original: yang dag ye shes nyin byed 'gro gsum dag tu dpal ldan chos kyi 'khor lor bzhugs //
analyzed: yang dag ye shes nyin byed 'gro gsum dag tu dpal ldan chos kyi 'khor lor bzhugs //
translated: The sun of perfect pristine consciousness, glorious Dharmacakra, abides in the three migrations.

original: bdud dang nyon mongs rab gtum rtag tu gsod mdzad dpal ldan sh'akya seng ge ste //
analyzed: bdud dang nyon mongs rab gtum rtag tu gsod mdzad dpal ldan sh'akya seng ge ste //
translated: The glorious lion of the Śākyas, who always kills the fierce demons and afflictions,

original: 'gro la de yi thugs rje dag dang shes rab kyis bskul bas ni 'grel bshad bri bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro la de yi thugs rje dag dang shes rab kyis bskul bas ni 'grel bshad bri bar bya // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is urged by his compassion and wisdom for migrating beings to write this commentary.

original: de ltar brjod par bya ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo'i mtshan nyid bshad par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar brjod par bya ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo'i mtshan nyid bshad par mdzad nas /
translated: Having explained the definition of Bhagavān Kālacakra, who is the nature of the subject matter,

original: brjod bya dang rjod byed thams cad bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo'i mtshan nyid yi ge re re'i don bshad par mdzad de /
analyzed: brjod bya dang rjod byed thams cad bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo'i mtshan nyid yi ge re re'i don bshad par mdzad de /
translated: he explains the meaning of each syllable of the definition of Bhagavān Kālacakra, all of which are the subject matter and the means of expression.

original: k'a yig gis ni rgyu zhi zhing //
analyzed: k'a yig gis ni rgyu zhi zhing //
translated: The syllable ka is the pacification of the cause.

original: la yig gis ni 'dir thim nges //
analyzed: la yig gis ni 'dir thim nges //
translated: The syllable la is the definite dissolution into this.

original: tsa yig gis ni g-yo ba'i sems //
analyzed: tsa yig gis ni g-yo ba'i sems //
translated: The syllable ca is the moving mind.

original: kra yig gis ni rim pas bcings //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kra yig gis ni rim pas bcings //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: The syllable kra is the binding in stages.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa phung po dang dbang po la sogs @104b pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa phung po dang dbang po la sogs @104b pa yin la /
translated: The so-called cause is the aggregates, the sense faculties, and so on, which are the cause of cyclic existence.

original: de rnams gang du med par gyur pa de zhi ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams gang du med par gyur pa de zhi ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which is devoid of those is called “peace.”

original: 'o na rnam pa thams cad du ye med par gyur tam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam pa thams cad du ye med par gyur tam zhe na /
translated: Well, is it completely nonexistent?

original: la yig gis ni 'dir thim nges zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: la yig gis ni 'dir thim nges zhes bya ba la /
translated: The syllable la indicates “dissolves here,”

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i 'brel pa dor nas nang du 'jug par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i 'brel pa dor nas nang du 'jug par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: that is, having abandoned the connection that is the nature of the apprehended and apprehender, it enters inside.

original: sems ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba myong zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba myong zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the mind experiences supreme unchanging bliss.

original: sems de lta bu yin zhe na /🔽tsa yig gis ni g-yo ba'i sems /
analyzed: sems de lta bu yin zhe na / tsa yig gis ni g-yo ba'i sems /
translated: What is that kind of mind?

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The syllable ca indicates “the moving mind.”

original: rlung gi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i mi brtan pa'i sems brtan par gyur nas /
analyzed: rlung gi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i mi brtan pa'i sems brtan par gyur nas /
translated: That is, having stabilized the unstable mind, which is of the nature of wind,

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dor nas /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dor nas /
translated: one abandons the suffering of cyclic existence

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and becomes the nature of supreme unchanging bliss.

original: ji ltar brtan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar brtan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does it become stable?

original: kra yig gis ni rim pas bcings //
analyzed: kra yig gis ni rim pas bcings //
translated: The letter kra binds in stages.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is

original: rim pa ji lta bas /
analyzed: rim pa ji lta bas /
translated: as follows:

original: lus kyi thig le dang ngag gi thig le dang sems kyi thig le dang / ye shes kyi thig le ni dpral ba dang / mgrin pa dang / snying ga dang / lte ba la bcings par gyur nas sems brtan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus kyi thig le dang ngag gi thig le dang sems kyi thig le dang / ye shes kyi thig le ni dpral ba dang / mgrin pa dang / snying ga dang / lte ba la bcings par gyur nas sems brtan par 'gyur te /
translated: The body bindu, the speech bindu, the mind bindu, and the gnosis bindu are bound at the forehead, throat, heart, and navel, respectively.

original: mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mind becomes stable, meaning it becomes immovable.

original: de bas na so sor sdud pa dang / bsam gtan dang / srog rtsol dang / 'dzin pas sems brtan por gyur na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na so sor sdud pa dang / bsam gtan dang / srog rtsol dang / 'dzin pas sems brtan por gyur na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when the mind becomes stable through the withdrawal, concentration, life-force control, and retention, it becomes the nature of supreme changelessness.

original: yang na rgyu zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: yang na rgyu zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: Alternatively, “cause” is

original: 'dod chags kyi bde ba la lta ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi bde ba la lta ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: the view of the bliss of desire and so on.

original: de gang la med par gyur pa de rgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: de gang la med par gyur pa de rgyu med pa'o //
translated: That which is free from that is “causeless.”

original: stong pa nyid kyi gzugs las skyes pa'i mi 'pho ba'i bde ba ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi gzugs las skyes pa'i mi 'pho ba'i bde ba ste /
translated: The bliss of nonemission arising from the form of emptiness is

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'o //
translated: the innate body.

original: thim pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid chos nyid dang lhan cig tu ro mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: thim pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid chos nyid dang lhan cig tu ro mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa ste /
translated: What is called “dissolution” is that very [awareness] becoming of one taste with dharmatā.🔽

original: chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'o //
translated: “Dissolution” is the very same [mind] becoming of one taste with reality, the dharmakāya.

original: g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni srog gi rlung yin la /
analyzed: g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni srog gi rlung yin la /
translated: “Motion” is the life-force wind.

original: de 'gags par 'gyur ba na brag ca bzhin du 'gyur ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de 'gags par 'gyur ba na brag ca bzhin du 'gyur ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: When that ceases, the enjoyment body arises, like an echo.

original: rim pa zhes bya ba ni lte ba la sogs pa'i gnas bzhi la rgyu mthun pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhis sems dag par gyur pa de sprul pa'i sku'o ;
analyzed: rim pa zhes bya ba ni lte ba la sogs pa'i gnas bzhi la rgyu mthun pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhis sems dag par gyur pa de sprul pa'i sku'o ;
translated: “Order” is the four results, the natural maṇḍala and so on, in the four places, the navel and so on. The mind that has become pure by those is the emanation body.

original: / de ltar sku bzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo bsgrub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: / de ltar sku bzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo bsgrub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus the Bhagavān Kālacakra is accomplished as the nature of the four bodies.

original: de ltar yi ge re re'i don bshad par mdzad nas //
analyzed: de ltar yi ge re re'i don bshad par mdzad nas //
translated: Having explained the meaning of each syllable in that way,

original: de nyid ye shes dang shes bya gcig tu gyur pas bshad par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid ye shes dang shes bya gcig tu gyur pas bshad par mdzad de /
translated: he explains it as the gnosis and the object of knowledge becoming one.

original: dus ni mi 'gyur ye shes bde //
analyzed: dus ni mi 'gyur ye shes bde //
translated: Time is unchanging bliss,

original: snying rje'i bdag nyid @105a * //
analyzed: snying rje'i bdag nyid @105a * //
translated: the nature of compassion,

original: thabs yin no //
analyzed: thabs yin no //
translated: and the method.

original: zhes bya ba ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i ye shes dang / dmigs pa med pa snying rje'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i thabs gang yin pa de dus zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i ye shes dang / dmigs pa med pa snying rje'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i thabs gang yin pa de dus zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The wisdom that has become the nature of supreme unchanging bliss and the means that has become the nature of non-objectifying compassion are what is called “time.”

original: 'o na 'khor lo gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'khor lo gang yin zhe na /
translated: Now, what is the wheel?

original: shes bya'i rnam pa 'gro 'khor lo //
analyzed: shes bya'i rnam pa 'gro 'khor lo //
translated: The wheel is the aspect of the knowable.

original: dpal ldan shes rab stong nyid bdag / ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: dpal ldan shes rab stong nyid bdag / ces bya ba ni /
translated: The glorious one, the nature of wisdom and emptiness,🔽is the wheel.

original: shes bya'i rang bzhin du gyur pa /
analyzed: shes bya'i rang bzhin du gyur pa /
translated: The wisdom that has become the nature of the knowable,

original: khams gsum po stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i shes rab gang yin pa 'khor lo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum po stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i shes rab gang yin pa 'khor lo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the emptiness that is the nature of the three realms, is what is called “wheel.”

original: de ltar ye shes dang / shes bya dang / snying rje dang / stong pa nyid dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa don dam par bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar ye shes dang / shes bya dang / snying rje dang / stong pa nyid dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa don dam par bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, the ultimate Bhagavān Kālacakra is the nature of wisdom, the knowable, compassion, emptiness, means, and wisdom.

original: gzhan yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is he like?

original: dpal ldan dus kyi 'khor lo 'di //
analyzed: dpal ldan dus kyi 'khor lo 'di //
translated: This glorious Kālacakra

original: kun nas rdo rje'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: kun nas rdo rje'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: is the vajra yoga in all aspects.

original: bden pa gnyis la gnas pa 'di //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis la gnas pa 'di //
translated: This one who abides in the two truths

original: mngon par brjod pa rjod byed 'gyur //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa rjod byed 'gyur //
translated: will be the speaker of the expression.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas /
translated: This is the stage of expression.

original: bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo rdo rje rnal 'byor kun rdzob kyi bden pa la gnas pa brjod bya'i rang bzhin du gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo rdo rje rnal 'byor kun rdzob kyi bden pa la gnas pa brjod bya'i rang bzhin du gyur pa yin la /
translated: The Bhagavān Kālacakra Vajrayoga, abiding in the conventional truth, is the nature of the expressed.

original: le'u lnga pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po ni brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: le'u lnga pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po ni brjod par bya'o //
translated: The king of tantras, which is of the nature of the five chapters, is the expression.

original: rgyud 'di la 'grel bshad gang gis mdzad ce na /
analyzed: rgyud 'di la 'grel bshad gang gis mdzad ce na /
translated: By whom was this tantra commented upon?

original: bshad par mdzad de /🔽bdag gis rgyud 'di'i 'grel pa ni //
analyzed: bshad par mdzad de / bdag gis rgyud 'di'i 'grel pa ni //
translated: It is said:🔽I, the one who was prophesied by that Sugata🔽and urged by Mañjuśrī,

original: bde gshegs des lung bstan nas dang // 'jam dpal gyis ni bskul nyid pas //
analyzed: bde gshegs des lung bstan nas dang // 'jam dpal gyis ni bskul nyid pas //
translated: will write this [tantra]

original: 'jig rten mgon pos bri bar bya //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon pos bri bar bya //
translated: by the Lord of the World.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa dang / 'jam dpal gyis bskul ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa dang / 'jam dpal gyis bskul ba ni /
translated: This is the king of condensed tantras, which was prophesied by the Tathāgata and urged by Mañjuśrī.

original: bdag byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten mgon pos 'grel bshad bri bar bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten mgon pos 'grel bshad bri bar bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: I, the Bodhisattva Lokanātha, will write the commentary.

original: 'grel bshad de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'grel bshad de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is that commentary like?

original: byis dang mkhas pa rmongs rnams la //
analyzed: byis dang mkhas pa rmongs rnams la //
translated: For the confused childish and learned,

original: rgyud kyi gsang ba gsal bar byed //
analyzed: rgyud kyi gsang ba gsal bar byed //
translated: it illuminates the secret of the tantra.

original: bu la ma yis phan byed ltar //
analyzed: bu la ma yis phan byed ltar //
translated: Like a mother helping her child,

original: lus can rnams la bde ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lus can rnams la bde ba'i phyir //
translated: for the happiness of embodied beings,

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: this is said.

original: byis pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams la rgyud kyi gsang ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byis pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams la rgyud kyi gsang ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For sentient beings such as the childish, the so-called secret of the tantra

original: rdo rje tshig ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje tshig ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: is the vajra words and so on.

original: de gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: That is what is illuminated.

original: gzhan yang bu rnams la mas phan thogs par byed pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad sdug bsngal sel ba'i phyir dang / thun mong bde ba thob pa'i phyir 'brel pa bri bar bya zhes bya ba ste 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bu rnams la mas phan thogs par byed pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad sdug bsngal sel ba'i phyir dang / thun mong bde ba thob pa'i phyir 'brel pa bri bar bya zhes bya ba ste 'brel pa'o //
translated: Moreover, just as a mother helps her children, in the same way, in order to remove the suffering of all sentient beings and in order to attain common happiness, the connection is written.

original: de bas @105b na sa bcu'i dbang phyug byang chub sems dpa'/
analyzed: de bas @105b na sa bcu'i dbang phyug byang chub sems dpa'/
translated: Therefore, the Bodhisattva, the Lord of the Ten Stages,

original: 'jig rten mgon pos sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir mdzad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon pos sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir mdzad pa yin gyi /
translated: The Lord of the World has done this in order to benefit sentient beings.

original: nyid kyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyid kyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not for the sake of accomplishing his own aim.

original: 'o na 'jig rten gyi bde ba ster na /
analyzed: 'o na 'jig rten gyi bde ba ster na /
translated: Well then, if he bestows mundane bliss,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba mi ster ram zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba mi ster ram zhe na /
translated: does he not bestow supramundane bliss?

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dam pa'i lam ;
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dam pa'i lam ;
translated: The path of the holy Vajrasattva

original: / rnal 'byor pa rnams gang gis rig / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: / rnal 'byor pa rnams gang gis rig / ces bya ba la /
translated: is known by the yogis.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i dam pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i dam pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The path of the holy Vajrasattva is

original: du ba la sogs pa'i rtags dang ldan par gyur ba sbyor ba'i yan lag drug ste /
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa'i rtags dang ldan par gyur ba sbyor ba'i yan lag drug ste /
translated: the six-branched yoga endowed with the signs of smoke, etc.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i lam de 'grel bshad gang gis shes par byed pa de bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i lam de 'grel bshad gang gis shes par byed pa de bri bar bya'o //
translated: That path which has the nature of the supreme unchanging is to be written by the yogis.

original: 'grel bshad gyi  mtshan ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'grel bshad gyi  mtshan ci yin zhe na /
translated: By what commentary is it to be known?

original: 'grel bshad dri ma med pa'i 'od //
analyzed: 'grel bshad dri ma med pa'i 'od //
translated: The commentary is the Stainless Light.

original: de bas de ni myur du bri //
analyzed: de bas de ni myur du bri //
translated: Therefore, it should be written quickly.🔽This is

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: what is said.

original: dri ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dri ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word “stain” refers to

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bags chags te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bags chags te /
translated: The stains of desire and so forth are removed.

original: de gang gis med par byed pa dang / sems de nyid 'od gsal bar byed pas na /
analyzed: de gang gis med par byed pa dang / sems de nyid 'od gsal bar byed pas na /
translated: Since it removes those and illuminates that very mind,

original: dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba ste /
translated: it is called the Stainless Light.

original: de nyid myur du bri bar bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid myur du bri bar bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it should be written quickly.

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud las rjes su 'brangs pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba las /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud las rjes su 'brangs pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba las /
translated: In the Stainless Light, a commentary on the root tantra of the glorious Wheel of Time, the king of condensed tantras, in twelve thousand [verses],🔽the explanation of the great summary of the definitive meaning of the supreme deity Yam

original: bdud dang bgegs thams cad nyams par byed pa dang / mchog tu 'dod pa'i lha dang / yam gyi nges pa'i mdor bsdus chen po'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: bdud dang bgegs thams cad nyams par byed pa dang / mchog tu 'dod pa'i lha dang / yam gyi nges pa'i mdor bsdus chen po'i bshad pa'o /
translated: It is the destroyer of all demons and obstacles, the supreme desired deity, and the great summary of the definitive meaning of the Yamari Tantra.🔽

original: // / de la dang po re zhig bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pas brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa la sogs pa gzigs nas /
analyzed: // / de la dang po re zhig bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pas brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa la sogs pa gzigs nas /
translated: In that [commentary], first, the all-knowing Bhagavān, having seen the expressible, the expression, and so forth,

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po bka' stsal pa yin gyi ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po bka' stsal pa yin gyi ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin no //
translated: spoke the king of tantras, but not exactly as they are.

original: de la thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo ni brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de la thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo ni brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: The Bhagavān Kālacakara, who is of the nature of method and wisdom, is what is to be expressed.

original: le'u lnga pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa yi ge'i tshogs rgyud kyi rgyal po ni rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: le'u lnga pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa yi ge'i tshogs rgyud kyi rgyal po ni rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: The collection of syllables, which is of the nature of the fifth chapter, is the king of tantras that expresses.

original: 'di dag gi 'brel pa ni brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di dag gi 'brel pa ni brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The relationship between these two is the definition of what is to be expressed and that which expresses.

original: dgos pa ni bsod nams kyi stobs dang rnam par rtog pa'i bsgom pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten gyi dngos grub bsgrub pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'o //🔽dgos pa'i dgos pa ni sbyor ba'i yan lag drug gis sa bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug nyid phyag rgya @106a * //
analyzed: dgos pa ni bsod nams kyi stobs dang rnam par rtog pa'i bsgom pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten gyi dngos grub bsgrub pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'o // dgos pa'i dgos pa ni sbyor ba'i yan lag drug gis sa bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug nyid phyag rgya @106a * //
translated: The purpose is to accomplish mundane powers and to benefit sentient beings through the power of merit and the power of the meditation of concepts.

original: chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The secondary purpose is to accomplish the state of lordship over the twelve stages and the attainment of mahāmudrā through the six-branched yoga.

original: don 'di dag la sogs ba la gzigs nas 'jig rten gyi khams kyi le'u dang / nang gi le'u dang / mngon par dbang bskur ba'i le'u dang / bsgrub pa'i le'u dang / ye shes kyi le'u dang / lnga'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo ni 'jig rten gyi dngos grub dang /
analyzed: don 'di dag la sogs ba la gzigs nas 'jig rten gyi khams kyi le'u dang / nang gi le'u dang / mngon par dbang bskur ba'i le'u dang / bsgrub pa'i le'u dang / ye shes kyi le'u dang / lnga'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo ni 'jig rten gyi dngos grub dang /
translated: Having seen these and other points, the Bhagavat Kalachakra, the king of tantras, which has the nature of five chapters, namely, the chapter on the world systems, the inner chapter, the chapter on the actual empowerment, the chapter on the practice and the chapter on wisdom, was taught in order to bestow the mundane and supramundane siddhis upon the fortunate.🔽

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having seen these and other topics, the Bhagavān Kālacakra, the king of tantras, which has the nature of five chapters—the chapter on the world systems, the inner chapter, the chapter on the actual consecration, the chapter on the practice, and the chapter on gnosis—was spoken for the sake of attaining mundane and supramundane siddhis

original: mi la sogs pa'i sems can thams cad la bka' stsal to //
analyzed: mi la sogs pa'i sems can thams cad la bka' stsal to //
translated: to all sentient beings, such as humans.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi le'u la sogs pa'i rim pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po bka' stsal pa de dgongs pa gang yin zhen brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi le'u la sogs pa'i rim pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po bka' stsal pa de dgongs pa gang yin zhen brjod par bya ste /
translated: What is the intention of the Bhagavān’s speaking the king of tantras of the tathāgatas in the order of the chapter on the world systems and so on?

original: sa chu me rlung la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni skye ba'i rten dang / 'chi ba'i rten yin la /
analyzed: sa chu me rlung la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni skye ba'i rten dang / 'chi ba'i rten yin la /
translated: The world, which is of the nature of the subtle particles of earth, water, fire, wind, etc., is the basis of birth and the basis of death.

original: brten pa ni sems can rnams so //
analyzed: brten pa ni sems can rnams so //
translated: The beings are what is based on that.

original: sems can rnams phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub la snod du rung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can rnams phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub la snod du rung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make beings suitable vessels for the attainment of the Great Seal,

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang bskur ba dgos pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang bskur ba dgos pa'o //
translated: it is necessary to confer the mundane and supramundane initiations.

original: dbang bskur nas 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i phyir bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur nas 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i phyir bsgrub pa'o //
translated: After the initiations, there is the practice in order to accomplish mundane attainments.

original: 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyis skye ba dang 'chi ba zad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyis skye ba dang 'chi ba zad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Mundane attainments do not bring an end to birth and death.

original: de bas skye ba dang 'chi bral bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas skye ba dang 'chi bral bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to be free from birth and death,🔽the attainment of the Great Seal

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ni /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ni /
translated: is the ultimate goal.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyis sgrub par byed ces bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pas thugs la dgongs nas dang po sa chu me rlung la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab kyi tshogs kyi rang bzhin du gyur ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi le'u bstan te /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyis sgrub par byed ces bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pas thugs la dgongs nas dang po sa chu me rlung la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab kyi tshogs kyi rang bzhin du gyur ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi le'u bstan te /
translated: The accomplishment by nondual wisdom is as follows: The Tathagata, having contemplated in his mind, first taught the chapter on the world realm, which has the nature of an aggregation of subtle particles of earth, water, fire, wind, and so forth.

original: de nas sems can gyi skye ba dang / 'gag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nang gi le'u bstan to //
analyzed: de nas sems can gyi skye ba dang / 'gag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nang gi le'u bstan to //
translated: Then, he taught the chapter on the inner, which has the nature of the arising, ceasing, and so forth of sentient beings.

original: de nas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mngon par dbang bskur ba'i rang bzhin du gyur ba'i dbang gi le'u'o //
analyzed: de nas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mngon par dbang bskur ba'i rang bzhin du gyur ba'i dbang gi le'u'o //
translated: Then, the chapter on empowerment, which has the nature of the mundane and supramundane empowerments.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa spros pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bsgrub pa'i le'u'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa spros pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bsgrub pa'i le'u'o //
translated: Then, the chapter on accomplishment, which has the nature of the emanation of the maṇḍala wheel, and so forth.

original: de nas dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid dang / dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes bsgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: de nas dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid dang / dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes bsgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: Then, the accomplishment of nondual wisdom, which has the nature of empty compassion with and without reference point.

original: ye shes kyi le'u bka' stsal to //
analyzed: ye shes kyi le'u bka' stsal to //
translated: The chapter on pristine awareness is taught.

original: de la dang @106b por 'jig rten gyi khams kyi le'u las don ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de la dang @106b por 'jig rten gyi khams kyi le'u las don ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What is taught in the chapter on the world systems?

original: tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i kun mkhyen zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i mthar ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i kun mkhyen zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i mthar ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The first verse, beginning with the omniscient one and ending with the Buddha, teaches the perfection of the teacher.

original: seng ge'i khrir bzhugs zhes bya bas gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: seng ge'i khrir bzhugs zhes bya bas gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase seated on a lion throne teaches the perfection of the place.

original: lha'i gtso bos phyag byas pas 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //🔽spyis btud de zhes bya ba nas /🔽rgyal po zla bzangs lag pa'i padma sbyar ba yan lag mchog gi steng bzhag nas //
analyzed: lha'i gtso bos phyag byas pas 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan to // spyis btud de zhes bya ba nas / rgyal po zla bzangs lag pa'i padma sbyar ba yan lag mchog gi steng bzhag nas //
translated: The phrase worshipped by the chief of the gods teaches the perfection of the retinue.🔽The phrase having bowed to the feet of the teacher teaches the perfection of the author.

original: zhes bya bas zhu ba po phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas zhu ba po phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase having placed the lotus of his hand on the supreme limb of the king Sucandra teaches the perfection of the questioner.

original: dpal ldan dus 'khor rnal 'byor rtsod ldan dus su zhes bya bas chos phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan dus 'khor rnal 'byor rtsod ldan dus su zhes bya bas chos phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase the glorious Kālacakra yoga teaches the perfection of the Dharma.

original: mi rnams dgrol ba'i don du'o zhes bya bas dgongs pa'i dgos pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: mi rnams dgrol ba'i don du'o zhes bya bas dgongs pa'i dgos pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The purpose of the intention is taught by for the sake of liberating people.

original: gsol ba btab pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa las /
analyzed: gsol ba btab pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa las /
translated: In the second verse of supplication,

original: stong dang ye shes rdo rje thig le mchog 'dzin zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: stong dang ye shes rdo rje thig le mchog 'dzin zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: beginning with the supreme drop of the vajra of emptiness and wisdom,🔽up to the end, please explain, the five syllables of great emptiness, the six syllables of the empty drop, the clan, the clan member, the nature, the person, and the body are taught.

original: bshad du gsol zhes bya ba'i mthar stong pa chen po'i yi ge lnga dang / thig le stong pa yi ge drug dang / rigs dang / rigs can dang / rang bzhin dang / skyes bu dang / lus la sna tshogs kyi tshad dang / phyi rol du srid pa gsum gyi dbyibs dang /
analyzed: bshad du gsol zhes bya ba'i mthar stong pa chen po'i yi ge lnga dang / thig le stong pa yi ge drug dang / rigs dang / rigs can dang / rang bzhin dang / skyes bu dang / lus la sna tshogs kyi tshad dang / phyi rol du srid pa gsum gyi dbyibs dang /
translated: The measure of the variety, the shape of the three worlds outside,

original: lha rnams kyi longs spyod pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang / dbang bstan ba'i phyir gsol ba btab po //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi longs spyod pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang / dbang bstan ba'i phyir gsol ba btab po //
translated: and the enjoyment of the gods are supplicated to be taught for the sake of the mandala and the empowerment.

original: de nas zla bzangs khyod la bdag dga' zhes bya ba rnams brtsams nas /
analyzed: de nas zla bzangs khyod la bdag dga' zhes bya ba rnams brtsams nas /
translated: Then, beginning with O you who are good and beautiful, I delight in you,

original: dbang dang dkyil 'khor nyan bar gyis zhes bya ba'i mthar de bzhin gshegs pa'i lan bstan to //
analyzed: dbang dang dkyil 'khor nyan bar gyis zhes bya ba'i mthar de bzhin gshegs pa'i lan bstan to //
translated: The reply of the Tathagata is taught at the end of the statement, Listen to the empowerment and the mandala!

original: de nas dus la zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: de nas dus la zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Then, beginning with at the time,

original: rgya mtsho dang zhes bya ba'i mthar 'jig rten gyi khams bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho dang zhes bya ba'i mthar 'jig rten gyi khams bsdus pa'o //
translated: up to the end of ocean, the world systems are summarized.

original: rgyu skar zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas sgo nga'i dbus zhes bya ba'i mthar rgyu skar dang / nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa dang / bkra shis la sogs pa'i gza' rnams dang / drang srong dang / 'byung po dang / klu dang rnam pa bzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyi skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: rgyu skar zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas sgo nga'i dbus zhes bya ba'i mthar rgyu skar dang / nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa dang / bkra shis la sogs pa'i gza' rnams dang / drang srong dang / 'byung po dang / klu dang rnam pa bzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyi skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: Beginning with the lunar mansions, up to the end of in the middle of the egg, the characteristics of the birth of sentient beings who are of the nature of the four types, such as the lunar mansions, the sun, the moon, and so on, the planets such as Bṛhaspati, the sages, the bhūtas, and the nāgas,

original: lus zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas kun rtog bral zhes bya ba'i mthar rnam pa bcu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rdo rje'i sku dang / lus g-yon zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas kun rtog bral zhes bya ba'i mthar rnam pa bcu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rdo rje'i sku dang / lus g-yon zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: and beginning with the body, up to the end of free from imagination, the vajrakāya, which is of the nature of the ten types, and beginning with the left body, up to the end of the right body, the gnosis of the four joys is taught.

original: dngos po kun gyis grol zhes bya ba'i mthar sgra gcan la sogs pa dang / srog gi rlung @107a * //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyis grol zhes bya ba'i mthar sgra gcan la sogs pa dang / srog gi rlung @107a * //
translated: The term liberated by all things refers to Rāhu and so on, and the generation of the life-force wind and so on.

original: la sogs pa bskyed pa dang / aa sogs zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: la sogs pa bskyed pa dang / aa sogs zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning with the vowels and so on,

original: khams gsum skyes 'gyur rgyal po kye /🔽zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: khams gsum skyes 'gyur rgyal po kye / zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: it says, the king born in the three realms, O!

original: zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang sngags sna tshogs pa dang / skye ba'i gnas zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽phung po khams te lhag pa'i lha zhes bya ba'i mthar dbyangs rnams kyi skye ba'i gnas dang / bsgom pa'i gnas dang / rlung nas lhun po'i mthar zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang sngags sna tshogs pa dang / skye ba'i gnas zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas / phung po khams te lhag pa'i lha zhes bya ba'i mthar dbyangs rnams kyi skye ba'i gnas dang / bsgom pa'i gnas dang / rlung nas lhun po'i mthar zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning with the abode of birth, it says, the moon and sun, increase and decrease, various mantras, and the abode of birth,🔽 and it concludes with the aggregates, elements, and the excellent deity.🔽 Beginning with from wind to Meru,

original: yon tan bral zhing de nyid dman zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: yon tan bral zhing de nyid dman zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: it says, the abode of the birth of the vowels, the abode of meditation, and the abode of the birth of the consonants, and it concludes with devoid of qualities and inferior reality.

original: 'jig rten gyi mtho ba'i tshad dang / rlung dang rlung gi mthar zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mtho ba'i tshad dang / rlung dang rlung gi mthar zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning with the height of the world, it says, the wind and the end of the wind, and it concludes with the end of the world and the end of the wind.🔽

original: dus kyi sbyor ba nas skyes zhes bya ba'i mthar zheng gi tshad dang / zheng gi tshad ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: dus kyi sbyor ba nas skyes zhes bya ba'i mthar zheng gi tshad dang / zheng gi tshad ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: From arisen from the conjunction of time up to the measure of width, and from the measure of width up to the measure of breadth,

original: rang rang gi tshad kye khru gang yang dag go zhes bya ba'i mthar rgya'i tshad dang / phra rab tshad ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: rang rang gi tshad kye khru gang yang dag go zhes bya ba'i mthar rgya'i tshad dang / phra rab tshad ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: the measure of breadth is one cubit. From the measure of the atom up to the measure of the yojana,

original: de yi dpag tshad tshad yin no zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: de yi dpag tshad tshad yin no zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: the measure of the yojana is the measure of the atom.

original: rdul phra rab la sogs pa'i tshad kyis khru la sogs pa'i tshad dang / dang po de ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: rdul phra rab la sogs pa'i tshad kyis khru la sogs pa'i tshad dang / dang po de ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: From the measure of the cubit up to the measure of the atom, and from the first one up to

original: a'a dang k'a sogs dbye bas so //🔽zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: a'a dang k'a sogs dbye bas so // zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: the division of a and ka, etc.,

original: srid pa sum cu rtsa gcig gi mtshan nyid dang / rin chen 'od nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: srid pa sum cu rtsa gcig gi mtshan nyid dang / rin chen 'od nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: from the characteristics of the thirty-one existences up to the jewel light,

original: bdun pa las kyi mthar zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: bdun pa las kyi mthar zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: and from the seventh action up to the end,

original: klu'i gnas la sogs pa'i ming dang / shar du rlung ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: klu'i gnas la sogs pa'i ming dang / shar du rlung ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: the names of the naga abodes, etc., and from the wind in the east up to

original: tha ma'i tshad yin no zhes bya ba'i mthar gling bzhi la sogs pa'i dbyibs dang tshad dang / tshangs pa'i yul sar zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽me dang rlung mthar ni zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i gnas la sogs pa dang / shar nas brgya byin zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: tha ma'i tshad yin no zhes bya ba'i mthar gling bzhi la sogs pa'i dbyibs dang tshad dang / tshangs pa'i yul sar zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas / me dang rlung mthar ni zhes bya ba'i mthar / bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i gnas la sogs pa dang / shar nas brgya byin zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The measure of the end is the measure of the end of the four continents and so on, beginning with the shape and measure of the realm of Brahma and ending with the end of fire and wind.

original: gzhom du med pa'i rdo rje'i sku zhes bya ba'i mthar phyogs skyong ba rnams kyi gnas dang / lhun po'i rgyab ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: gzhom du med pa'i rdo rje'i sku zhes bya ba'i mthar phyogs skyong ba rnams kyi gnas dang / lhun po'i rgyab ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning with the abode of the Bhagavat Kalachakra and ending with the abode of the direction protectors, the abode of the direction protectors is described, beginning with the abode of Indra in the east and ending with the indestructible vajra body.

original: mi rnams kyi ni lo brgya gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i mthar bcom ldan 'das kyis dum bu bcu gnyis la bskor ba dang / dus rdzogs ldan la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid lo'i grangs dang / phra mo dbugs 'byung /🔽zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi ni lo brgya gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i mthar bcom ldan 'das kyis dum bu bcu gnyis la bskor ba dang / dus rdzogs ldan la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid lo'i grangs dang / phra mo dbugs 'byung /🔽zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning with the back of Meru and ending with the measure of the human lifespan, the Bhagavat's turning of the wheel in the twelve sectors and the characteristics of the eons of completeness and so on are described in terms of years, beginning with the subtle breath and ending with the measure of the human lifespan.🔽Beginning with the measure of the human lifespan and ending with the measure of the lifespan of the gods of the Abhasvara realm, the measure of the lifespan of the gods of the Abhasvara realm is described in terms of years, beginning with the subtle breath and ending with the measure of the lifespan of the gods of the Abhasvara realm.

original: nyin mtshan gcig la nyi ma bcu gnyis zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: nyin mtshan gcig la nyi ma bcu gnyis zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: In one day and night, there are twelve suns.

original: srin bu la sogs pa la rang @107b rang gi tshe'i tshad dang / phyogs zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: srin bu la sogs pa la rang @107b rang gi tshe'i tshad dang / phyogs zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning with insects and so on, up to their own lifespan, and in the directions,

original: lus kyi dbus su de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: lus kyi dbus su de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: up to in the middle of the body,

original: phyi dang nang du dus kyi dbye ba dang / lo 'di nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: phyi dang nang du dus kyi dbye ba dang / lo 'di nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: beginning with the division of time externally and internally, up to from this year,

original: dus kyi dbang gis 'gyur zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: dus kyi dbang gis 'gyur zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: up to through the power of time,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyi sprul pa'i sku bzhengs pa dang / kla klo'i chos dar ba dang / skar rtsis nyams pa la sogs pa dang / me dang rgya mtsho zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyi sprul pa'i sku bzhengs pa dang / kla klo'i chos dar ba dang / skar rtsis nyams pa la sogs pa dang / me dang rgya mtsho zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /

translated: The refutation of the Charvaka texts is begun in the lines: The self is not the aggregates, nor is it different from them, and continues up to the lines:🔽The self is not the support of the aggregates, nor is it the supported.🔽 The refutation of the Samkhya texts is begun in the lines: The self is not the aggregates, nor is it different from them, and continues up to the lines:🔽The self is not the support of the aggregates, nor is it the supported.🔽 The refutation of the Vedanta texts is begun in the lines: The self is not the aggregates, nor is it different from them, and continues up to the lines:🔽The self is not the support of the aggregates, nor is it the supported.

original: 'bring po'i rgyu ru'o zhes bya ba'i mthar /

translated: the one who is

analyzed: snod du rung ba'i slob ma dang / dpyid zla 'bring po'i dkar po'i nya la zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /

analyzed: rgyud rgyal bstan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the teaching of the king of tantras will not occur.

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: At the end,

analyzed: dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i nges pa dang / dbang gi don du sa yongs bsnyams pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: the certainty of the empowerment, and so on, the preparation of the ground for the sake of empowerment, and so on,

original: dkyil 'khor bzhengs pa dang zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bzhengs pa dang zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: the construction of the maṇḍala, and so on,

original: slob dpon rnams kyi spyi'i nges pa dang / sa'i rigs bzhi zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: slob dpon rnams kyi spyi'i nges pa dang / sa'i rigs bzhi zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: the general certainty of the masters, the four types of ground, and so on,

original: rgyal rigs bram ze gzhan zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: rgyal rigs bram ze gzhan zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: the kṣatriyas, the brahmins, and others, and so on,

original: sa'i rigs la sogs pa dang / dkar po zhi dang rgyas pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: sa'i rigs la sogs pa dang / dkar po zhi dang rgyas pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: the types of ground, and so on, the white, the pacifying, and the enriching, and so on,

original: rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya /
translated: the yogin should know.

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar sa yongs su brtag pa dang / dbang ldan byang du zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar sa yongs su brtag pa dang / dbang ldan byang du zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: At the end, the examination of the ground, in the northeast, and so on,

original: rang dang rmongs pa'o zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: rang dang rmongs pa'o zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: one's own and deluded, and so on,

original: phyogs kyi nges pa dang / thab khung grong gi phyogs brgyad ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽rdo rje yang ni thams cad la /
analyzed: phyogs kyi nges pa dang / thab khung grong gi phyogs brgyad ces bya ba nas brtsams nas / rdo rje yang ni thams cad la /
translated: The certainty of direction is from “The hearth is in the eight directions of the village”

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: up to “The vajra is in all.”

original: thab khung gi cho ga dang / phur bu'i bya ba brgyad de zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽tsu ta byil ba nyi mar skyes /
analyzed: thab khung gi cho ga dang / phur bu'i bya ba brgyad de zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas / tsu ta byil ba nyi mar skyes /
translated: The rite of the hearth is from “The eight activities of the dagger”

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: up to “Cūḍa is born in the sun.”

original: phur bu rnams dang / de ltar shel gyi bum pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽zhi dang rgyas pa gzhan la min /
analyzed: phur bu rnams dang / de ltar shel gyi bum pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas / zhi dang rgyas pa gzhan la min /
translated: The daggers are from “Thus, the crystal vase”

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽bum pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / snga dro nas ni thun tshod brgyad //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar / bum pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / snga dro nas ni thun tshod brgyad //
translated: up to “Pacification and increase are not for others.”

original: ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽las brgyad rnams ni rab tu bya //
analyzed: ces bya ba nas brtsams nas / las brgyad rnams ni rab tu bya //
translated: The characteristics of the vases are from “In the morning, up to the eighth period”

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: up to “The eight activities are to be performed.”

original: dus kyi @115b nges pa dang / nyin phyed mtshan mo phyed ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: dus kyi @115b nges pa dang / nyin phyed mtshan mo phyed ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The certainty of time is from “At noon, at midnight”

original: de bzhin du rab tu grags zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: de bzhin du rab tu grags zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: up to “Thus, it is well known.”

original: dus drag po la sogs ba 'gags pa dang / 'o ma can dang bcas /
analyzed: dus drag po la sogs ba 'gags pa dang / 'o ma can dang bcas /
translated: The time for wrathful and so forth is blocked, and it is with milk.

original: zhi dang rgyas la sogs zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: zhi dang rgyas la sogs zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning with “pacifying, increasing, and so forth,”

original: rengs pa dang rmongs par byed pa la zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: rengs pa dang rmongs par byed pa la zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: up to “paralyzing and confusing,”

original: yam shing nges pa dang / 'o ma mar dang khrag ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: yam shing nges pa dang / 'o ma mar dang khrag ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: the definite articles for the firewood, “milk, butter, and blood,” and so forth,

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽sreg rdzas kyi nges ba dang / gshin rje'i bden bral mtshams zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i mthar / sreg rdzas kyi nges ba dang / gshin rje'i bden bral mtshams zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: up to “pacifying and so forth,”🔽are the definite articles for the burnt offerings.

original: zhi sogs las la'o zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽sbyin sreg gi dus su gdan gyi nges pa dang / las gnyis las ni tshon zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: zhi sogs las la'o zhes bya ba'i mthar / sbyin sreg gi dus su gdan gyi nges pa dang / las gnyis las ni tshon zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning with “the south, the southwest, and the west,” up to “the actions of pacifying and so forth,”🔽are the definite articles for the seats at the time of the burnt offering.

original: phyogs su tshon dgyer 'gyur zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽rdul tshon dgye ba'i nges pa dang / dgod sogs zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: phyogs su tshon dgyer 'gyur zhes bya ba'i mthar / rdul tshon dgye ba'i nges pa dang / dgod sogs zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning with “the two actions, the colors,” up to “the colors are applied in the directions,”🔽are the definite articles for applying the colored powders.

original: lha rnams la zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: lha rnams la zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: Beginning with “the arrangement and so forth,” up to “the deities,”

original: slob dpon la zhes bya ba'i nges pa dang / shel sogs zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: slob dpon la zhes bya ba'i nges pa dang / shel sogs zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The certainty of the master, beginning with “crystal” and so on,🔽

original: sor ni bcu gnyis so zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽mchod yon gyi snod kyi nges pa dang / rnam lnga rgyal dbang zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: sor ni bcu gnyis so zhes bya ba'i mthar / mchod yon gyi snod kyi nges pa dang / rnam lnga rgyal dbang zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The certainty of the master, beginning with crystal up to twelve fingerbreadths.

original: sbyin sreg don no zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽dgang gzar dang blugs gzar gyi nges pa dang ; zhi ba dang khro bos zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: sbyin sreg don no zhes bya ba'i mthar / dgang gzar dang blugs gzar gyi nges pa dang ; zhi ba dang khro bos zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The certainty of the vessel for the drinking water, beginning with the five victors up to the purpose of the burnt offering.

original: dkyil 'khor du ni lhag pa'i lha //🔽zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽lha rnams kyi ni nges pa dang / rnam lnga rgyal dbang zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du ni lhag pa'i lha // zhes bya ba'i mthar / lha rnams kyi ni nges pa dang / rnam lnga rgyal dbang zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The certainty of the ladle and the spoon, beginning with peaceful and wrathful up to the supreme deity in the maṇḍala.

original: rnam pa lnga ru gyur ba nyid //🔽ces bya ba'i mthar /🔽rdul tshon gyi rnam par dag pa dang / thib skud khru brgyad ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ru gyur ba nyid // ces bya ba'i mthar / rdul tshon gyi rnam par dag pa dang / thib skud khru brgyad ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The certainty of the deities, beginning with the five victors up to the five colors.

original: thig skud gcig ste gzhan ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: thig skud gcig ste gzhan ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: The purity of the colored powders, beginning with the thread of eight cubits up to the single thread, not another.🔽The certainty of the maṇḍala, beginning with the maṇḍala of the body up to the maṇḍala of the mind.

original: thig skud kyi mtshan nyid dang / skyil mo krung ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: thig skud kyi mtshan nyid dang / skyil mo krung ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: beginning with “the cross-legged posture,”

original: las dbye bas gnas la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: las dbye bas gnas la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: up to “the divisions of the ritual action, the site, and so forth,”🔽are the ascertainment of the sitting posture.

original: 'dug stangs kyi nges pa dang / shel dang mu tig ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽sngags bzlas pa yi phreng ba yis /
analyzed: 'dug stangs kyi nges pa dang / shel dang mu tig ces bya ba nas brtsams nas / sngags bzlas pa yi phreng ba yis /
translated: Beginning with “crystal and pearl,”

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: up to “the rosary for the recitation of the mantra,”🔽are the ascertainment of the rosary.

original: phreng ba'i nges pa dang / dri zhim me tog dkar zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: phreng ba'i nges pa dang / dri zhim me tog dkar zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning with “fragrant white flowers,”

original: bska ba drag po'i spos zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: bska ba drag po'i spos zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: up to “bitter pungent incense,”🔽are the ascertainment of the offerings.

original: mchod pa'i nges pa dang / dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba nas brtsams @116a * //
analyzed: mchod pa'i nges pa dang / dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba nas brtsams @116a * //
translated: Beginning with “the maṇḍala,”

original: nas ; lus la rim pas so zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: nas ; lus la rim pas so zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: up to “the body is drawn in stages,”🔽are the ritual of drawing the maṇḍala.

original: 'khrul 'khor bri ba'i cho ga dang / dpal gyi rdo rje zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor bri ba'i cho ga dang / dpal gyi rdo rje zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning with “śrīvajra,”

original: rnal 'byor pas ni bsgom par bya //🔽zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ni bsgom par bya //🔽zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: up to “the yogin should meditate,”🔽are the ascertainment of the maṇḍala.

original: bsrung ba'i cho ga dang sa'i phyogs su rdo rje gsum gyis zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: bsrung ba'i cho ga dang sa'i phyogs su rdo rje gsum gyis zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The rite of protection, the rite of the ground, beginning with “with the three vajras” up to

original: bsrung ba'i don du dgod par bya //
analyzed: bsrung ba'i don du dgod par bya //
translated: “for the sake of protection, one should set out.”

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar zhing skyong ba la sogs pa'i cha ba gtor gyi cho ga dang / sa spyan 'dren pa la sogs pa'i cho ga dang / zug rdu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar zhing skyong ba la sogs pa'i cha ba gtor gyi cho ga dang / sa spyan 'dren pa la sogs pa'i cho ga dang / zug rdu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas brtsams nas /
translated: The rite of the field guardians, etc., the rite of inviting the ground, etc., the rite of the stake, etc., beginning with “stake” up to

original: mchod spyin don du'o zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: mchod spyin don du'o zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: “for the sake of the sacrificial offering.”

original: spyod pa dang sbyangs zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: spyod pa dang sbyangs zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The rite of the purification of the ground, etc., beginning with “purification” up to

original: de rnams ma lus so zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: de rnams ma lus so zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: “all of them.”

original: sa gzung ba la sogs pa dus kyi nges pa dang / bsrung bar bya zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: sa gzung ba la sogs pa dus kyi nges pa dang / bsrung bar bya zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The rite of the determination of the time of taking the ground, etc., beginning with “protection” up to

original: bri bar bya zhes pa'i mthar /
analyzed: bri bar bya zhes pa'i mthar /
translated: “one should draw.”

original: slob ma la bsrung ba'i nges pa dang / dag ba'i gnas zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: slob ma la bsrung ba'i nges pa dang / dag ba'i gnas zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The rite of the determination of the protection of the disciple, beginning with “pure place” up to

original: dkyil 'khor du thig gdab bya zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du thig gdab bya zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: “one should lay out the maṇḍala.”

original: thig skud la sogs pa'i nges pa ste /
analyzed: thig skud la sogs pa'i nges pa ste /
translated: The certainty of the chalk line, etc.

original: sta gon gyi cho ga dang / thig skud chad na zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: sta gon gyi cho ga dang / thig skud chad na zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The ritual of the preliminary service, and beginning with “If the chalk line is broken,”

original: rig par bya zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: rig par bya zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: up to “one should know.”🔽The characteristics of bad signs, etc.

original: mtshan ma ngan pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / a'a dang k'a la sogs zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: mtshan ma ngan pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / a'a dang k'a la sogs zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning with “the ā and the ka, etc.,”

original: thig skud la bstim bsgom par bya //
analyzed: thig skud la bstim bsgom par bya //
translated: up to “one should meditate on dissolving into the chalk line.”

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar yi dam gyi lha dmigs pa dang / thi ga des tshangs skud nas ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽shar gyi cha dang gzhan la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar yi dam gyi lha dmigs pa dang / thi ga des tshangs skud nas ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas / shar gyi cha dang gzhan la'o //
translated: The visualization of the pledged deity, beginning with “from the Brahmā line of that chalk line,”

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: up to “in the eastern part and elsewhere.”🔽The certainty of the chalk line.

original: thig gdab pa'i nges pa dang / rdo rje la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: thig gdab pa'i nges pa dang / rdo rje la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning with “the vajra, etc.,”

original: rim pas so zhes bya ba'i mthar rdul chon dgye ba'i des pa dang / shar gyis zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: rim pas so zhes bya ba'i mthar rdul chon dgye ba'i des pa dang / shar gyis zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: up to “in stages.” The certainty of scattering the sand, beginning with “from the east,”

original: phyi'i rdo rje phred ba'i zhes pa'i mthar /
analyzed: phyi'i rdo rje phred ba'i zhes pa'i mthar /
translated: up to “the outer vajra fence.”

original: rdul tshon gyis la kha dog la sogs pa'i nges pa dang / bsgoms pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: rdul tshon gyis la kha dog la sogs pa'i nges pa dang / bsgoms pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The certainty of the colors, etc. of the colored powder mandala,

original: phun tshogs mdzes par zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: phun tshogs mdzes par zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: beginning with “having contemplated” and ending with “beautiful perfection.”

original: re kh'a dang mtshan ma ngan pa'i skyon dang / nag po la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽rdo rje phreng ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: re kh'a dang mtshan ma ngan pa'i skyon dang / nag po la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas / rdo rje phreng ba rnams la'o //
translated: The faults of bad lines and signs, beginning with “black, etc.,”

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: and ending with “in the vajra garland.”

original: rdul tshon gyi dpangs kyi tshad kyi nges pa dang / dbus nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: rdul tshon gyi dpangs kyi tshad kyi nges pa dang / dbus nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The certainty of the height of the colored powder mandala,

original: lus spyar bar bya zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: lus spyar bar bya zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: beginning with “from the center” and ending with “the body should be applied.”

original: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la rnam par dag pa dang / gnyis dang rgya mtsho zhes bya ba nas @116b brtsams nas /🔽dkyil 'khor rnams zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽sngon du brjod pa'i thig skud kyi cho ga dang / aom yig ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽ye shes rdo rje bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la rnam par dag pa dang / gnyis dang rgya mtsho zhes bya ba nas @116b brtsams nas / dkyil 'khor rnams zhes bya ba'i mthar / sngon du brjod pa'i thig skud kyi cho ga dang / aom yig ces bya ba nas brtsams nas / ye shes rdo rje bzhi pa'o //
translated: The purity of the colored powder mandala, beginning with “two and ocean” and ending with “the mandalas.”

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: The rite of the thread mentioned previously, beginning with “the syllable OṀ” and ending with “the four wisdom vajras.”

original: sngags kyi mtshan nyid dang / h'um yig ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: sngags kyi mtshan nyid dang / h'um yig ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The characteristics of the mantra, beginning with “the syllable hūṃ,”

original: bdud rnam par bskrad par ro zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: bdud rnam par bskrad par ro zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: and ending with “the demons are expelled.”

original: sa bon la sogs pa dgod pa dang / sgo rnams zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa dgod pa dang / sgo rnams zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The placement of the seed syllables, etc., beginning with “the doors,”

original: la sogs zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: la sogs zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: and ending with “etc.”

original: sgo srung ba la sogs pa'i nges pa dang / zlum ma zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: sgo srung ba la sogs pa'i nges pa dang / zlum ma zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The certainty of the door guardians, etc., beginning with “the circle,”

original: dag ba'i rgyu ru zhes bya ba'i mthar /
