analyzed: rnal 'byor ba la spyod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mthe bong zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Having begun with “the thumb,”

original: de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: at the end of “just so,”

original: sor mo rnams kyi ming dang / khu tshur zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽gung mo la sogs brkyang pa'o //
analyzed: sor mo rnams kyi ming dang / khu tshur zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas / gung mo la sogs brkyang pa'o //
translated: The names of the fingers, beginning with “fist,”

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: “the middle finger, and so on are extended.”🔽The mudras of the six tathagatas, beginning with Vajrasattva,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi phyag rgya dang / lag pa g-yon zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi phyag rgya dang / lag pa g-yon zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: “with the left hand, and so on,

original: rnal 'byor pas ni brdung bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ni brdung bar bya // zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: the yogi should beat.”🔽The mudra of beauty,

original: mdzes pa'i phyag rgya dang / lag gnyis zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: mdzes pa'i phyag rgya dang / lag gnyis zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: “with the two hands, and so on,

original: gdengs ka rnams kyi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: gdengs ka rnams kyi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: the movements of the hoods,” and so on,🔽the mudras of the wrathful lords, and so on,

original: khro bo mgon po la sogs pa dang / gdengs ka rnams kyi phyag rgya dang / sbyor ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: khro bo mgon po la sogs pa dang / gdengs ka rnams kyi phyag rgya dang / sbyor ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: “the union, and so on,

original: bstan par bya zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: bstan par bya zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: should be displayed.”🔽The characteristics of the mudra of beauty,🔽“the spokes, and so on,”

original: mdzes pa'i phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid dang / rtsibs zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: mdzes pa'i phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid dang / rtsibs zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: and so on.

original: shes rab ma la 'khyud pa'i phyag rgya dang / lag gnyis zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽dgra sta la'o zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽g-yas phyogs kyi mtshan ma'i phyag rgya dang / steng du zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: shes rab ma la 'khyud pa'i phyag rgya dang / lag gnyis zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas / dgra sta la'o zhes bya ba'i mthar / g-yas phyogs kyi mtshan ma'i phyag rgya dang / steng du zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: beginning with “two hands” up to “axe.”🔽The mudra of the right-hand signs,

original: mthe'u chung ngo zhes @118b bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: mthe'u chung ngo zhes @118b bya ba'i mthar /
translated: beginning with “above” up to “little finger.”🔽The mudra of the elephant,

original: glang po che'i ba'i phyag rgya dang / dpung g-yon zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽spyor ba'i zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽g-yon phyogs kyi mtshan ma rnams kyi phyag rgya dang / rna cha la sogs pa'i phyag rgya dang / mthe bo zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: glang po che'i ba'i phyag rgya dang / dpung g-yon zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas / spyor ba'i zhes bya ba'i mthar / g-yon phyogs kyi mtshan ma rnams kyi phyag rgya dang / rna cha la sogs pa'i phyag rgya dang / mthe bo zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: beginning with “left arm” up to “practice.”🔽The mudra of the left-hand signs,🔽the mudra of earrings, and so on,

original: rigs kyi phyag rgya khyad par 'phags so zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i rigs kyi phyag rgya dang / mdzub mo mtha' zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: rigs kyi phyag rgya khyad par 'phags so zhes bya ba'i mthar / mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i rigs kyi phyag rgya dang / mdzub mo mtha' zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: beginning with “thumb” up to “superior family mudra.”🔽The mudra of the dakini and so on,

original: gzhan ma'o zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: gzhan ma'o zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: beginning with “tip of the index finger” up to “other.”

original: 'bar ba'i phyag rgya dang mdzub mo nges par ston 'gyur zhes bya ba nas brtsam nas /
analyzed: 'bar ba'i phyag rgya dang mdzub mo nges par ston 'gyur zhes bya ba nas brtsam nas /
translated: The mudrā of blazing, and the index finger is shown, and so on.

original: mthe bong brgyad pas so zhes bya ba'i mthar ;
analyzed: mthe bong brgyad pas so zhes bya ba'i mthar ;
translated: The eight thumbs are the mudrā of the messenger.

original: phebs par smra ba'i phyag rgya dang / chos zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: phebs par smra ba'i phyag rgya dang / chos zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The mudrā of speaking, and the Dharma, and so on.

original: khyod kyi rgyu ma za bar bya //
analyzed: khyod kyi rgyu ma za bar bya //
translated: You eat the intestines.

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar khro bo'i phyag rgya dang / sgeg mo zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar khro bo'i phyag rgya dang / sgeg mo zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The mudrā of the wrathful one, and the flirtatious one, and so on.

original: de'i rang bzhin phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: The nature of that is the mudrā.

original: phyag rgya'i lan la sogs pa dang / zur mig ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: phyag rgya'i lan la sogs pa dang / zur mig ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The reply of the mudrā, and so on, and the sidelong glance, and so on.

original: rnal 'byor pas ni rig par bya //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ni rig par bya //
translated: The yogin should know.

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: And so on.

original: lta stangs kyi mtshan nyid dang / cha drug cha zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: lta stangs kyi mtshan nyid dang / cha drug cha zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The characteristics of the gaze, and the six parts, and so on.

original: phyag rgya bzang mos 'bigs zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: phyag rgya bzang mos 'bigs zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: The good mudrā pierces, and so on.

original: slob ma rnams la spyin pa'i nges pa dang / sems can gang zhig ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: slob ma rnams la spyin pa'i nges pa dang / sems can gang zhig ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The certainty of giving to the disciples, beginning with “to whatever sentient being,”

original: byang chub spyod pa la gnas zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: byang chub spyod pa la gnas zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: up to “abiding in the conduct of awakening.”

original: snying rjes dbang bskur ba dang / rdzas ni mi 'byor zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽des pa kun las rnam par grol //
analyzed: snying rjes dbang bskur ba dang / rdzas ni mi 'byor zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas / des pa kun las rnam par grol //
translated: The consecration of compassion, beginning with “if the substances are not available,”

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: up to “the one who is gentle is completely liberated from all.”

original: kun spangs pa'i slob ma la dbang bskur ba'i cho ga dang ; gzhan rnams zhes bya ba'i rkang pa gcig gis gzhan rnams la dag pa dang / dbang gi mthar zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽rang rang gnas su gshegs su gsol //
analyzed: kun spangs pa'i slob ma la dbang bskur ba'i cho ga dang ; gzhan rnams zhes bya ba'i rkang pa gcig gis gzhan rnams la dag pa dang / dbang gi mthar zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas / rang rang gnas su gshegs su gsol //
translated: The ritual of consecration for the disciple who has abandoned all, and the one verse “the others” for the purification of the others, beginning with “at the conclusion of the consecration,”

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: up to “requesting them to depart to their respective abodes.”

original: dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol ba dang / tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i cho ga dang / dgra zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol ba dang / tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i cho ga dang / dgra zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The request for the maṇḍala to depart, the ritual of the gaṇacakra, and the enemies, beginning with “if there are enemies,”

original: de la 'joms par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: de la 'joms par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: up to “they will be destroyed by that.”

original: bar chod du gyur pa'i 'jigs pa bcu drug 'joms par bstan to /
analyzed: bar chod du gyur pa'i 'jigs pa bcu drug 'joms par bstan to /
translated: It is taught that the sixteen fears that are obstacles are destroyed.

original: // / de nas bsgrub pa'i le'u las don ci gsungs she na /
analyzed: // / de nas bsgrub pa'i le'u las don ci gsungs she na /
translated: What is the meaning of the chapter on practice?

original: thob ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: thob ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning with “having obtained,”

original: gtso bo'i sgrub thabs yang dag zhu //🔽@119a * // zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: gtso bo'i sgrub thabs yang dag zhu // @119a * // zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: “the practice of the principal is requested.”

original: bsgrub pa'i le'u bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i le'u bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Up to “the practice chapter is taught.”🔽In order to request the practice, “having heard the words of the moon,” and so on, the reply of the tathāgatas is given, “the body of the moon,” and so on, up to “the practice of the wheel of time.”

original: zhu ba dang / zla ba'i zang tshig gsan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas de bzhin gshegs bsal lan bka' stsal ba dang / sku zla zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: zhu ba dang / zla ba'i zang tshig gsan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas de bzhin gshegs bsal lan bka' stsal ba dang / sku zla zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: “The body of the moon” is the moon of the body of the Bhagavān.🔽“The body of the sun” is the sun of the body of the Bhagavān.🔽“The body of the stars” is the stars of the body of the Bhagavān.🔽“The body of the planets” is the planets of the body of the Bhagavān.

original: dus kyi 'khor lo bsgrub par bya //🔽zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo bsgrub par bya // zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: “The body of the moon” is the moon of the body of the Bhagavān.🔽“The body of the sun” is the sun of the body of the Bhagavān.

original: lus rnam par dag pas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i mtshan nyid dang / skyed mos tshal zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽der ni bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: lus rnam par dag pas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i mtshan nyid dang / skyed mos tshal zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽der ni bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: “The body of the stars” is the stars of the body of the Bhagavān.🔽“The body of the planets” is the planets of the body of the Bhagavān.

original: bsgrub pa'i gnas kyi nges pa dang / sngar brjod ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i gnas kyi nges pa dang / sngar brjod ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The certainty of the place of practice,🔽from the beginning of the section on “previously mentioned” up to🔽

original: sems can don gyi phyir zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽gnas bsgrung ba la sogs pa dang / stong pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: sems can don gyi phyir zhes bya ba'i mthar / gnas bsgrung ba la sogs pa dang / stong pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The certainty of the place of practice, beginning with “as before” and ending with “for the sake of sentient beings,”

original: dkyil 'khor dbang phyug go zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / chu yis zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dbang phyug go zhes bya ba'i mthar / stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / chu yis zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: the description of the place, and so on, beginning with “emptiness” and ending with “lord of the maṇḍala,”

original: sa yi dbus su dgod par bya //🔽zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phung po blang ba dang dor ba'i mtshan nyid dang / stong pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: sa yi dbus su dgod par bya // zhes bya ba'i mthar / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phung po blang ba dang dor ba'i mtshan nyid dang / stong pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: the characteristic of emptiness, beginning with “with water” and ending with “in the center of the earth,”

original: rgyal ba'i longs spyod 'khor lo bzang //🔽zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽phyi dang nang du skye gnas spyang pa'i cho ga dang / aa sogs zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽dus kyi 'khor lo bsgom par bya //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i longs spyod 'khor lo bzang // zhes bya ba'i mthar / phyi dang nang du skye gnas spyang pa'i cho ga dang / aa sogs zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas / dus kyi 'khor lo bsgom par bya //
translated: the characteristic of accepting and rejecting the mundane and transcendent aggregates, beginning with “emptiness” and ending with “the excellent wheel of enjoyment of the victors,”

original: zhes pa'i mthar /
analyzed: zhes pa'i mthar /
translated: the rite of purifying the external and internal birthplaces, beginning with “the āḥ and so on” and ending with “one should meditate on Kālacakra,”🔽and the rite of the creation stage, beginning with “the āḥ and so on” and ending with “one should meditate on Kālacakra.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku rdzogs pa dang / rdo rje zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽lha mo zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku rdzogs pa dang / rdo rje zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas / lha mo zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: The vajra and so forth, up to the Bhagavat's body is complete,🔽the goddess and so forth, up to the Bhagavat's body shape and so forth,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i dbyibs la sogs pa dang / gser 'dra rig byed zhal zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas ;🔽rgyas btab po zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i dbyibs la sogs pa dang / gser 'dra rig byed zhal zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas ; rgyas btab po zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: the golden and so forth, up to the face of the Veda,🔽the seal and so forth, up to the Bhagavatī's body characteristics,

original: bcom ldan 'das ma sna tshogs yum gyi sku'i mtshan nyid dang / 'dab brgyad lha mo brgyad ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽dkar mo'i zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽du ba la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / phyogs kyi padma zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma sna tshogs yum gyi sku'i mtshan nyid dang / 'dab brgyad lha mo brgyad ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas / dkar mo'i zhes bya ba'i mthar / du ba la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / phyogs kyi padma zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: the eight petals and so forth, up to the eight goddesses,🔽the white and so forth, up to the goddesses of smoke and so forth,

original: lha mo rnams zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: lha mo rnams zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: the petals in the directions and so forth, up to the goddesses,

original: don yod grub pa la sogs pa dang / sgrol ma la sogs pa'i gnas dang / sku'i mtshan nyid dang / nam mkha'i snying zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: don yod grub pa la sogs pa dang / sgrol ma la sogs pa'i gnas dang / sku'i mtshan nyid dang / nam mkha'i snying zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: the Amoghasiddhi and so forth, the locations of Tārā and so forth, the body characteristics, the heart of space and so forth,

original: gdan rgyas pa zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: gdan rgyas pa zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: The extensive seat is at the end.

original: dbang po dang yul dang / las @119b kyi dbang po rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / nag po rnams zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang / las @119b kyi dbang po rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / nag po rnams zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The characteristics of the sense faculties, objects, and the faculties of action, beginning with the black ones,

original: shar gyi lha la sogs pa'i lha //
analyzed: shar gyi lha la sogs pa'i lha //
translated: and the deities of the east, and so on,

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: are at the end.

original: don yod grub pa la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan rnams dang / du ba la sogs zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: don yod grub pa la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan rnams dang / du ba la sogs zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The hand implements of Amoghasiddhi, and so on, beginning with smoke,

original: rab dmar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽dkyil 'khor gyi nges pa dang / phyi ru zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: rab dmar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i mthar / dkyil 'khor gyi nges pa dang / phyi ru zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: and ending with very red,🔽 are the characteristics of the seventy-two goddesses, such as Cācī, who reside in the maṇḍala of speech. Outside of that, and so on,🔽 and ending with the year,

original: mtshan bcas so zhes bya ba'i mthar gsung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i tsar tsi ka la sogs pa'i lha mo bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid dang / de'i phyir rol zhes pa nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: mtshan bcas so zhes bya ba'i mthar gsung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i tsar tsi ka la sogs pa'i lha mo bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid dang / de'i phyir rol zhes pa nas brtsams nas /
translated: are the characteristics of the seventy-two goddesses, such as Cācī, who reside in the maṇḍala of body.

original: lo'i sbyor bas so zhes bya ba'i mthar ;
analyzed: lo'i sbyor bas so zhes bya ba'i mthar ;
translated: The extensive seat is at the end.

original: sku'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i gnod spyin la sogs pa'i lha bcu gnyis dang / de rnams kyi 'khor du gyur pa'i lha mo sum brgya bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad kyi mtshan nyid dang / sgo lha zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽rig pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sku'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i gnod spyin la sogs pa'i lha bcu gnyis dang / de rnams kyi 'khor du gyur pa'i lha mo sum brgya bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad kyi mtshan nyid dang / sgo lha zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas / rig pas rig par bya'o //
translated: The characteristics of the twelve gods such as Yakṣa who reside in the body maṇḍala, and the thirty-four hundred goddesses who are their retinue,

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: should be known by the wise.

original: sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo la gnas pa'i lha mo 'od zer can ma la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / ka ba'i 'og tu zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo la gnas pa'i lha mo 'od zer can ma la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / ka ba'i 'og tu zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The characteristics of the goddesses such as Māmakī who reside at the gates of the body maṇḍala,

original: stobs kyi rgyu la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: stobs kyi rgyu la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: and the characteristics of the nāgas such as Balabhadra,

original: klu rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / khyi gdong zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽g-yo ba'i mthar zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: klu rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / khyi gdong zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas / g-yo ba'i mthar zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: the characteristics of the dog-faced ones such as Śvānavaktrā,🔽and the characteristics of the charnel grounds such as Aṭṭahāsa,🔽the characteristics of the red pretas such as Pretavaktrā,

original: dur khrod la sogs pa'i khyi gdong ma'i mtshan nyid dang / yi dgas dmar mo zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: dur khrod la sogs pa'i khyi gdong ma'i mtshan nyid dang / yi dgas dmar mo zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: and the characteristics of the outer enclosure,

original: ra ba rim pas so zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: ra ba rim pas so zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: should be known by the wise.

original: tsar tsi ka la sogs pa'i dang / bden bral la sogs pa'i gdan gyi nges pa dang / bi run ta zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas ;
analyzed: tsar tsi ka la sogs pa'i dang / bden bral la sogs pa'i gdan gyi nges pa dang / bi run ta zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas ;
translated: The certainty of the seats of Cācini and so on, and of Nairṛtī and so on,

original: mig gsum pa zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: mig gsum pa zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: beginning with “Virūpākṣa” and ending with “three-eyed.”🔽The certainty of the seats of Śvānaमुखī and so on,

original: khyi gdong ma la sogs pa'i gdan gyi nges pa dang / 'od zer can las zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: khyi gdong ma la sogs pa'i gdan gyi nges pa dang / 'od zer can las zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: beginning with “from Māmakī” and ending with “frowning brow.”

original: khro gnyer ri zhes bya ba'i mthar /🔽khro bo'i lha mo rnams kyi nges pa dang / dri dang phreng ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: khro gnyer ri zhes bya ba'i mthar / khro bo'i lha mo rnams kyi nges pa dang / dri dang phreng ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /

analyzed: rigs 'di la ni rig par bya /

original: rgyud kyi yon tan dang / gang la thog ma mtha' zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /🔽phyag rgya 'dud ces bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: rgyud kyi yon tan dang / gang la thog ma mtha' zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas / phyag rgya 'dud ces bya ba'i mthar /
translated: At the end of the qualities of the tantra,

original: bcom ldan 'das la rnam pa @125b lnga'i bstod pa dang / gang zhig seng ge zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la rnam pa @125b lnga'i bstod pa dang / gang zhig seng ge zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: At the end of the praise in five aspects to the Bhagavān,

original: ston pa'i yon tan la sogs pa bstan to /🔽// / de ltar brjod par 'gyur ba'i rim pas /
analyzed: ston pa'i yon tan la sogs pa bstan to / // / de ltar brjod par 'gyur ba'i rim pas /
translated: The qualities of the Teacher and so forth are taught.🔽In this way, the five chapters are the object to be expressed,

original: le'u lnga la don gyi ngo bo gnas par 'gyur ba'i dus kyi 'khor lo ni brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: le'u lnga la don gyi ngo bo gnas par 'gyur ba'i dus kyi 'khor lo ni brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: the Wheel of Time that abides as the essence of the meaning.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po le'u lnga'i yi ge'i tshogs ni rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po le'u lnga'i yi ge'i tshogs ni rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: The collection of syllables of the five chapters of the king of tantras is the means of expression.

original: de la dang po re zhig bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal sdud pa po nyid kyis tshigs su bcad pa'i dang po don ci gsungs she na /
analyzed: de la dang po re zhig bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal sdud pa po nyid kyis tshigs su bcad pa'i dang po don ci gsungs she na /
translated: First, what is the meaning of the first verse spoken by the Bhagavān Mañjuśrī, the compiler himself?

original: kun mkhyen ye shes sku dang nyin byed sku ste spyan ni padma'i 'dab ltar rgyas //
analyzed: kun mkhyen ye shes sku dang nyin byed sku ste spyan ni padma'i 'dab ltar rgyas //
translated: The omniscient gnosis body, the sun body, the eyes expansive like lotus petals,🔽The one called Buddha, with twenty-three syllables beginning with omniscient,

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la kun mkhyen zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yi ge nyi shu rtsa gsum gyis sku bzhi la sogs pa dang ldan par gyur par bcom ldan 'das kyi bye brag bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la kun mkhyen zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yi ge nyi shu rtsa gsum gyis sku bzhi la sogs pa dang ldan par gyur par bcom ldan 'das kyi bye brag bstan to //
translated: the Bhagavān is distinguished as possessing the four bodies and so forth.

original: de la kun mkhyen zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la kun mkhyen zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, omniscient means

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i skad cig la mngon par byang chub pa rnal 'byor pas thob na /
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i skad cig la mngon par byang chub pa rnal 'byor pas thob na /
translated: If the yogin attains the manifest enlightenment in a moment of supreme unchanging bliss,

original: nyi khri chig stong drug brgya mtha' ru sgom par byed de /
analyzed: nyi khri chig stong drug brgya mtha' ru sgom par byed de /
translated: he meditates on the twenty-one thousand six hundred moments to the end.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde bas skad cig thams cad rdzogs par 'gyur ba nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya bar brjod de /
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde bas skad cig thams cad rdzogs par 'gyur ba nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya bar brjod de /
translated: Because all moments are perfected by supreme unchanging bliss, he is said to be a perfect buddha.

original: de bas na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i skad cig thob pa'i dus su skad cig thams cad kyi rang bzhin shes pas na kun mkhyen zhes bya bar brjod do ;
analyzed: de bas na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i skad cig thob pa'i dus su skad cig thams cad kyi rang bzhin shes pas na kun mkhyen zhes bya bar brjod do ;
translated: Therefore, when he attains a moment of supreme unchanging bliss, he is said to be omniscient because he knows the nature of all moments.

original: / de lhan cig skyes pa'i sku thob ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / de lhan cig skyes pa'i sku thob ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that he attains the innate body.

original: skad cig de nyid rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du gyur na chos nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa ye shes kyi sku yin te /
analyzed: skad cig de nyid rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du gyur na chos nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa ye shes kyi sku yin te /
translated: If that very moment becomes the nature of the ripened result, it becomes the nature of reality, the body of wisdom.

original: chos kyi sku zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called the body of reality.

original: de nyid mgrin par skyes bu byed pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa dang / rmi lam gyi gnas skabs 'gags pas na /
analyzed: de nyid mgrin par skyes bu byed pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa dang / rmi lam gyi gnas skabs 'gags pas na /
translated: That very [element] at the throat is the nature of human action, and since the state of dreaming is blocked,

original: nyin byed kyi sku yin pa la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyin byed kyi sku yin pa la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is the body of the sun and is called the sambhogakaya.

original: de nyid sad pa'i gnas skabs 'gags na dri ma med pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur nas /
analyzed: de nyid sad pa'i gnas skabs 'gags na dri ma med pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur nas /
translated: When that very [element] blocks the state of waking, the stainless result is attained.

original: spyan ni pad ma'i 'dab ma rgyas pa lta bu sangs rgyas yin la /
analyzed: spyan ni pad ma'i 'dab ma rgyas pa lta bu sangs rgyas yin la /
translated: The eye is like an open lotus petal and is the Buddha.

original: sprul pa'i sku zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called the nirmanakaya.

original: 'dir stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa bzhis bzhi pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bzhi 'gags na /
analyzed: 'dir stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa bzhis bzhi pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bzhi 'gags na /
translated: Here, when the four states such as the fourth state are blocked by the four doors of liberation such as emptiness,

original: lhan cig skyes pa la sogs pa'i sku bzhi thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa la sogs pa'i sku bzhi thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: the four kayas such as the connate are attained.

original: bcom ldan 'das de lta bu gang yin pa des chos gnas gang du bka' stsal zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de lta bu gang yin pa des chos gnas gang du bka' stsal zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, In what place did the Bhagavan teach that dharma?

original: seng ge'i khrir bzhugs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: seng ge'i khrir bzhugs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Seated on the lion throne means🔽that the Bhagavan was seated on the lion throne of the four

original: rnam @126a * //
analyzed: rnam @126a * //
translated: vajras.

original: pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par stong pa nyid la bzhugs nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par stong pa nyid la bzhugs nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and the emptiness of the form of the deity.

original: 'khor gang la gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'khor gang la gsungs she na /
translated: To what retinue was it spoken?

original: lha'i gtso bos phyag byas pa la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lha'i gtso bos phyag byas pa la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: To those who are bowed to by the chief of the gods

original: skal ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i sems can rnams la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skal ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i sems can rnams la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: means to those sentient beings who are fortunate.

original: zhu ba po gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhu ba po gang yin zhe na /
translated: Who is the petitioner?

original: spyi bo btud de zhus pa /
analyzed: spyi bo btud de zhus pa /
translated: Having bowed his head, he asked,

original: rgyal po zla bzang padma'i lag pa sbyar ba yan lag mchog gi steng bzhag nas //
analyzed: rgyal po zla bzang padma'i lag pa sbyar ba yan lag mchog gi steng bzhag nas //
translated: King Sucandra, with lotus hands placed on the top of his head,

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means having bowed his head, he asked.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde bas dbugs khri dang / stong phrag brgya 'bigs pa'i sa bcu'i dbang phyug byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje zhus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde bas dbugs khri dang / stong phrag brgya 'bigs pa'i sa bcu'i dbang phyug byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje zhus pa yin gyi /
translated: The petitioner is the bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi, the lord of the tenth stage, who pierces the vital points of the ten thousand and one hundred vital winds with supreme unchanging bliss.

original: sems can phal pas ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: sems can phal pas ni ma yin no ;
translated: It is not by ordinary sentient beings.

original: / chos ni ci zhu zhe na /
analyzed: / chos ni ci zhu zhe na /
translated: What Dharma was asked?

original: dpal ldan dus 'khor rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dpal ldan dus 'khor rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The glorious Kālacakra yoga,

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor yin la /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor yin la /
translated: It is the yoga of glorious Kālacakra, which has the nature of method and wisdom.

original: gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called the yoga of nonduality.

original: de gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur ba'i rnal 'byor las ma gtogs par gnyis su med pa'i ye shes su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur ba'i rnal 'byor las ma gtogs par gnyis su med pa'i ye shes su mi 'gyur te /
translated: Except for the yoga that has the nature of method and wisdom, nondual wisdom does not occur.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ma grub kyi bar du phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ma grub kyi bar du phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Until nondual wisdom is accomplished, the spiritual power of the great seal is not accomplished.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ma 'grub kyi bar du skye ba dang 'chi ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i 'khor ba las gol ba mi srid do //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ma 'grub kyi bar du skye ba dang 'chi ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i 'khor ba las gol ba mi srid do //
translated: Until the spiritual power of the great seal is accomplished, it is impossible to transcend cyclic existence, which has the nature of birth and death.

original: de nas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de nas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Then, the spiritual power of the great seal of nondual wisdom is attained.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang 'ba' zhig pa'i ye shes kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang 'ba' zhig pa'i ye shes kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not attained by the wisdom that is mere conceptual thought.

original: gang gi dus su zhus she na /
analyzed: gang gi dus su zhus she na /
translated: At what time is it requested?

original: rtsod ldan dus tshe la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtsod ldan dus tshe la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “in the age of strife, in the life” means

original: snyigs ma lnga'i dus so //
analyzed: snyigs ma lnga'i dus so //
translated: in the age of the five degenerations.

original: nges pa'i don du ni a'a li zhes bya ba ni dbyangs thung du dang ring por gyur pa'i yi ge sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / ka la sogs pa'i gsal byed sum cu rtsa lnga phreng ba ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i don du ni a'a li zhes bya ba ni dbyangs thung du dang ring por gyur pa'i yi ge sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / ka la sogs pa'i gsal byed sum cu rtsa lnga phreng ba ste /
translated: In the definitive meaning, “in the life” means in the place that has the nature of the thirty-two vowels and thirty-five consonants, which are the short and long vowels,

original: zla ba dang nyi ma'i thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i shu kra dang / rdul lo //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma'i thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i shu kra dang / rdul lo //
translated: and the semen and ovum, which have the nature of the method and wisdom of the sun and moon.

original: de dag tu ro mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gnas su zhus pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag tu ro mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gnas su zhus pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The “life” is the place that has the nature of the equality of those two.

original: ci'i phyir zhus she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhus she na /
translated: Why is it asked?

original: mi rnams dgrol ba'i don du'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rnams dgrol ba'i don du'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “For the sake of liberating people” means

original: mi'i skye bas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: mi'i skye bas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: that it is for the sake of attaining mundane and supramundane powers through a human birth.

original: lha'i skye ba la sogs pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lha'i skye ba la sogs pas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not for the sake of a god birth, and so on.

original: de ltar ston pa po la sogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa bstan par @126b mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar ston pa po la sogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa bstan par @126b mdzad nas /
translated: Having thus taught the perfection of the teacher, etc.,

original: mdor bsdus pa bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid bshad par mdzad de /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid bshad par mdzad de /
translated: he explains the definition of the object to be accomplished in brief:🔽The one who holds the vajra of the drop of emptiness and intuition, the god of gods and titans, etc.

original: stong dang ye shes thig le rdo rje mchog 'dzin sangs rgyas lha dang lha min dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la stong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yi ge bcu bzhi pos sgrib pa med pa'i khams drug gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gang zag skyes bu chen por brjod do //
analyzed: stong dang ye shes thig le rdo rje mchog 'dzin sangs rgyas lha dang lha min dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la stong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yi ge bcu bzhi pos sgrib pa med pa'i khams drug gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gang zag skyes bu chen por brjod do //
translated: In the fourteen syllables beginning with “emptiness,” the person who is the nature of the six unimpeded elements is called the “great being.”

original: de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: And what is that?

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rigs dang rigs can gyi 'brel par gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rigs dang rigs can gyi 'brel par gsungs so //
translated: By “buddha,” etc., he teaches the relation of the family and the one who has the family.

original: mu stegs pa'i lta bas de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: mu stegs pa'i lta bas de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is that by the views of the tīrthikas?

original: phyi dang lus dang gzhan du rang bzhin skyes bu nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid dang / zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: phyi dang lus dang gzhan du rang bzhin skyes bu nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid dang / zhes bya ba la ;
translated: The nature of the twenty-five personal entities is external, bodily, and other.

original: phyi rol du sa la sogs pa lnga dang / sgra gcan la sogs pa gsum dang / bkra shis la sogs pa gza' lnga dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga dang / skyur ba la sogs pa'i ro drug ste /
analyzed: phyi rol du sa la sogs pa lnga dang / sgra gcan la sogs pa gsum dang / bkra shis la sogs pa gza' lnga dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga dang / skyur ba la sogs pa'i ro drug ste /
translated: Externally, the nature of the twenty-four is the five such as earth, the three such as Rāhu, the five planets such as Bṛhaspati, the five objects such as form, and the six tastes such as sour.

original: dngos po nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rang bzhin yin la de rnams skyed par byed pa'i dus ni skyes bu ste nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: dngos po nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rang bzhin yin la de rnams skyed par byed pa'i dus ni skyes bu ste nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: The time that generates those is the person, making twenty-five.

original: de bzhin du lus zhes bya ba ni nang du sa la sogs pa'i dngos po bdun dang / nam mkha'i rang bzhin du gyur pa bzhi'i gnas skabs dang / dbang po lnga dang / yul lnga dang / las kyi dbang po lnga dang / rang rig pa'i bde ba'i gnas skabs ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus zhes bya ba ni nang du sa la sogs pa'i dngos po bdun dang / nam mkha'i rang bzhin du gyur pa bzhi'i gnas skabs dang / dbang po lnga dang / yul lnga dang / las kyi dbang po lnga dang / rang rig pa'i bde ba'i gnas skabs ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Similarly, the so-called body is the nature of twenty-four, which is the state of the seven things such as earth, the four that are the nature of space, the five sense organs, the five objects, the five organs of action, and the state of the bliss of reflexive awareness.

original: de rnams khyab pa po ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i skyes bu ste /
analyzed: de rnams khyab pa po ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i skyes bu ste /
translated: The person, which is the nature of the all-basis consciousness, is the pervader of those.

original: nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: twenty-five.🔽Similarly, “the others” are the twenty-four deities of the maṇḍala, who are the nature of the twenty-four spokes, and the maṇḍala lord, who is the nature of the hub, which is the nature of method and wisdom.

original: de bzhin du gzhan zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor du thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po dang / 'khor nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rang bzhin dang / skyes bu ni gnas gsum du 'grub ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor du thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po dang / 'khor nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rang bzhin dang / skyes bu ni gnas gsum du 'grub ces bya'o //
translated: “The person is accomplished in the three places.”

original: de bzhin du rtog pa rags pa spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtog pa rags pa spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, in order to abandon coarse concepts,

original: lus la sna tshogs tshad ces bya bar gsungs so //
analyzed: lus la sna tshogs tshad ces bya bar gsungs so //
translated: “the body is said to be of various sizes.”

original: de bzhin du lus la sogs pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i srid pa gsum pa'i skye ba dang / dbyibs la sogs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus la sogs pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i srid pa gsum pa'i skye ba dang / dbyibs la sogs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: Similarly, “what is the shape of the body and so on, and the birth in the three existences of the desire realm and so on?”

original: srid gsum dbyibs zhes bya bar zhus pa'o //
analyzed: srid gsum dbyibs zhes bya bar zhus pa'o //
translated: “The shape of the three existences” is asked.

original: de bzhin du lha rnams longs nyid spyod pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang ni dbang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lha rnams longs nyid spyod pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang ni dbang ste /
translated: Similarly, “the enjoyment of the gods, the maṇḍala, and the empowerment

original: lha mi'i bla mas 'di dag ma lus legs par bshad du gsol //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lha mi'i bla mas 'di dag ma lus legs par bshad du gsol //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
translated: are all explained well by the guru of gods and humans.”

original: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin sems can thams cad la phan @127a * //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin sems can thams cad la phan @127a * //
translated: In due order, they benefit all sentient beings.🔽

original: 'dogs pa'i don du gsal por gyur pa'i don gyis bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dogs pa'i don du gsal por gyur pa'i don gyis bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes zhus pa'o //
translated: For the sake of all sentient beings, he asked the Blessed One, the Lord of the Vajra, for the meaning of the Tantra of the Secret Assembly, which is clear in its meaning.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas phyag na rdo rje'i zhu ba gsan nas lan 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas phyag na rdo rje'i zhu ba gsan nas lan 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Having heard Vajrapāṇi's request, the Tathāgata spoke this reply:

original: rab mchog lha mi srin po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab mchog lha mi srin po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs so //
translated: The supreme, excellent one, the rākṣasa, and so forth.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis legs par gnang nas rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams ji ltar skyes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis legs par gnang nas rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams ji ltar skyes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, having been well-approved by the Blessed One, he spoke the verse on how the world with its moving and unmoving nature was born:

original: dus kyis stong pa las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dus kyis stong pa las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: From the empty time... and so forth.

original: dus zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa'i dus kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa'i dus kyi dbang gis so //
translated: Here, time means by the power of the productive time.

original: stong pa zhes bya ba ni sems can phal pa'i mig gi dbang po'i spyod yul du ma gyur pa'i sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab de rnams kyi dbang gis rlung la sogs pa 'byung ba bzhi'i rang bzhin du gyur pa 'jig rten gyi khams skyed pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa zhes bya ba ni sems can phal pa'i mig gi dbang po'i spyod yul du ma gyur pa'i sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab de rnams kyi dbang gis rlung la sogs pa 'byung ba bzhi'i rang bzhin du gyur pa 'jig rten gyi khams skyed pa'o //
translated: The so-called void is the world-realm, which is generated from the four elements, wind, etc., by the power of those subtle particles of earth, etc., which are not within the range of experience of the eye faculty of ordinary beings.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de la brten pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa bdun dang / nyi ma dang zla ba dang bkra shis la sogs pa'i gza' rnams dang / skar ma bdun /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de la brten pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa bdun dang / nyi ma dang zla ba dang bkra shis la sogs pa'i gza' rnams dang / skar ma bdun /
translated: The stars, the twenty-seven lunar mansions, the sun, the moon, the planets such as Ketu, the seven asterisms,

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi la sogs pa dang / gzhan gyis mi thub pa la sogs pa dang / rgyal po la sogs pa'i klu rnams dang / rnam pa bzhi'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dud 'gro rnams dang / mi dang dmyal ba ni stong pa las skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi la sogs pa dang / gzhan gyis mi thub pa la sogs pa dang / rgyal po la sogs pa'i klu rnams dang / rnam pa bzhi'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dud 'gro rnams dang / mi dang dmyal ba ni stong pa las skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: the four great kings, etc., the unvanquishable, etc., the nāgas such as the king, the animals of the four types, humans, and hell beings are born from the void.

original: gang nas skye zhe na /
analyzed: gang nas skye zhe na /
translated: Where do they arise?

original: stong dbus yang dag byung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: stong dbus yang dag byung zhes pa'o //
translated: From the center of the void.

original: ji ltar skye zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar skye zhe na /
translated: How does it arise?

original: chu las lan tshva bzhin dang / sgo da las skyes sgo da'i dbus zhes pa'i dpes bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: chu las lan tshva bzhin dang / sgo da las skyes sgo da'i dbus zhes pa'i dpes bstan par mdzad de /
translated: It is taught by the example of salt in water and the chick in the egg.

original: gsher ba'i dngos po las sra ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa lan tshva skye ba ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: gsher ba'i dngos po las sra ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa lan tshva skye ba ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as salt arises from water, having the nature of a solid substance,

original: ri dang gling la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ri dang gling la sogs pa'o //
translated: so it is with mountains, continents, and so on.

original: sgo nga'i nang du khu ba'i rdul phra rab ni gdong pa la sogs pa'i yan lag gi rang bzhin du gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du sems can rnams shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sgo nga'i nang du khu ba'i rdul phra rab ni gdong pa la sogs pa'i yan lag gi rang bzhin du gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du sems can rnams shes par bya'o //
translated: Just as the subtle particles of liquid in the egg have the nature of the parts of the face and so on, so it is with sentient beings.

original: de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mtshan nyid bshad par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mtshan nyid bshad par mdzad nas /
translated: Having explained the characteristics of the world realm in this way,

original: sgrib pa dang ldan pa dang / sgrib pa med pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid bshad par mdzad de /
analyzed: sgrib pa dang ldan pa dang / sgrib pa med pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid bshad par mdzad de /
translated: he explains the characteristics of the body with and without obscuration.

original: lus dang ye shes zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus dang ye shes zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The body and wisdom

original: sgrib pa med pa'i zla ba la sogs pa rnam pa bcu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa rdo rje'i sku bstan to //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i zla ba la sogs pa rnam pa bcu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa rdo rje'i sku bstan to //
translated: indicate the vajra body, which has the nature of ten aspects, such as the unobstructed moon and so on.

original: de rnams kyi sa bon gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sa bon gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are the seeds of those?

original: sngags kyi skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngags kyi skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The mantra birth is

original: thig le la sogs pa'i yi ge bcu po ni de rnams kyis skyed par byed pa'i @127b rgyu'o ;
analyzed: thig le la sogs pa'i yi ge bcu po ni de rnams kyis skyed par byed pa'i @127b rgyu'o ;
translated: the ten syllables such as the drop, which are the cause of their generation.

original: de la don ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de la don ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the meaning of that?

original: de ltar gang gis yang dag rig pa de ni phyugs ma yin zhing sems kyi kun rtog bral //
analyzed: de ltar gang gis yang dag rig pa de ni phyugs ma yin zhing sems kyi kun rtog bral //
translated: One who knows reality in that way is not an animal, free from mental🔽conceptualization.

original: zhes bya ba de ni yon tan gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni yon tan gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the statement of the qualities.🔽Having explained the characteristic of the body of nonobstruction in

original: de ltar sgrib pa med pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid bshad par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar sgrib pa med pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid bshad par mdzad nas /
translated: that way,

original: phyi rol du sgra gcan la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams nang du sbyar ba mdzad de /
analyzed: phyi rol du sgra gcan la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams nang du sbyar ba mdzad de /
translated: he applies externally Rāhu and so on internally.

original: lus g-yon zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lus g-yon zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The body's left and so on.

original: ye shes kyi phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i rang bzhin du gyur pa gzhom du med pa'i yi ge aa gang yin pa de'i g-yon phyogs su gnas pa'i 'du shes kyi phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan mar gyur pa dang / yi ge ao'i rang bzhin du thig le'i nang du dkar po 'bar ba yin la /
analyzed: ye shes kyi phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i rang bzhin du gyur pa gzhom du med pa'i yi ge aa gang yin pa de'i g-yon phyogs su gnas pa'i 'du shes kyi phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan mar gyur pa dang / yi ge ao'i rang bzhin du thig le'i nang du dkar po 'bar ba yin la /
translated: The syllable O, which is the nature of the sign of the aggregate of perception, and so on, is the blazing white bindu.

original: skye 'gro'i bdud rtsi tsha zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skye 'gro'i bdud rtsi tsha zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The syllable A is the nectar of living beings.

original: rtsa g-yon pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtsa g-yon pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the left nāḍī is that.

original: de bzhin du gzhom du med pa'i g-yas su gnas pa'i tshor ba'i phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan mar gyur pa'i yi ge re re'i bdag nyid tsheg drag ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhom du med pa'i g-yas su gnas pa'i tshor ba'i phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan mar gyur pa'i yi ge re re'i bdag nyid tsheg drag ni /
translated: Similarly, the syllable H, which is the nature of the sign of the aggregate of feeling, and so on, is on the right side of the indestructible.

original: dmar po'i mdog yin la /
analyzed: dmar po'i mdog yin la /
translated: It is the color of red.

original: rdul gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa rtsa g-yas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdul gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa rtsa g-yas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the right nāḍī is that it is the nature of the rajas.

original: de nas phyi rol du sgra gcan dang / dus kyi me gang yin pa de steng 'og gi dbus ma'i rtsa gnyis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyi rol du sgra gcan dang / dus kyi me gang yin pa de steng 'og gi dbus ma'i rtsa gnyis zhes bya'o //
translated: Then, externally, Rāhu and Kālāgni are the two middle nāḍīs above and below.

original: de bzhin du zla ba dang nyi ma la sogs pa'i zung drug gang yin pa de rnams nang du g-yon du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zla ba dang nyi ma la sogs pa'i zung drug gang yin pa de rnams nang du g-yon du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the six pairs such as the moon and sun should be applied inwardly to the left.

original: thig le dang tsheg drag gi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de /
analyzed: thig le dang tsheg drag gi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de /
translated: The form that has become the nature of the bindu and visarga

original: gzhom du med pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi gzhan gyi don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhom du med pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi gzhan gyi don ni ma yin no //
translated: is the nature of the invincible, not the other.

original: de bzhin du gsungs pa //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsungs pa //
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'bar ba dag la gnas te mun bral zung gcig po ni mun pa dag gi mthar //🔽zhes bya ba'o //🔽de bzhin du gzhom du med pa'i steng 'og tu rim pa ji lta bas gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa dang / 'du byed kyi phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan mar gyur pa'i yi ge li dang / yi ge ao'i thong gshol gyi rnam pa dang /
analyzed: 'bar ba dag la gnas te mun bral zung gcig po ni mun pa dag gi mthar // zhes bya ba'o // de bzhin du gzhom du med pa'i steng 'og tu rim pa ji lta bas gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa dang / 'du byed kyi phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan mar gyur pa'i yi ge li dang / yi ge ao'i thong gshol gyi rnam pa dang /
translated: Abiding in the blazing, the pair free from darkness at the end of darkness,🔽Thus, above and below the invincible, in the proper order, the form aggregate, etc.

original: dbyug pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de rnam pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa gang yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dbyug pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de rnam pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa gang yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: and the conditioning aggregate, etc., should be known as the nature of the two aspects, the plow-shaped form of the letter li and the club-shaped form of the letter o.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa bcu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa srog gi rlung gang yin pa de rim pa ji lta bas steng 'og tu zung lnga yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa bcu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa srog gi rlung gang yin pa de rim pa ji lta bas steng 'og tu zung lnga yin te /
translated: Likewise, the life-force wind, which has the nature of ten aspects, is the five pairs above and below, in order.

original: sa dang lhan cig tu zung bdun zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang lhan cig tu zung bdun zhes bya'o //
translated: Together with the earth wind, they are called the seven pairs.

original: de dag la sogs pa'i sa bon ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa'i sa bon ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are the seed syllables of those?

original: dbus su rdo rje'i steng gi sa bon yon tan tshogs bcas rang nus 'og na yang dag gnas //
analyzed: dbus su rdo rje'i steng gi sa bon yon tan tshogs bcas rang nus 'og na yang dag gnas //
translated: The seed syllable above the vajra in the center, together with the assembly of qualities, is the perfect abode below one's own capacity.

original: @128a * // ye shes kun du stong la zhi ba'i rang bzhin go 'phang dang bcas dngos po kun gyis rnam par grol //🔽zhes bya bar gsungs so /
analyzed: @128a * // ye shes kun du stong la zhi ba'i rang bzhin go 'phang dang bcas dngos po kun gyis rnam par grol // zhes bya bar gsungs so /
translated: The nature of all pristine consciousnesses is peace, together with the stage, liberated from all things.

original: de ltar sgra gcan la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid bshad par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar sgra gcan la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid bshad par mdzad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the characteristics of Rāhu and so on,

original: zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'phel ba dang 'grib ba bshad par mdzad de /
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'phel ba dang 'grib ba bshad par mdzad de /
translated: the waxing and waning of the moon and sun are explained.

original: aa sogs sum cu dbyangs gang ha ya ra wa lar ldan de ni zla ba'i nyin mtshan cha //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: aa sogs sum cu dbyangs gang ha ya ra wa lar ldan de ni zla ba'i nyin mtshan cha //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The vowels a and so on, together with ha, ya, ra, wa, la, are the lunar day and night.

original: dkar po'i phyogs dang nag po'i phyogs kyi tshes sum cu'i sa bon du gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs dang nag po'i phyogs kyi tshes sum cu'i sa bon du gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The seed of the thirty days of the bright and dark fortnights.

original: de bzhin du ka sogs sde dbyangs bcas pa nyin byed rgyu ba stong phrag me yi tshad kyis so //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du ka sogs sde dbyangs bcas pa nyin byed rgyu ba stong phrag me yi tshad kyis so // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Similarly, the vowels along with the ka and so forth, the movement of the sun, the measure of a thousand fires.

original: yi ge ka la sogs pa sum cu gang yin pa de rnams dbyangs thung du dang ring po bcu gnyis kyis phye bar 'gyur na sum brgya drug cur 'gyur te /
analyzed: yi ge ka la sogs pa sum cu gang yin pa de rnams dbyangs thung du dang ring po bcu gnyis kyis phye bar 'gyur na sum brgya drug cur 'gyur te /
translated: The thirty letters beginning with ka, when divided by the twelve short and long vowels, become three hundred and sixty.

original: de rnams kyi lo'i tshes sum brgya drug cu'i sa bon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi lo'i tshes sum brgya drug cu'i sa bon du gyur pa'o //
translated: They are the seed of the three hundred and sixty days of the year.

original: de bzhin du nyin mtshan re re chu tshod drug cu'i sa bon gang yin zhe na /🔽ha sogs dbyangs ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyin mtshan re re chu tshod drug cu'i sa bon gang yin zhe na / ha sogs dbyangs ni /
translated: Similarly, what is the seed of the sixty periods of each day and night?🔽The vowels beginning with ha

original: rtsa rnams yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtsa rnams yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: are the channels.

original: yi ge ha la sogs pa lnga po gang yin pa de yi ge aa la sogs pa thung du lnga dang / thig le dang ring po lnga dang / tsheg drag kyi  bar gyur na yi ge drug cur 'gyur te /
analyzed: yi ge ha la sogs pa lnga po gang yin pa de yi ge aa la sogs pa thung du lnga dang / thig le dang ring po lnga dang / tsheg drag kyi  bar gyur na yi ge drug cur 'gyur te /
translated: When they are combined with the five long vowels beginning with a, the five short vowels beginning with a, the five long vowels beginning with a, and the visarga, they become the sixty syllables.

original: de rnams ni chu tshod drug cu'i sa bon du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni chu tshod drug cu'i sa bon du shes par bya'o //
translated: These should be known as the seeds of the sixty periods.

original: de ltar mdor bsdus par sa bon gyi mtshan nyid bshad par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bsdus par sa bon gyi mtshan nyid bshad par mdzad nas /
translated: Having explained the characteristics of the seeds in brief,

original: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po thams cad sngags kyi rang bzhin yin par bshad pa mdzad de /
analyzed: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po thams cad sngags kyi rang bzhin yin par bshad pa mdzad de /
translated: he explains that all moving and unmoving things are of the nature of mantra.

original: lha mi'i gdengs ka 'byung bo'i gnas ni sngags zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lha mi'i gdengs ka 'byung bo'i gnas ni sngags zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The abode of the nāgas, the crest jewels of gods and men, is called mantra.

original: lha dang mi la sogs pa rnams kyi yi ge dang po gang yin pa de ni don sna tshogs grub pa'i phyir de rnams kyi sa bon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha dang mi la sogs pa rnams kyi yi ge dang po gang yin pa de ni don sna tshogs grub pa'i phyir de rnams kyi sa bon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first letter of the names of gods, men, and so on is the seed of those because it accomplishes various goals.

original: de bas na a'a li dang k'a li la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams kyis 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams gsum po'i don 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na a'a li dang k'a li la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams kyis 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams gsum po'i don 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the meanings of the three realms, such as the desire realm, are accomplished by the letters such as āli and kāli.

original: 'di dag aa sogs ka sogs dang ldan srid gsum nges par de ltar skye 'gyur rgyal po kye //
analyzed: 'di dag aa sogs ka sogs dang ldan srid gsum nges par de ltar skye 'gyur rgyal po kye //
translated: O King, the three existences will definitely arise in this way, endowed with ā, etc. and ka, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is

original: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba 'di dag la sogs pa'i srid pa gsum bo ni a'a li dang k'a lis phyi rol du rjod par byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du rnal 'byor pas nang du yi ge rnams las skye bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba 'di dag la sogs pa'i srid pa gsum bo ni a'a li dang k'a lis phyi rol du rjod par byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du rnal 'byor pas nang du yi ge rnams las skye bar shes par bya'o //
translated: as follows. The three existences, such as the moving and unmoving, are expressed externally by āli and kāli. In the same way, the yogī should understand that they arise internally from the letters.

original: 'on dngos po thams cad a'a li dang k'a li las gal te skyes par gyur pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: 'on dngos po thams cad a'a li dang k'a li las gal te skyes par gyur pa de lta na ni /
translated: But if all things arise from āli and kāli,

original: de rnams gang nas skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams gang nas skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: from where do they arise?

original: @128b dbyangs rnams ka tsa pa ta tar ldan /
analyzed: @128b dbyangs rnams ka tsa pa ta tar ldan /
translated: The vowels are endowed with ka, ca, ṭa, ta, and ta.

original: ka sogs kyis sbyar skye ba'i gnas dag ni /
analyzed: ka sogs kyis sbyar skye ba'i gnas dag ni /
translated: The places of their arising are joined with ka, etc.

original: mgrin rkan steng gi cha dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mgrin rkan steng gi cha dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are equal to the throat, palate, and upper parts.

original: yi ge de rnams kyis kye ba'i gnas ni yin no //
analyzed: yi ge de rnams kyis kye ba'i gnas ni yin no //
translated: The places of the letters are the places of the vowels.

original: gnas de rnams ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gnas de rnams ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are those places like?🔽The places of the throat, etc. are the elements of space, wind, fire, water, and earth, respectively.

original: mkha' rlung me skye yin la chu dang sa dag go zhes bya ba ni /🔽rim pa ji lta bas mgrin pa la sogs pa'i gnas rnams ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mkha' rlung me skye yin la chu dang sa dag go zhes bya ba ni / rim pa ji lta bas mgrin pa la sogs pa'i gnas rnams ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The places of the throat, etc. are the elements of space, etc.

original: de ltar sngags bzlas pa'i phyir yi ge rnams kyi skye ba'i gnas brjod par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar sngags bzlas pa'i phyir yi ge rnams kyi skye ba'i gnas brjod par mdzad nas /
translated: Thus, having described the places of origin of the letters for the purpose of mantra recitation,

original: bsgom pa'i gnas bshad par mdzad de /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i gnas bshad par mdzad de /
translated: he explains the places of meditation.🔽The places of meditation are the head, wheel, heart, throat, navel, and secret cakras, respectively.🔽The places of meditation are the head, wheel, heart, throat, navel, and secret cakras, respectively.

original: aa sogs gtsug tor 'khor lo snying mgrin spyi gtsug lte ba'i 'khor lo rim pa ste //🔽zhes bya ba ni yi ge aa dang yi ge ha dang tsheg drag dang / yi ge ka'i sde tshan rnam pa ni nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: aa sogs gtsug tor 'khor lo snying mgrin spyi gtsug lte ba'i 'khor lo rim pa ste //🔽zhes bya ba ni yi ge aa dang yi ge ha dang tsheg drag dang / yi ge ka'i sde tshan rnam pa ni nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The places of meditation are the head, wheel, heart, throat, navel, and secret cakras, respectively.🔽The places of meditation are the head, wheel, heart, throat, navel, and secret cakras, respectively.🔽The places of meditation are the head, wheel, heart, throat, navel, and secret cakras, respectively.🔽The places of meditation are the head, wheel, heart, throat, navel, and secret cakras, respectively.🔽The places of meditation are the head, wheel, heart, throat, navel, and secret cakras, respectively.🔽The places of meditation are the head, wheel, heart, throat, navel, and secret cakras, respectively.🔽The places of meditation are the head, wheel, heart, throat, navel, and secret cakras, respectively.🔽The places of meditation are the head, wheel, heart, throat, navel, and secret cakras, respectively.🔽The places of meditation are the head, wheel, heart, throat, navel, and secret cakras, respectively.🔽The places of meditation are the head, wheel, heart, throat, navel, and secret cakras, respectively.🔽The places of meditation are the head, wheel, heart, throat, navel, and secret cakras, respectively.🔽The places of meditation are the head, wheel, heart, throat, navel, and secret cakras, respectively.🔽The places of meditation are the head, wheel, heart, throat, navel, and secret cakras, respectively.🔽The places of meditation are the head, wheel, heart, throat, navel, and secret cakras, respectively.🔽The places of meditation are the head, wheel, heart, throat, navel, and secret cakras, respectively.🔽The places of meditation are the head, wheel, heart, throat,

original: de bzhin du yi ge ae dang ya dang sha dang tsa'i sde ni rlung gi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i snying ga'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yi ge ae dang ya dang sha dang tsa'i sde ni rlung gi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i snying ga'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: Likewise, the classes of the letters e, ya, ṣa, and ca are the wheel at the heart, which has the nature of wind.

original: yi ge re dang sha dang da'i sde ni me'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i mgrin pa la'o //
analyzed: yi ge re dang sha dang da'i sde ni me'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i mgrin pa la'o //
translated: The classes of the letters re, śa, and da are at the throat, which has the nature of fire.

original: yi ge au dang wa dang hya dang pa'i sde ni chu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dpral ba la'o //🔽yi ge li dang ta'i sde ni sa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge au dang wa dang hya dang pa'i sde ni chu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dpral ba la'o // yi ge li dang ta'i sde ni sa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ste /
translated: The classes of the letters o, va, ha, and pa are at the forehead, which has the nature of water.

original: lte ba la'o //
analyzed: lte ba la'o //
translated: The classes of the letters li and ta are at the navel, which has the nature of earth.

original: de rnams kyi kha dog ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi kha dog ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are the colors of those?

original: sna tshogs nag dang dmar po ri bong ser 'dra zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs nag dang dmar po ri bong ser 'dra zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are “black, variegated, red, and rabbit-like yellow.”

original: 'khor lo de rnams la byin gyis brlab pa gang gis mdzad ce na /
analyzed: 'khor lo de rnams la byin gyis brlab pa gang gis mdzad ce na /
translated: By what kind of consecration are those wheels consecrated?

original: phung po khams te lhag pa'i lha zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phung po khams te lhag pa'i lha zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The aggregates, elements, and the superior deities” means

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po la sogs pa dang / nam mkha'i khams la sogs pa'i lha dang / lha mo ni gtsug tor 'khor lo la sogs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po la sogs pa dang / nam mkha'i khams la sogs pa'i lha dang / lha mo ni gtsug tor 'khor lo la sogs par shes par bya'o //
translated: The gods and goddesses of the aggregate of consciousness and so on, and of the space element and so on, should be known as the wheel in the crown and so on.

original: da ni 'jig rten gyi khams la sogs pa bshad par mdzad de /
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten gyi khams la sogs pa bshad par mdzad de /
translated: Now, the world systems and so on are explained.

original: rlung nas lhun po'i mtha' ru dmyal ba gdengs ka'i grong khyer dpag tshad 'bum phrag gnyis //
analyzed: rlung nas lhun po'i mtha' ru dmyal ba gdengs ka'i grong khyer dpag tshad 'bum phrag gnyis //
translated: From the wind to the edge of Meru, the hells are two hundred thousand leagues.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is said.

original: 'og tu gnas pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: 'og tu gnas pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning from the wind maṇḍala below,

original: ri rab kyi rtsa ba'i bar du 'bum phrag gnyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ri rab kyi rtsa ba'i bar du 'bum phrag gnyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: up to the base of Meru, it is two hundred thousand leagues.

original: de nas rtsa ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: de nas rtsa ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Then, beginning from the base,

original: ri rab ni mgrin pa'i bar du 'bum phrag gcig ste /
analyzed: ri rab ni mgrin pa'i bar du 'bum phrag gcig ste /
translated: Meru is one hundred thousand leagues up to the neck.

original: de nyid nyi ma la sogs pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //🔽gnas de nas mgrin pa ni stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: de nyid nyi ma la sogs pa'i gnas zhes bya'o // gnas de nas mgrin pa ni stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: That is called the abode of the sun and so on.🔽From that abode, the neck is twenty-five thousand leagues.

original: gdong pa ni stong phrag lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: gdong pa ni stong phrag lnga bcu'o //
translated: The face is fifty thousand leagues.

original: de nas gtsug phud kyi bar du stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: de nas gtsug phud kyi bar du stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: The rest of the body, from the soles of the feet to the top of the head, is twenty-five thousand yojanas.

original: de ltar dpag tshad @129a * //
analyzed: de ltar dpag tshad @129a * //
translated: Thus, the body is one hundred thousand yojanas.🔽One yojana on the outside

original: 'bum phrag bzhi ni phyi rol du dpag tshad gang yin pa de /🔽lus la rkang pa nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: 'bum phrag bzhi ni phyi rol du dpag tshad gang yin pa de / lus la rkang pa nas brtsams nas /
translated: is equal to one foot on the inside.

original: gtsug phud kyi bar du sbyar ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
analyzed: gtsug phud kyi bar du sbyar ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
translated: The Blessed One has thus applied the yojanas on the outside to the feet up to the top of the head on the inside.

original: de ltar steng 'og gi tshad brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar steng 'og gi tshad brjod nas /
translated: Having thus stated the measurements of the upper and lower parts,

original: zheng gi tshad brjod par mdzad de /
analyzed: zheng gi tshad brjod par mdzad de /
translated: he states the measurements of the width.

original: rlung nas rlung gi mthar ni gnas pas yi steng ni gling dang ri bo rgya mtsho rnams //
analyzed: rlung nas rlung gi mthar ni gnas pas yi steng ni gling dang ri bo rgya mtsho rnams //
translated: The wind maṇḍala is four hundred thousand yojanas, from wind to wind,

original: bzhi phyed 'bum gnyis me dang g-yo ba'i dkyil 'khor dpag tshad rnams ni 'bum phrag gnyis //
analyzed: bzhi phyed 'bum gnyis me dang g-yo ba'i dkyil 'khor dpag tshad rnams ni 'bum phrag gnyis //
translated: and the fire maṇḍala is two hundred thousand yojanas.

original: zhes bya ba ni rlung gi dkyil ni lho phyogs nas byang dang shar nas nub kyi bar du 'bum phrag bzhi yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rlung gi dkyil ni lho phyogs nas byang dang shar nas nub kyi bar du 'bum phrag bzhi yin la /
translated: The wind maṇḍala is four hundred thousand yojanas from south to north and from east to west.

original: de'i dbus su 'bum phrag gsum ni me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i dbus su 'bum phrag gsum ni me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: In the middle of that, the fire maṇḍala is three hundred thousand yojanas.

original: de'i dbus su 'bum phrag gnyis ni chu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i dbus su 'bum phrag gnyis ni chu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: In the middle of that, the water mandala is two hundred thousand yojanas.

original: chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su sa'i dkyil 'khor 'bum phrag gcig tu gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su sa'i dkyil 'khor 'bum phrag gcig tu gyur ba yin la /
translated: In the middle of the water mandala, the earth mandala is one hundred thousand yojanas.

original: de la ri dang rgya mtsho dang gling la sogs pas te /
analyzed: de la ri dang rgya mtsho dang gling la sogs pas te /
translated: It is surrounded by mountains, oceans, continents, and so on.

original: dbus su ni ri rab bo /
analyzed: dbus su ni ri rab bo /
translated: In the middle is Mount Meru.

original: de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: dbus nas lhun po gang zhig steng nas nyin mtshan 'bru yi 'khor lo bskor bcas 'khor //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbus nas lhun po gang zhig steng nas nyin mtshan 'bru yi 'khor lo bskor bcas 'khor // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the middle is Meru, which is surrounded by the wheel of day and night above.

original: g-yas g-yon gyi tshad ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: g-yas g-yon gyi tshad ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of the right and left sides?

original: 'bum phrag gnyis gnyis kyis ni drug gi cha ste zhes bya ba ni ri rab kyi g-yas g-yon dang shar nub dang steng 'og gi cha drug ste /
analyzed: 'bum phrag gnyis gnyis kyis ni drug gi cha ste zhes bya ba ni ri rab kyi g-yas g-yon dang shar nub dang steng 'og gi cha drug ste /
translated: Two hundred thousand yojanas each for the six parts. The right and left sides, east and west, and above and below of Meru are six parts.

original: dpag tshad 'bum phrag gnyis gnyis ni zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad 'bum phrag gnyis gnyis ni zhes bya'o //
translated: Two hundred thousand yojanas each.

original: de ltar zheng gi tshad bshad par mdzad nas ;
analyzed: de ltar zheng gi tshad bshad par mdzad nas ;
translated: Having explained the measure of the width,

original: rgya'i tshad brjod par mdzad de /
analyzed: rgya'i tshad brjod par mdzad de /
translated: the measure of the circumference is stated.

original: ma lus 'jig rten khams kyi zheng gi tshad kyis rgya ru sum 'gyur kun nas so //
analyzed: ma lus 'jig rten khams kyi zheng gi tshad kyis rgya ru sum 'gyur kun nas so //
translated: The diameter of the entire world system is three times its breadth.

original: sa la rgyar ni 'bum phrag gsum ste chu dang me rlung rnams ni drug dgu nyi ma'i rim pas so //
analyzed: sa la rgyar ni 'bum phrag gsum ste chu dang me rlung rnams ni drug dgu nyi ma'i rim pas so //
translated: The earth is one hundred thousand leagues in diameter. The water, fire, and wind spheres are, respectively, six, nine, and twelve such [hundred thousands].

original: zhes bya ba ni rim pa ji lta bas 'bum phrag gsum dang drug dang dgu dang bcu gnyis ni sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rim pa ji lta bas 'bum phrag gsum dang drug dang dgu dang bcu gnyis ni sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'o //
translated: The earth mandala and so forth are, respectively, one hundred thousand, six hundred thousand, nine hundred thousand, and twelve hundred thousand leagues in diameter.

original: de ltar phyi'i 'jig rten gyi tshad bshad par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyi'i 'jig rten gyi tshad bshad par mdzad nas /
translated: Having explained the measure of the external world system,

original: de nyid nang du sbyar bar mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid nang du sbyar bar mdzad de /
translated: he applies that to the internal:

original: gang gi phyir srid gsum gnas na 'bum phrag gcig gi dpag tshad rnams ni mi dbang kye /
analyzed: gang gi phyir srid gsum gnas na 'bum phrag gcig gi dpag tshad rnams ni mi dbang kye /
translated: Since the three existences are one hundred thousand leagues in the abode, O Lord of Men,🔽 that is the earth mandala, and the body is one cubit in size.

original: de ni sa yi steng gnas lus la rang rang gi tshad kyis khru gang dag tu yang dag go //
analyzed: de ni sa yi steng gnas lus la rang rang gi tshad kyis khru gang dag tu yang dag go //
translated: What is a league?

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He explains this in a verse:🔽Eight of the smallest particles is one particle. Eight of those is one water particle.🔽Eight of those is one dust particle. Eight of those is one louse.🔽Eight of those is one barley seed. Eight of those is one finger width.

original: dpag tshad ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: dpag tshad ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: Eight of those is one cubit. Four of those is one hasta.🔽Four of those is one dhanus. Five hundred of those is one krośa.🔽Eight of those is one yojana.

original: phra rab rdul brgyad kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas gsungs so //
analyzed: phra rab rdul brgyad kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas gsungs so //
translated: The measure of the world system is explained in this way.

original: srid pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are the characteristics of the three realms?

original: dang po de ni chos kyi bskal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: dang po de ni chos kyi bskal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The first is called the eon of Dharma, etc.

original: gzugs med pa'i lha'i gnas yin @129b la ;
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i lha'i gnas yin @129b la ;
translated: It is the abode of the formless gods.

original: gang du lha rnams tshe bskal pa gcig ste mtho ris zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang du lha rnams tshe bskal pa gcig ste mtho ris zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The gods there live for one eon, which is called the higher realms.

original: de rnams kyi dbye ba du yin zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbye ba du yin zhe na /
translated: How many types of gods are there?🔽The text says, “two pairs of gods, two pairs of gods, and two pairs of gods.”

original: zung zung zung ldan zhes bya ba ni gtsug tor gyi gnas su zad par stong pa la sogs pa bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa'i lha rnams bskal ba chen po gcig la sogs pa'i tshad dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //🔽rim pa de bzhin du dpral ba la sogs pa'i gnas bzhi la zad par rlung la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis /
analyzed: zung zung zung ldan zhes bya ba ni gtsug tor gyi gnas su zad par stong pa la sogs pa bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa'i lha rnams bskal ba chen po gcig la sogs pa'i tshad dang ldan pa zhes bya'o // rim pa de bzhin du dpral ba la sogs pa'i gnas bzhi la zad par rlung la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis /
