translated: By the power of cultivating the meditative absorption of the totalities such as the totality of space, the gods of the sphere of infinite space and so on are said to have a lifespan of one great eon and so forth.

original: bskal pa 'bring po bcu drug dang bco lnga la sogs pa'i tshe dang ldan pa gzugs na spyod pa lha rnams te /
analyzed: bskal pa 'bring po bcu drug dang bco lnga la sogs pa'i tshe dang ldan pa gzugs na spyod pa lha rnams te /
translated: In the same way, by the power of the meditative absorption of the totalities such as the totality of wind in the four abodes such as the forehead and so on, the gods of the form realm have a lifespan of sixteen intermediate eons and fifteen intermediate eons and so forth.

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar gyi bskal pa'i bskal pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar gyi bskal pa'i bskal pa zhes bya'o //
translated: up to the Brahma world is called a kalpa of dissolution.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod par gyur pa'i lha rnams ni sbyin pa dang sngags bzlas pa'i stobs kyis bskal pa tha ma drug la sogs pa'i tshe'i tshad dang ldan pa drug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod par gyur pa'i lha rnams ni sbyin pa dang sngags bzlas pa'i stobs kyis bskal pa tha ma drug la sogs pa'i tshe'i tshad dang ldan pa drug ste /
translated: Similarly, the gods of the desire realm, by the power of generosity and mantra, have a life span of six kalpas at the end of the age and so on.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i stobs kyis lha min la sogs pa lnga yin la /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i stobs kyis lha min la sogs pa lnga yin la /
translated: By the power of virtue and nonvirtue, there are five, such as the demigods.

original: legs gnas sred las 'dod pa bcu gcig pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: legs gnas sred las 'dod pa bcu gcig pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The eleventh is called the desire realm of good abode.

original: rnal 'byor pas de rnams kyi skye ba ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas de rnams kyi skye ba ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
translated: How do yogis meditate on the arising of those?

original: bzhi ni aa sogs zung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rkang pa gnyis kyis de rnams skyed pa'i sa bon rnams su brjod do //
analyzed: bzhi ni aa sogs zung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rkang pa gnyis kyis de rnams skyed pa'i sa bon rnams su brjod do //
translated: The two lines beginning with “the four are the pairs of a ā and so on” express the seed syllables that give rise to them.

original: srid pa sum cu gcig gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: srid pa sum cu gcig gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The thirty-one existences are

original: skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs par 'gyur bas na srid pa yin la /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs par 'gyur bas na srid pa yin la /
translated: existence because of birth, death, and so on.

original: sum cu rtsa gcig gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gcig gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thirty-one is

original: skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs par 'gyur bas na /
translated: because of birth, death, and so on.

original: srid pa yin la sum cu rtsa gcig go //
analyzed: srid pa yin la sum cu rtsa gcig go //
translated: Thus, there are thirty-one existences.

original: de rnams mdor bsdus pas 'di ru srid pa gsum 'gyur la khams kyi dbye bas khams gsum mo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams mdor bsdus pas 'di ru srid pa gsum 'gyur la khams kyi dbye bas khams gsum mo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In brief, they are the three existences, and by the division of the realms, there are the three realms.

original: de nyid sku'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i dbye bas 'di dag rdo rje gsum yin khams gsum ma lus pa dang / aa dang ka sogs dbye bas so //
analyzed: de nyid sku'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i dbye bas 'di dag rdo rje gsum yin khams gsum ma lus pa dang / aa dang ka sogs dbye bas so //
translated: They are the three vajras, the body vajra, and so on, by the division of the three vajras, because of the division of the three realms, and because of the division of the vowels and consonants.

original: da ni sa 'og na gnas pa'i dmyal ba la sogs pa'i ming brjod par mdzad de /
analyzed: da ni sa 'og na gnas pa'i dmyal ba la sogs pa'i ming brjod par mdzad de /
translated: Now, he mentions the names of the hells and so on that are located below the earth.

original: rin chen 'od ces bya ba ni rin po che rnams kyis gang du gsal por byed pa de rin chen 'od yin la /
analyzed: rin chen 'od ces bya ba ni rin po che rnams kyis gang du gsal por byed pa de rin chen 'od yin la /
translated: Ratna-prabha means that which is illuminated by jewels.

original: stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga pa klu dang lha ma yin gyi gnas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga pa klu dang lha ma yin gyi gnas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is the abode of the nagas and asuras, twenty-five thousand yojanas in extent.

original: de'i 'og tu chu dang gseg ma dang ldan pa'i dmyal ba stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chu dang gseg ma dang ldan pa'i dmyal ba stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o //
translated: Below that is the hell of water and gravel, twenty-five thousand yojanas in extent.

original: de bzhin du chu'i dmyal ba gnyis ni stong phrag lnga bcu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chu'i dmyal ba gnyis ni stong phrag lnga bcu ste /
translated: Likewise, the two water hells are 50,000 yojanas.

original: bye ma chu dang ldan pa dang 'dam rdzab lta bu'o //🔽me'i dmyal ba gnyis ni du ba dang drag po dang ldan pa @130a * //
analyzed: bye ma chu dang ldan pa dang 'dam rdzab lta bu'o // me'i dmyal ba gnyis ni du ba dang drag po dang ldan pa @130a * //
translated: They are like sand with water and like mud.🔽The two fire hells are 50,000 yojanas.

original: dang ; mun pa chen po ste stong phrag lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: dang ; mun pa chen po ste stong phrag lnga bcu'o //
translated: They are like smoke, like a fierce fire, and like great darkness.

original: de bzhin du rlung gi dmyal ba gnyis ni du 'bod dang mnar med pa ni stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung gi dmyal ba gnyis ni du 'bod dang mnar med pa ni stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the two wind hells are 25,000 yojanas.🔽They are like the Saṃghāta and Mahāsaṃghāta hells.

original: de bzhin du rgya mtsho la sogs pa'i ming ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgya mtsho la sogs pa'i ming ni /
translated: Likewise, the names of the oceans, etc.

original: lan tshva chang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis gsungs so //
analyzed: lan tshva chang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis gsungs so //
translated: are stated in one verse beginning with “salt and liquor.”

original: gling bzhi'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gling bzhi'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are the characteristics of the four continents?

original: shar du rlung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod do //
analyzed: shar du rlung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod do //
translated: They are stated beginning with “in the east is Videha.”

original: ri rab ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ri rab ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is Meru like?

original: stong pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin du gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: stong pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin du gyur pa yin la /
translated: It is of the nature of space, like space.

original: lhun po rdo rje mchog gi rang bzhin dkyil 'khor rnams kyi dbus su'o //
analyzed: lhun po rdo rje mchog gi rang bzhin dkyil 'khor rnams kyi dbus su'o //
translated: In the center of the mandala, which is the nature of the supreme vajra Meru.

original: gling bzhi pa'i tshad ni ji lta bu yin zhe na ;
analyzed: gling bzhi pa'i tshad ni ji lta bu yin zhe na ;
translated: What is the size of the four continents?

original: ri dang klung zhes bya ba ni rim pa ji lta bu sa dpag tshad stong phrag bdun dang / brgyad dang dgu dang bcu ni shar gyi gling la sogs pa'i tshad shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ri dang klung zhes bya ba ni rim pa ji lta bu sa dpag tshad stong phrag bdun dang / brgyad dang dgu dang bcu ni shar gyi gling la sogs pa'i tshad shes par bya'o //
translated: The mountains and rivers are seven, eight, nine, and ten thousand yojanas in height, respectively, in the eastern and other continents.

original: ri rab kyi rgya'i tshad ji lta bu yin zhe na /🔽lhun po'i steng gi rgyar ni sa steng gnas su dpag tshad rnams ni stong phrag lnga bcu la /
analyzed: ri rab kyi rgya'i tshad ji lta bu yin zhe na / lhun po'i steng gi rgyar ni sa steng gnas su dpag tshad rnams ni stong phrag lnga bcu la /
translated: What is the size of Meru?🔽The surface of Meru is fifty thousand yojanas in extent.

original: zhes bya ba ni steng du stong phrag lnga bcu yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni steng du stong phrag lnga bcu yin la /
translated: Fifty thousand yojanas above is the surface of Meru.

original: 'og tu stong phrag bcu drug zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'og tu stong phrag bcu drug zhes bya'o //
translated: Sixteen thousand yojanas below is the base of Meru.

original: phyi rol du stong phrag gcig ni 'khor yug go //
analyzed: phyi rol du stong phrag gcig ni 'khor yug go //
translated: One thousand yojanas beyond that is the outer ring of mountains.

original: de bzhin du steng rva lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pas ri rab kyi mtshan nyid dang / gling la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du steng rva lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pas ri rab kyi mtshan nyid dang / gling la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The characteristics of Meru and the continents, etc., are stated in the verse beginning with “five peaks above, etc.”

original: gling de dag la sogs pa'i tshad ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gling de dag la sogs pa'i tshad ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are the dimensions of these continents?

original: thams cad rgya mtsho drug ces bya ba'i rgya mtsho drug dang / ri drug dang gling drug gi tshad ni /
analyzed: thams cad rgya mtsho drug ces bya ba'i rgya mtsho drug dang / ri drug dang gling drug gi tshad ni /
translated: The dimensions of the six oceans, six mountains, and six continents are as follows:

original: dpag tshad brgya phrag brgyad brgya brgyad cu rtsa brgyad dang / rgyang grags gsum dang gzhu brgyad cu rtsa gcig gis lhag pa'i stong phrag gcig dang / sor bcu dang nas lnga dang shig gnyis dang ske tshe lnga dang skra'i rtse mo gnyis dang / rdul phra rab drug tsam mo //
analyzed: dpag tshad brgya phrag brgyad brgya brgyad cu rtsa brgyad dang / rgyang grags gsum dang gzhu brgyad cu rtsa gcig gis lhag pa'i stong phrag gcig dang / sor bcu dang nas lnga dang shig gnyis dang ske tshe lnga dang skra'i rtse mo gnyis dang / rdul phra rab drug tsam mo //
translated: the outer ocean has a breadth of 84,000 yojanas, 1,000 yojanas, and 81 yojanas, and it is 10 fingers, 5 barley grains, 2 mustard seeds, 5 sesame seeds, and 6 atoms thick.

original: 'dzam bu gling gi tshad ji lta bu yin zhe na /🔽'dzam bu gling gi rgyar ni lan tshva'i chu gter 'bum phyed kyi tshad yin zhing zhes bya ba ni stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dzam bu gling gi tshad ji lta bu yin zhe na / 'dzam bu gling gi rgyar ni lan tshva'i chu gter 'bum phyed kyi tshad yin zhing zhes bya ba ni stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: What is the size of Jambudvīpa?🔽Jambudvīpa is 150,000 yojanas wide,

original: rim pa de bzhin du nyis ldab kyi tshad ni lan tshva'i rgya mtsho las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa de bzhin du nyis ldab kyi tshad ni lan tshva'i rgya mtsho las shes par bya'o //
translated: and the other continents are twice the size of the previous one in each direction.

original: de bzhin du tshangs pa'i yul las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rkang pa gcig gis ma tshangs ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i bzhugs la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshangs pa'i yul las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rkang pa gcig gis ma tshangs ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i bzhugs la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: Likewise, with one verse beginning with “In the realm of Brahmā” and so on, he teaches the abodes of the Blessed One Kālacakra and so on.

original: rdzogs dang gsum pa cha gnyis nges par gzhan yang rtsod ldan dus kyi dbang gis 'byung //
analyzed: rdzogs dang gsum pa cha gnyis nges par gzhan yang rtsod ldan dus kyi dbang gis 'byung //
translated: The perfect, the third, the two-part, and also the age of strife, which occurs by the power of time.

original: @130b zhes bya ba ni cha bzhis dge ba rdzogs pa na /
analyzed: @130b zhes bya ba ni cha bzhis dge ba rdzogs pa na /
translated: Here, when virtue is complete in four parts,

original: rdzogs ldan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs ldan zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the perfect age.

original: dge ba'i cha gsum gyis byas pa na /
analyzed: dge ba'i cha gsum gyis byas pa na /
translated: When it is made up of three parts of virtue,

original: sum ldan gyi cha zhes bya ba ste dge ba'i cha nas gcig med par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sum ldan gyi cha zhes bya ba ste dge ba'i cha nas gcig med par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is called the two-part age, meaning that one part of virtue is missing.

original: dge ba'i cha shas gnyis dang ldan pas na nyis ldan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i cha shas gnyis dang ldan pas na nyis ldan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When it is endowed with two parts of virtue, it is called the two-part age.

original: rnam pa thams cad ni sdig par 'byung bas na rtsod ldan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ni sdig par 'byung bas na rtsod ldan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since all aspects are the arising of evil, it is called the age of strife.

original: de ji ltar shes pa zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar shes pa zhe na /
translated: How is this known?

original: dum bu gang la stobs ldan 'khor lo can zhugs de ni rdzogs gyur la //
analyzed: dum bu gang la stobs ldan 'khor lo can zhugs de ni rdzogs gyur la //
translated: The age of completeness is where the powerful one with the wheel enters, and it is complete.

original: sum ldan rgyal po'i rgyab ste rtsod ldan bdun la gnyis ldan gnyis dbus su //
analyzed: sum ldan rgyal po'i rgyab ste rtsod ldan bdun la gnyis ldan gnyis dbus su //
translated: The age of three-quarters is the back of the king’s age, and the age of two-quarters is the two middle ages of conflict.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is so.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mdzad pa de rdzogs ldan yin la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mdzad pa de rdzogs ldan yin la /
translated: The age of completeness is where the Bhagavat turned the wheel of the Dharma.

original: gang nas byon pa de sum ldan te /
analyzed: gang nas byon pa de sum ldan te /
translated: The age of three-quarters is where he came from.

original: gang du gshegs pa de rtsod ldan no //
analyzed: gang du gshegs pa de rtsod ldan no //
translated: The age of conflict is where he went.

original: rtsod ldan dang sum ldan gyi bar du nyis ldan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtsod ldan dang sum ldan gyi bar du nyis ldan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The age of two-quarters is between the age of conflict and the age of three-quarters.

original: dus bzhi'i tshad du yin zhe na /
analyzed: dus bzhi'i tshad du yin zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of the four ages?

original: nyi shu stong phrag gcig dang ro brgya dang bcas lo yi grangs ni dus rnams kyi //
analyzed: nyi shu stong phrag gcig dang ro brgya dang bcas lo yi grangs ni dus rnams kyi //
translated: One thousand twenty times ten thousand years is the measure of the ages.

original: zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: This is so.

original: dus bzhi'i tshad ni lo drug brgya dang / stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig go //
analyzed: dus bzhi'i tshad ni lo drug brgya dang / stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig go //
translated: The measure of the four ages is twenty-one thousand years.

original: re re dus ji tsam gyi bar du dar zhe na /
analyzed: re re dus ji tsam gyi bar du dar zhe na /
translated: For how long does each age last?

original: re re'i tshad ni zung dang mdas bgrangs mi rnams lo brgya gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: re re'i tshad ni zung dang mdas bgrangs mi rnams lo brgya gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The measure of each is the distance covered by two arrows shot simultaneously.

original: mi rnams kyi lo bzhi brgya lnga stong ni re re'i tshad dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi lo bzhi brgya lnga stong ni re re'i tshad dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Four hundred and fifty human years is the measure of one day and night for each of the gods of the Four Groups of the Four Great Kings.

original: lo la bye brag yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: lo la bye brag yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is there a difference in the length of a year?🔽One year for the gods of the Four Great Kings is five hundred human years.🔽One day and night for the gods of the Thirty-three is one thousand human years.🔽One day and night for the gods of Yāma is two thousand human years.

original: phra mo dbugs 'byung dhru rtsa gnyis dhru dus dang stong phrag nyi shu gcig dang drug brgyas tshad de rim gyis ni //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phra mo dbugs 'byung dhru rtsa gnyis dhru dus dang stong phrag nyi shu gcig dang drug brgyas tshad de rim gyis ni // zhes bya ba la /
translated: One day and night for the gods of Tuṣita is four thousand human years.🔽One day and night for the gods of Nirmāṇarati is eight thousand human years.🔽One day and night for the gods of Paranirmitavaśavartin is sixteen thousand human years.

original: mi rnams kyi 'byung ba dang / 'jug pa'i dbugs gcig gi cha shas nyi khri chig stong drug brgya pa ni /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi 'byung ba dang / 'jug pa'i dbugs gcig gi cha shas nyi khri chig stong drug brgya pa ni /
translated: One day and night for the gods of Brahmakāyika is two hundred and fifty human years.🔽One day and night for the gods of Brahmapurohita is five hundred human years.

original: srin bu la sogs pa'i dbugs gcig yin la /🔽de lta bu'i dbugs drug gi chu srang gcig yin te /
analyzed: srin bu la sogs pa'i dbugs gcig yin la / de lta bu'i dbugs drug gi chu srang gcig yin te /
translated: One day and night for the gods of Mahābrahman is one thousand human years.🔽One day and night for the gods of Parīttābha is two thousand human years.🔽One day and night for the gods of Apramāṇābha is four thousand human years.🔽One day and night for the gods of Ābhāsvara is eight thousand human years.

original: chu srang drug cus chu tshod gcig go //
analyzed: chu srang drug cus chu tshod gcig go //
translated: One day and night for the gods of Parīttaśubha is sixteen thousand human years.🔽One day and night for the gods of Apramāṇaśubha is thirty-two thousand human years.

original: chu tshod drug chus nyin mtshan du gyur pa'o //🔽nyin mtshan sum cus zla ba gcig go //
analyzed: chu tshod drug chus nyin mtshan du gyur pa'o // nyin mtshan sum cus zla ba gcig go //
translated: One day and night for the gods of Śubhakṛtsna is sixty-four thousand human years.🔽One day and night for the gods of Bṛhatphala is one hundred and twenty-five thousand human years.🔽One day and night for the gods of Avṛha is two hundred and fifty thousand human years.🔽One day and night for the gods of Atapa is five hundred thousand human years.🔽One day and night for the gods of Sudarśana is one million human years.

original: zla ba bcu gnyis kyis lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba bcu gnyis kyis lo zhes bya'o //
translated: One day and night for the gods of Sudṛśa is two million human years.🔽One day and night for the gods of Akaniṣṭha is four million human years.

original: rang rang gi tshad kyis de lta bur gyur pa'i lo brgya tham pa ni lus las skyes pa'i srin bu la sogs pa rnams kyi tshe'i tshad yin la /
analyzed: rang rang gi tshad kyis de lta bur gyur pa'i lo brgya tham pa ni lus las skyes pa'i srin bu la sogs pa rnams kyi tshe'i tshad yin la /
translated: The life span of the worms, etc. that are born from the body is one hundred years according to their own measure.

original: de yang sdig pa dang bsod nams kyi dbang gis lhag pa dang nyung bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sdig pa dang bsod nams kyi dbang gis lhag pa dang nyung bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is increased or decreased by the power of sin and merit.

original: rim pa ji lta bas mi rnams kyi dbugs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i nyin mtshan la sogs pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta bas mi rnams kyi dbugs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i nyin mtshan la sogs pa shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the day and night of humans, which is the nature of twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths, is in the same order as the day and night of the worms, etc.

original: mi rnams kyi chu tshod sum cu ni 'byung po la sogs @131a * //🔽pa'i dbugs gcig yin la /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi chu tshod sum cu ni 'byung po la sogs @131a * // pa'i dbugs gcig yin la /
translated: Thirty human hours are one breath of the bhūtas, etc.

original: de lta bu dbugs rnams kyis chu srang la sogs pa'i dbye ba shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dbugs rnams kyis chu srang la sogs pa'i dbye ba shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know the divisions of hours, etc. by the breaths in that way.

original: mi rnams kyi chu tshod gcig gis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi dbugs gcig go //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi chu tshod gcig gis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi dbugs gcig go //
translated: One human hour is one breath of the gods of the desire realm.

original: mi rnams kyi nyin mtshan gcig ni lha ma yin rnams kyi dbugs gcig go / mi rnams kyi lo ni 'og min rnams kyi dbugs gcig go //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi nyin mtshan gcig ni lha ma yin rnams kyi dbugs gcig go / mi rnams kyi lo ni 'og min rnams kyi dbugs gcig go //
translated: One day and night of humans is one day and night of the demigods.

original: mi rnams kyi lo nyi khri chig stong drug brgya ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi dbugs gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi lo nyi khri chig stong drug brgya ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi dbugs gcig ces bya'o //
translated: One hundred years of humans is one day and night of the Akaniṣṭha gods.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The same text says,

original: lus skyes phra mo mi dang 'byung po lha dang lha min rnams dang ni //
analyzed: lus skyes phra mo mi dang 'byung po lha dang lha min rnams dang ni //
translated: The subtle body, humans, bhūtas, gods, and demigods,

original: lus dang gtso bo'i nyin gcig sa steng dag tu 'gyur te nus ma'i tshad kyis dus rnams te //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lus dang gtso bo'i nyin gcig sa steng dag tu 'gyur te nus ma'i tshad kyis dus rnams te // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One day of the body and the principal is one day on earth, the measure of the kalpas.

original: dus bzhi'i tshad 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi tshad kyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dus bzhi'i tshad 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi tshad kyis shes par bya'o //
translated: The measure of the four ages should be understood by the measure of the Akaniṣṭha gods.

original: dum bu dum bu zhi ba'i go 'phang 'khor lo can gshegs nyin mtshan gcig la nyi ma bcu gnyis so //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dum bu dum bu zhi ba'i go 'phang 'khor lo can gshegs nyin mtshan gcig la nyi ma bcu gnyis so //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The peaceful stage, cut into pieces, has twelve suns in one day and night of Cakravartin.

original: phyi rol du zla ba bcu gnyis kyi 'pho ba rnams kyis nyi ma bcu gnyis 'khor bar byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: phyi rol du zla ba bcu gnyis kyi 'pho ba rnams kyis nyi ma bcu gnyis 'khor bar byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the twelve transits of the twelve months are completed by the twelve suns,

original: nyin mtshan gcig dum bu bcu gnyis la bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i nyin mtshan du mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: nyin mtshan gcig dum bu bcu gnyis la bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i nyin mtshan du mdzad pa'o //
translated: so the twelve parts of a single day and night are made into a day and night of the nature of Dharma by the Lord.

original: de ltar dbugs kyi tshad bshad par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar dbugs kyi tshad bshad par mdzad nas /
translated: Having explained the measure of the breath in this way,

original: lo'i dbye ba bshad par mdzad de /
analyzed: lo'i dbye ba bshad par mdzad de /
translated: he explains the divisions of the year.

original: phyogs dang zla ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: phyogs dang zla ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In directions, months, and so on,

original: phyogs ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: phyogs ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: directions are the twenty-four.

original: dpyid zla 'bring po la sogs pa zla ba bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: dpyid zla 'bring po la sogs pa zla ba bcu gnyis so //
translated: Months are the twelve, such as the middle month of spring.

original: zla ba gnyis gnyis kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dpyid ka la sogs pa'i dus drug go //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis gnyis kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dpyid ka la sogs pa'i dus drug go //
translated: Seasons are the six, such as spring, which are of the nature of two months each.🔽 Times are the four, which are of the nature of three months each.

original: zla ba gsum gsum gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa dus bzhi'o //
analyzed: zla ba gsum gsum gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa dus bzhi'o //
translated: Ages are the three, which are of the nature of four months each.🔽 The years are the twelve, such as the middle month of spring.🔽 The half-years are the six, such as spring, which are of the nature of two months each.🔽 The years are the twelve, such as the middle month of spring.🔽 The half-years are the six, such as spring, which are of the nature of two months each.🔽 The years are the twelve, such as the middle month of spring.🔽 The half-years are the six, such as spring, which are of the nature of two months each.🔽 The years are the twelve, such as the middle month of spring.🔽 The half-years are the six, such as spring, which are of the nature of two months each.🔽 The years are the twelve, such as the middle month of spring.🔽 The half-years are the six, such as spring, which are of the nature of two months each.🔽 The years are the twelve, such as the middle month of spring.🔽 The half-years are the six, such as spring, which are of the nature of two months each.🔽 The years are the twelve, such as the middle month of spring.🔽 The half-years are the six, such as spring, which are of the nature of two months each.

original: zla ba bzhi bzhi'i rang bzhin du gyur pa dus gsum mo ;
analyzed: zla ba bzhi bzhi'i rang bzhin du gyur pa dus gsum mo ;
translated: The years are the twelve, such as the middle month of spring.🔽 The

original: / zla ba drug drug gi rang bzhin du gyur pa byang dang lhor ni bgrod pa gnyis so //
analyzed: / zla ba drug drug gi rang bzhin du gyur pa byang dang lhor ni bgrod pa gnyis so //
translated: The northern and southern courses are six months each.

original: 'di dag la sogs pa dang ldan par gyur pa'i lo ni phyi nang du sems can thams cad la gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag la sogs pa dang ldan par gyur pa'i lo ni phyi nang du sems can thams cad la gyur pa'o //
translated: The year is endowed with these and other qualities, and it is present in all sentient beings, externally and internally.

original: de la phyi rol du lo gang yin pa de ni nang du nyin mtshan yin la /
analyzed: de la phyi rol du lo gang yin pa de ni nang du nyin mtshan yin la /
translated: Externally, the year is the day and night internally.

original: phyi rol du nyin mtshan ni nang du chu tshod yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol du nyin mtshan ni nang du chu tshod yin la /
translated: Externally, the day and night are the hours internally.

original: phyi rol du chu tshod ni nang du chu srang yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol du chu tshod ni nang du chu srang yin la /
translated: Externally, the hours are the minutes internally.

original: phyi rol du chu srang ni nang du dbugs yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol du chu srang ni nang du dbugs yin la /
translated: Externally, the minutes are the breaths internally.

original: phyi rol du dbugs ni nang du dbugs gcig gi nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i cha gcig go //
analyzed: phyi rol du dbugs ni nang du dbugs gcig gi nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i cha gcig go //
translated: Externally, the breaths are one part of the twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths internally.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽phyi rol du lo gcig ni chu tshod nyi khri chig stong drug brgyar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / phyi rol du lo gcig ni chu tshod nyi khri chig stong drug brgyar 'gyur te /
translated: Why is this?🔽Externally, the year is twenty-one thousand six hundred hours.

original: nang du nyin mtshan gcig ni dbugs @131b nyi khri chig stong drug brgyas so //
analyzed: nang du nyin mtshan gcig ni dbugs @131b nyi khri chig stong drug brgyas so //
translated: Internally, the day and night are twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths.

original: phyi rol du nyin mtshan gcig ni chu tshod sum brgya drug cus yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol du nyin mtshan gcig ni chu tshod sum brgya drug cus yin la /
translated: Externally, one day and night is 3,600 [breaths].

original: nang du dbugs sum brgya drug cus chu tshod gcig go //
analyzed: nang du dbugs sum brgya drug cus chu tshod gcig go //
translated: Internally, one hour is 360 [breaths].

original: phyi rol du chu tshod drug cus nyin mtshan gcig yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol du chu tshod drug cus nyin mtshan gcig yin la /
translated: Externally, one day and night is 60 hours.

original: chu srang drug cus chu tshod gcig go //
analyzed: chu srang drug cus chu tshod gcig go //
translated: One hour is 60 minutes.

original: phyi rol du dbugs drug gi chu srang gcig yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol du dbugs drug gi chu srang gcig yin la /
translated: Externally, one minute is six breaths.

original: de'i nang du dbugs gcig go //
analyzed: de'i nang du dbugs gcig go //
translated: Internally, one breath is one minute.

original: phyi rol du dbugs gcig gi dus tshod gang yin pa de nang du dbugs gcig gi nyi khri chig stong drug rgya'i cha gcig shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du dbugs gcig gi dus tshod gang yin pa de nang du dbugs gcig gi nyi khri chig stong drug rgya'i cha gcig shes par bya'o //
translated: Externally, the time of one breath is to be known as one-sixtieth of one breath internally.

original: chos mthun pa de'i phyir /🔽phyi rol du lo gcig la dus sbyor bcu gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos mthun pa de'i phyir / phyi rol du lo gcig la dus sbyor bcu gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Because of this similarity,🔽externally, one year is twelve double-hours.

original: nang du nyin mtshan gcig la srog gi rlung gis 'pho ba bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: nang du nyin mtshan gcig la srog gi rlung gis 'pho ba bcu gnyis so //
translated: Internally, in one day and night, the life-wind moves through twelve double-hours.

original: phyi rol du chu tshod lnga lnga'i rang bzhin du gyur pa dus sbyor bzhi stong sum brgya nyi shu lo gcig yin la nang du dbugs lnga lnga'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dus sbyor de rnams kyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du chu tshod lnga lnga'i rang bzhin du gyur pa dus sbyor bzhi stong sum brgya nyi shu lo gcig yin la nang du dbugs lnga lnga'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dus sbyor de rnams kyis shes par bya'o //
translated: Externally, the nature of five hours is one day and night, and the nature of five hundred and forty-three twenty-four-hour periods is one year. Internally, the nature of five breaths is one day and night, and the nature of five hundred and forty-three twenty-four-hour periods is one year.

original: phyi rol du chu tshod nyi khri chig stong drug brgyas lo gcig yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol du chu tshod nyi khri chig stong drug brgyas lo gcig yin la /
translated: Externally, twenty-one thousand six hundred hours is one year.

original: nang du dbugs de rnams kyis nyin mtshan gcig go //
analyzed: nang du dbugs de rnams kyis nyin mtshan gcig go //
translated: Internally, those breaths are one day and night.

original: rim pa de lta bas na chu srang la sogs pa'i grangs ni phyi dang nang du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa de lta bas na chu srang la sogs pa'i grangs ni phyi dang nang du shes par bya'o //
translated: Since it is in that order, the number of hours and so on should be understood externally and internally.

original: phyi dang nang du de lta bur gyur ba'i dus kyi tshad gang yin pa de rang rang gi tshad kyis srin bu la sogs pa rnams la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi dang nang du de lta bur gyur ba'i dus kyi tshad gang yin pa de rang rang gi tshad kyis srin bu la sogs pa rnams la rig par bya'o //
translated: The measure of time that is like that externally and internally should be understood in relation to worms and so on by their own measure.

original: de nyid bshad par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid bshad par mdzad de /
translated: That is explained:

original: 'di rnams 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di rnams 'di ltar 'gyur te /
translated: They are like this:

original: lus skyes phra rab mi dang 'byung po lha dang lha min dang // nus dang gtso bo nyin gcig srid gsum gnas dang lus kyi dbus su de bzhin no //
analyzed: lus skyes phra rab mi dang 'byung po lha dang lha min dang // nus dang gtso bo nyin gcig srid gsum gnas dang lus kyi dbus su de bzhin no //
translated: The atoms born of the body, the humans, the spirits, the gods, the demigods, the power, the principle, the day, the three worlds, the abode, and the middle of the body.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning:

original: phyi rol du lo'i bye brag ji lta ba de bzhin du srog gi rlung gis kun tu spyod pas nang du rnal 'byor pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du lo'i bye brag ji lta ba de bzhin du srog gi rlung gis kun tu spyod pas nang du rnal 'byor pas rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as there are distinctions of years externally, so too should the yogi know internally the conduct of the life-force wind.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyis shambhala'i yul du sprul pa'i sku bzhengs pa dang / kla klo'i chos dar ba dang / skar rtsis la sogs pa'i mdor bsdus ni gsal po yin te /
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyis shambhala'i yul du sprul pa'i sku bzhengs pa dang / kla klo'i chos dar ba dang / skar rtsis la sogs pa'i mdor bsdus ni gsal po yin te /
translated: Now, the arising of the emanation body of Bhagavat Manjushri in the land of Shambhala, the spread of the barbarian religion, and the brief summary of astrology and so forth are clear.

original: lo ni 'di nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: lo ni 'di nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning from From this year... up to

original: drag po la sogs lha rnams kyis so zhes bya ba'i mthar /
analyzed: drag po la sogs lha rnams kyis so zhes bya ba'i mthar /
translated: ...by the gods such as Rudra and so forth.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bdun cu rtsa brgyad kyi don ni legs par bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bdun cu rtsa brgyad kyi don ni legs par bstan to //
translated: The meaning of seventy-eight verses is well explained.

original: da ni 'jig rten pa'i don bsgrub pa'i phyir dbyangs 'byung bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten pa'i don bsgrub pa'i phyir dbyangs 'byung bar gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to accomplish worldly purposes, the arising of the vowels is stated:

original: aa sogs dbyangs lnga gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: aa sogs dbyangs lnga gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The five vowels such as a and so forth,

original: yi ge aa la sogs pa'i dbyangs lnga gang yin pa de sa chu me rlung nam mkha'i rang @132a * //🔽bzhin du gyur pa yin yang /
analyzed: yi ge aa la sogs pa'i dbyangs lnga gang yin pa de sa chu me rlung nam mkha'i rang @132a * // bzhin du gyur pa yin yang /
translated: whatever they are, are the nature of earth, water, fire, wind, and space.

original: de rnams kyis kyang tshes dga' mo la sogs pa lnga la byin gyis rlob par byed de /
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang tshes dga' mo la sogs pa lnga la byin gyis rlob par byed de /
translated: Even though they are like that, they also bless the five lunar days such as the first day of the lunar month.

original: de bzhin du yon tan dang yang na aa ti sha'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bcu ni yang tshes dga' mo la sogs pa rnams la shar bar gyur pa'o /
analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan dang yang na aa ti sha'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bcu ni yang tshes dga' mo la sogs pa rnams la shar bar gyur pa'o /
translated: In the same way, the ten lunar days such as the first day of the lunar month arise in the nature of the qualities or Atisha.

original: tshes de rnams la bkra shis la sogs pa'i gza' rnams su ma gyur pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: tshes de rnams la bkra shis la sogs pa'i gza' rnams su ma gyur pa de lta na ni /
translated: If those lunar days are not the planets such as the auspicious planet,

original: dbyangs dang tshes de'i mthus don 'grub par 'gyur gyi gzhan du na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbyangs dang tshes de'i mthus don 'grub par 'gyur gyi gzhan du na ni ma yin no //
translated: then the purpose will be accomplished by the power of the vowels and the lunar days, but not otherwise.

original: de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i rgyu skar dang ldan par gyur pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i rgyu skar dang ldan par gyur pa de lta na ni /
translated: In the same way, if they are endowed with the inauspicious lunar mansions,

original: don mi 'grub par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: don mi 'grub par shes par bya'o //
translated: then the purpose will not be accomplished.

original: don de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: don de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That very meaning is stated:

original: aa sogs dbyangs lnga gang yin dang po'i tshes kyi dbang gis dga' ma la sogs sbyor ba lnga //
analyzed: aa sogs dbyangs lnga gang yin dang po'i tshes kyi dbang gis dga' ma la sogs sbyor ba lnga //
translated: The five vowels beginning with a are the five unions with the beloved, such as the Joyful, by the power of the first lunar day.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad dgus dbyangs de rnams kyi skye ba'i gnas dang mtshan nyid la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad dgus dbyangs de rnams kyi skye ba'i gnas dang mtshan nyid la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, with nine verses, it teaches the places of origin, characteristics, and so forth of those vowels.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i don 'grub pa'i zhu ba ni rnal 'byor bas shes par bya ste ;
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i don 'grub pa'i zhu ba ni rnal 'byor bas shes par bya ste ;
translated: Similarly, the yogī should understand the request for the accomplishment of the meaning of worldly virtue and nonvirtue.

original: der rtsa g-yas pa dang g-yon par srog gi rlung gi kun tu rgyu ba'i spyod par rig par bya zhing /
analyzed: der rtsa g-yas pa dang g-yon par srog gi rlung gi kun tu rgyu ba'i spyod par rig par bya zhing /
translated: There, the conduct of the movement of the life-force wind in the right and left channels should be known.

original: de la gal te rtsa g-yas pa'i stong pa'i dkyil 'khor las dus kyi me shar bar gyur pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te rtsa g-yas pa'i stong pa'i dkyil 'khor las dus kyi me shar bar gyur pa de lta na ni /
translated: If the fire of time arises from the mandala of emptiness in the right channel,

original: 'khrugs pa'i gnas su zhugs par byas pa'i mi de 'chi bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrugs pa'i gnas su zhugs par byas pa'i mi de 'chi bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: then that person who has entered the state of agitation will die.

original: de bzhin du rlung gi dkyil 'khor las nyi ma shar bar gyur pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung gi dkyil 'khor las nyi ma shar bar gyur pa de lta na ni /
translated: Similarly, if the sun arises from the mandala of wind,

original: bcom par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bcom par gyur pa'o //
translated: then he will be destroyed.

original: me'i dkyil 'khor la bkra shis shar bar gyur pa de lta na ni rmas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: me'i dkyil 'khor la bkra shis shar bar gyur pa de lta na ni rmas par gyur pa'o //
translated: If it rises in the fire maṇḍala, it is a wound.

original: chu 'di dkyil 'khor las phur bu dang gza' lhag shar bar gyur pa de lta na ni mthun par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chu 'di dkyil 'khor las phur bu dang gza' lhag shar bar gyur pa de lta na ni mthun par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If it rises in the water maṇḍala, it is a nail or Jupiter, and it is favorable.

original: sa'i dkyil 'khor las dman par gyur pa ni spen par gyur pa de lta na ni yul du 'khrug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa'i dkyil 'khor las dman par gyur pa ni spen par gyur pa de lta na ni yul du 'khrug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it rises in the earth maṇḍala, it is Saturn, and it is a quarrel in the country.

original: de bzhin du nad pa la ni stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la ni sogs pa la grangs ji lta bas 'chi ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang rma dang bde ba dang ma nyams pa nyid ces bya ba ni zhu ba pos zhus na nad rnams la 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nad pa la ni stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la ni sogs pa la grangs ji lta bas 'chi ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang rma dang bde ba dang ma nyams pa nyid ces bya ba ni zhu ba pos zhus na nad rnams la 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Similarly, for a patient, in the empty maṇḍala, and so on, according to the number, it is death, affliction, a wound, happiness, and no harm, respectively.

original: de bzhin du rtsa g-yon pa'i stong pa'i dkyil 'khor las gal te sgra gcan shar bar gyur pa de lta na ni zhu ba po'i dgra g-yul du nyams par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa g-yon pa'i stong pa'i dkyil 'khor las gal te sgra gcan shar bar gyur pa de lta na ni zhu ba po'i dgra g-yul du nyams par gyur pa'o //
translated: If Rāhu rises in the left channel in the empty maṇḍala, the inquirer’s enemy will be defeated in battle.

original: rtsa g-yon pa'i dkyil 'khor las zla ba la sogs pa shar ba de lta na ni bcom pa la sogs pa g-yul gyi gnas su shes par bya'o /
analyzed: rtsa g-yon pa'i dkyil 'khor las zla ba la sogs pa shar ba de lta na ni bcom pa la sogs pa g-yul gyi gnas su shes par bya'o /
translated: If the moon, etc., rise in the mandala of the left channel, then one should know that the battle will be a defeat, etc.🔽Thus, it will be the result of virtue if one goes to a wedding or a feast.

original: 'di ltar mgron dang bag ma len par @132b dge ba'i 'bras bur 'gyur te g-yon lam gza' rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni zhu ba'i dus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mgron dang bag ma len par @132b dge ba'i 'bras bur 'gyur te g-yon lam gza' rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni zhu ba'i dus so //
translated: The grahas in the left path are the waning period.🔽Similarly, the waning period is the time when the planets are in the left path.

original: de bzhin du zhu ba pos yi ge rnams gang brjod pa de bcus bsgres nas bcu gnyis bsre bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhu ba pos yi ge rnams gang brjod pa de bcus bsgres nas bcu gnyis bsre bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should add twelve to whatever letter is uttered by the petitioner and divide by ten.

original: phyi nas lngas bsgres nas zhub po dor nas nye bar gnas pa'i mi bsre bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nas lngas bsgres nas zhub po dor nas nye bar gnas pa'i mi bsre bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having subtracted the petitioner, one should add the remaining person.

original: bdun gyis bcad nas mi mnyam pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i nyi ma la sogs pa lhag mar gyur pa de lta na ni don grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdun gyis bcad nas mi mnyam pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i nyi ma la sogs pa lhag mar gyur pa de lta na ni don grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the remaining planets, etc., have an uneven nature, then the goal will not be accomplished.

original: de nas mnyam pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa zla ba la sogs pa de lta na ni don grub par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mnyam pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa zla ba la sogs pa de lta na ni don grub par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: If the remaining moon, etc., have an even nature, then the goal will be accomplished.

original: de bzhin dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa'i dus su gal te zhu bar gyur pa de lta na ni grangs ji lta bas don mi 'grub pa dang 'grub par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa'i dus su gal te zhu bar gyur pa de lta na ni grangs ji lta bas don mi 'grub pa dang 'grub par shes par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, if the dissolution occurs at the time of the exhalation and inhalation of breath, then one should know that the meaning is not accomplished or is accomplished according to the number.

original: de gang gis shes she na rnal 'byor ldan pas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de gang gis shes she na rnal 'byor ldan pas shes par bya'o //
translated: By what is that known? It should be known by one who is endowed with yoga.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: las shes dus rtsar gnas pa'i nyin mo'i dbang gis zla ba nyi ma grub byas la //
analyzed: las shes dus rtsar gnas pa'i nyin mo'i dbang gis zla ba nyi ma grub byas la //
translated: the moon and sun are accomplished by the power of the day abiding in the nāḍīs of the life and downward-voiding [vāyus].

original: gzhan ma rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i don gang bshad par byed pa de la skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gzhan ma rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i don gang bshad par byed pa de la skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the fault of explaining the meaning of virtue and nonvirtue of the others?

original: da ltar byung ba ma shes pas ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i 'bras bu 'jig rten 'dir ni gang gis brjod //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ma shes pas ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i 'bras bu 'jig rten 'dir ni gang gis brjod //
translated: Since the present is not known, by what is the result of virtue and nonvirtue explained in this world?

original: long ba des ni long ba khrid las glang chen seng+ges gang ba'i nags tshal 'jug par byed /
analyzed: long ba des ni long ba khrid las glang chen seng+ges gang ba'i nags tshal 'jug par byed /
translated: The blind lead the blind, and they enter the forest filled with elephants and lions.

original: ces bya'o // gal te srog gi rlung gi mtshan nyid mi shes pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: ces bya'o // gal te srog gi rlung gi mtshan nyid mi shes pa de lta na ni /
translated: If the characteristics of the prāṇa vāyu are not known,

original: skar rtsis kyi sgo yis dge ba dang mi dge ba bstan par bya'o //🔽de la yang skye ba'i dus sbyor dang / bdun pa la gal te dus kyi me la sogs par de lta na ni zhu ba po la 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skar rtsis kyi sgo yis dge ba dang mi dge ba bstan par bya'o // de la yang skye ba'i dus sbyor dang / bdun pa la gal te dus kyi me la sogs par de lta na ni zhu ba po la 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One should indicate the virtuous and non-virtuous [aspects] by means of astrology.🔽 There, if the ascendant and the seventh house are in the sign of Aries, etc., then for the questioner there will be the suffering of death, etc.

original: de nas sgra gcan la sogs par gyur pa de lta na ni dgra 'chi ba la sogs par gyur pa'o ;
analyzed: de nas sgra gcan la sogs par gyur pa de lta na ni dgra 'chi ba la sogs par gyur pa'o ;
translated: If [the ascendant and the seventh house] are in Rahu, etc., then there will be the suffering of death, etc., of an enemy.

original: / gzhan yang zhu ba'i dus su gza' skar bzang ba dang / g-yon gyi rtsa 'bab pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: / gzhan yang zhu ba'i dus su gza' skar bzang ba dang / g-yon gyi rtsa 'bab pa de lta na ni /
translated: Moreover, if the time of the question is an auspicious day and the left channel is flowing, then

original: nges par don ni thams cad 'grub /
analyzed: nges par don ni thams cad 'grub /
translated: all aims will certainly be accomplished.

original: ces bya'o // de bzhin du tha skar la sogs pa'i rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa bdun sum char byas nas /
analyzed: ces bya'o // de bzhin du tha skar la sogs pa'i rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa bdun sum char byas nas /
translated: Similarly, having divided the twenty-seven lunar mansions such as Āśleṣā into three parts,

original: cha dang po'am cha gnyis par mi mnyam pa'i skar ma la gal te gza' mi mnyam par gyur pa de lta na ni 'thab mo'am nad pa 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: cha dang po'am cha gnyis par mi mnyam pa'i skar ma la gal te gza' mi mnyam par gyur pa de lta na ni 'thab mo'am nad pa 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: if the first or second part is an uneven lunar mansion and the planet is uneven, then there will be fighting, illness, or death.🔽 🔽If the first or second part is an even lunar mansion and the planet is even, then all aims will be accomplished.

original: de nas gza' mnyam pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: de nas gza' mnyam pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa de lta na ni /
translated: Then, when the planets become of equal nature,

original: rgyal ba dang nad sod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba dang nad sod par gyur pa'o //
translated: there is victory and the curing of illness.

original: de bzhin du mi rnams kyi tshe ni mdor bsdus pa kho nar brgya rtsa brgyad yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rnams kyi tshe ni mdor bsdus pa kho nar brgya rtsa brgyad yin la /
translated: In the same way, the lifespan of humans is exactly one hundred and eight years.

original: de rnams la nyi ma la sogs pas @133a * //
analyzed: de rnams la nyi ma la sogs pas @133a * //
translated: The sun and so on

original: longs spyod par byed do //
analyzed: longs spyod par byed do //
translated: enjoy that.

original: de la rags pa'i gnas skabs su nyi ma la drug dang zla ba la bco lnga dang / bkra shis la brgyad dang gza' lhag la bcu bdun dang / spen pa la bcu dang / phur bu la bcu dgu dang / sgra gcan la bcu gnyis ngang pa sangs la nyi shu rtsa gcig go //
analyzed: de la rags pa'i gnas skabs su nyi ma la drug dang zla ba la bco lnga dang / bkra shis la brgyad dang gza' lhag la bcu bdun dang / spen pa la bcu dang / phur bu la bcu dgu dang / sgra gcan la bcu gnyis ngang pa sangs la nyi shu rtsa gcig go //
translated: In the gross state, the sun has six, the moon fifteen, Bṛhaspati eight, Śukra seventeen, Śani ten, Rāhu nineteen, and Jīva twenty-one.

original: de rnams las nyi ma la sogs pa'i mi mnyam pa'i gza' rnams kyi lo ji tsam du gyur pa dus de tsam bar du nyon mongs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams las nyi ma la sogs pa'i mi mnyam pa'i gza' rnams kyi lo ji tsam du gyur pa dus de tsam bar du nyon mongs par gyur pa'o //
translated: The unequal planets, the sun and so on, are afflicted for as many years as their time.

original: zhi ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa zla ba la sogs pa mnyam pa ni zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa zla ba la sogs pa mnyam pa ni zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: The equal planets, the moon and so on, which are of a peaceful nature, are pacifiers.

original: de la phra ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gnas skabs su nyi ma'i lo drug la zla ba la sogs pas longs spyod par byed cing /
analyzed: de la phra ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gnas skabs su nyi ma'i lo drug la zla ba la sogs pas longs spyod par byed cing /
translated: In the state of subtle nature, the sun is enjoyed by the moon and so forth for six solar years.

original: zla ba la sogs pa'i lo rnams nyi ma la sogs pas longs spyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba la sogs pa'i lo rnams nyi ma la sogs pas longs spyod par byed pa'o //
translated: The lunar years and so forth are enjoyed by the sun and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi sa bon du gyur pa'i yi ge rnams ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sa bon du gyur pa'i yi ge rnams ni /
translated: The seed syllables of those are

original: dbyangs dang gsal byed du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dbyangs dang gsal byed du shes par bya'o //
translated: to be known as vowels and consonants.

original: don de ni de lta bu gang yin pa de nyid ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yon tan bcu gnyis kyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: don de ni de lta bu gang yin pa de nyid ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yon tan bcu gnyis kyis shes par bya'o //
translated: That meaning is to be known by the twelve qualities of dependent origination, such as ignorance.

original: de bzhin du phyogs brgyad kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sa la 'bru'i 'khor lo dang / gza'i 'khor lo shes par byas la gal te /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs brgyad kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sa la 'bru'i 'khor lo dang / gza'i 'khor lo shes par byas la gal te /
translated: In that way, having understood the wheel of the stars and the wheel of the grains on the ground of the nature of the eight directions, if

original: nyi ma la sogs pa'i mi mnyam pa'i gza' rnams rang la rgyab dang g-yas su gyur pa dang / dgra la mdun dang g-yon du gyur pa dang / de lta na ni dgra rnams gsod par byed do //🔽de bzhin du zla ba la sogs pa mnyam pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa /
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pa'i mi mnyam pa'i gza' rnams rang la rgyab dang g-yas su gyur pa dang / dgra la mdun dang g-yon du gyur pa dang / de lta na ni dgra rnams gsod par byed do // de bzhin du zla ba la sogs pa mnyam pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa /
translated: In that way, one slays the enemies.🔽Similarly, the even planets such as the moon, etc., are in the front and left of oneself, and in the back and right of the enemy.

original: rang la mdun dang g-yon du gyur pa dang / dgra la rgyab dang g-yas su gyur pa de lta na ni don snga ma bzhin du byed do //
analyzed: rang la mdun dang g-yon du gyur pa dang / dgra la rgyab dang g-yas su gyur pa de lta na ni don snga ma bzhin du byed do //
translated: In that way, one does the former thing.

original: rim pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma la sogs pa ni gal te g-yas dang / rgyab tu gyur pa de lta na ni dgra la sogs pa gsod par byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rim pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma la sogs pa ni gal te g-yas dang / rgyab tu gyur pa de lta na ni dgra la sogs pa gsod par byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: In that order, the yoginis, etc., are in the right and back of oneself, and in the front and left of the enemy. In that way, one slays the enemies, etc.

original: de nas gal te gdug pa dang zhi ba'i gza' la sogs pa ni dus gcig tu g-yas dang rgyab tu mdun dang g-yon du rang dang dgra la gnas par gyur pa de lta na ni stobs gnyis bcom par byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nas gal te gdug pa dang zhi ba'i gza' la sogs pa ni dus gcig tu g-yas dang rgyab tu mdun dang g-yon du rang dang dgra la gnas par gyur pa de lta na ni stobs gnyis bcom par byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: Then, if the fierce and peaceful planets, etc., are in the right and back, and in the front and left, of oneself and the enemy, respectively, in that way, one conquers the two powers.

original: gzhan yang tshangs mo la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma brgyad char shar la sogs pa la tshes gcig la sogs pa'i dbye bas shar ba la sogs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshangs mo la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma brgyad char shar la sogs pa la tshes gcig la sogs pa'i dbye bas shar ba la sogs par shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should know that the eight yoginis, such as Brahma, arise in the east, etc., and that they arise in the east, etc., by the divisions of the first day of the lunar month, etc.

original: de bzhin du dkar po'i phyogs kyi tshes bzhi dang tshes brgyad dang / bcu gcig dang nya la shar la sogs pa'i phyogs dang / nag po'i @133b phyogs kyi tshes gsum dang tshes bdun dang tshes bcu dang tshes bcu bzhi la me'i mtshams la sogs pa las ke'i kang 'char bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dkar po'i phyogs kyi tshes bzhi dang tshes brgyad dang / bcu gcig dang nya la shar la sogs pa'i phyogs dang / nag po'i @133b phyogs kyi tshes gsum dang tshes bdun dang tshes bcu dang tshes bcu bzhi la me'i mtshams la sogs pa las ke'i kang 'char bar 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, on the fourth, eighth, eleventh, and fifteenth days of the bright fortnight, the asterisms arise in the east, etc., and on the third, seventh, tenth, and fourteenth days of the dark fortnight, they arise in the south, etc.

original: shar ba'i phyogs de rnams shes nas bya ba 'grub pa dang mi 'grub par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: shar ba'i phyogs de rnams shes nas bya ba 'grub pa dang mi 'grub par shes par bya'o //
translated: Knowing those directions of the asterisms, one should know whether one's actions will be successful or not.

original: de bzhin du lo'i drag po dang / bgrod pa'i drag po dang / zla ba'i drag po dang ; phyogs kyi drag po dang / nyin mtshan gyi drag po dang / dus kyi drag po ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lo'i drag po dang / bgrod pa'i drag po dang / zla ba'i drag po dang ; phyogs kyi drag po dang / nyin mtshan gyi drag po dang / dus kyi drag po ste /
translated: Similarly, there are the fierce days of the year, the fierce days of the month, the fierce days of the lunar mansion, the fierce days of the direction, the fierce days of the day and night, and the fierce days of the season.

original: rnam pa drug tu de yang rnal 'byor pas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa drug tu de yang rnal 'byor pas shes par bya'o //
translated: The yogi should know this in six ways.

original: de bzhin du thun mtshams phyed kyi sgra gcan gyi stobs ni phyogs dang phyogs mtshams la 'khor bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du thun mtshams phyed kyi sgra gcan gyi stobs ni phyogs dang phyogs mtshams la 'khor bar shes par bya ste /
translated: Similarly, one should know that the strength of Rāhu at the end of the half-periods moves through the directions and intermediate directions.

original: de shes nas 'khrug pa'i dus su rgyal ba dang pham par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de shes nas 'khrug pa'i dus su rgyal ba dang pham par rig par bya'o //
translated: Knowing this, one should know victory and defeat in the time of conflict.

original: de bzhin du gnyis 'thab pa'i dus su yi ge gsum dang ldan pa'i ming gis yi ge gnyis dang ldan par gyur pa'i ming can ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis 'thab pa'i dus su yi ge gsum dang ldan pa'i ming gis yi ge gnyis dang ldan par gyur pa'i ming can ni /
translated: Similarly, in the time of the battle of the two, the one with a name endowed with three syllables and the one with a name endowed with two syllables,

original: pham pa dang bcom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pham pa dang bcom par 'gyur ro //
translated: the defeated and the conquered will be as follows.

original: de bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba'i dus su gang gis zhus par byas pa dang / dbugs 'jug pa'i dus su zhu ba po ni grangs ji lta bus pham pa dang rgyal bar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba'i dus su gang gis zhus par byas pa dang / dbugs 'jug pa'i dus su zhu ba po ni grangs ji lta bus pham pa dang rgyal bar gyur ba'o //
translated: Similarly, at the time of exhalation, the one who asks and at the time of inhalation, the questioner, by whatever number, will be defeated or victorious.

original: 'di dag la sogs pa'i nang nas nan tan gyi sgra gcan gyi mtshan nyid shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag la sogs pa'i nang nas nan tan gyi sgra gcan gyi mtshan nyid shes par bya ste /
translated: From among these and so forth, one should know the characteristics of the serious Rāhu.

original: dus ni 'thab mo'i sa yang rung rgyal po rnams kyi g-yas dang g-yon du gal te mun pa can gyur na /
analyzed: dus ni 'thab mo'i sa yang rung rgyal po rnams kyi g-yas dang g-yon du gal te mun pa can gyur na /
translated: The time of battle is also the time of the gods. If Rahu is on the right or left of the kings,

original: g-yul du lha'i mgon po seng ge dbang dang bcas pa mi rnams kyis ni bcom //
analyzed: g-yul du lha'i mgon po seng ge dbang dang bcas pa mi rnams kyis ni bcom //
translated: then the gods, the lords of the battle, together with the lion, are defeated by men.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'khor ba'i dbang gis gal te g-yas su mjug ma'i sgra gcan dang / g-yon du gdong ba'i sgra gcan g-yul du gyur pa de lta na ni sgra gcan gyi stobs des khyab 'jug dang drag po ni lhan cig tu mi rnams kyis kyang bcom par byed do ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'khor ba'i dbang gis gal te g-yas su mjug ma'i sgra gcan dang / g-yon du gdong ba'i sgra gcan g-yul du gyur pa de lta na ni sgra gcan gyi stobs des khyab 'jug dang drag po ni lhan cig tu mi rnams kyis kyang bcom par byed do ;
translated: Here, if Rahu is on the right in the form of Ketu, and on the left in the form of Rāhu, then by the power of Rahu, Viṣṇu and Śiva are defeated together by men.

original: / de bas na 'di ltar dpal ldan rtsa ba'i sgra gcan bla ma'i tshig la gnas par dus kyi 'khor lor shes par bya'o //
analyzed: / de bas na 'di ltar dpal ldan rtsa ba'i sgra gcan bla ma'i tshig la gnas par dus kyi 'khor lor shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in this way, the glorious root Rahu should be known in the Kālacakra as abiding in the words of the guru.

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams ke'u kang drag po gza' tshogs dang bcas dbyangs bcas shar //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams ke'u kang drag po gza' tshogs dang bcas dbyangs bcas shar //
translated: The yoginīs, Kṛṣṇa, Śiva, and the hosts of planets, together with the vowels, rise.

original: de rnams dor nas srid gsum rgyal bas rgyal po rnams kyis gcig pu gzung bar bya //
analyzed: de rnams dor nas srid gsum rgyal bas rgyal po rnams kyis gcig pu gzung bar bya //
translated: Having abandoned them, the Victorious Ones of the three worlds should be taken by the kings as one.

original: gang gis nyi zla zos pa lha rnams 'jigs byed drag po'i rnam pa mig sman dang 'dra ba //
analyzed: gang gis nyi zla zos pa lha rnams 'jigs byed drag po'i rnam pa mig sman dang 'dra ba //
translated: The gods, who are fierce in their fear of swallowing the sun and moon, are like collyrium.

original: sa yi shar dang nub tu 'khor zhing nyin mo'i dus su lho dang byang rnams dag tu'o //
analyzed: sa yi shar dang nub tu 'khor zhing nyin mo'i dus su lho dang byang rnams dag tu'o //
translated: They circle in the east and west of the earth, and in the south and north during the day.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is said.

original: khyad par du gyur par gsungs zhes bya ba'o //🔽de nas g-yul nas dgra bcom zhes bya ba la @134a * //
analyzed: khyad par du gyur par gsungs zhes bya ba'o // de nas g-yul nas dgra bcom zhes bya ba la @134a * //
translated: It is said to be special.

original: sogs pa nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: sogs pa nas brtsams nas /
translated: Then, starting from the arhat who was defeated in battle,🔽up to the fifteen verses beginning with wherever he is led,

original: gang dang gang du khrid pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bco lngas sgyogs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin gshegs pas gang gsungs pa des bdag cag la dgos pa med de /
analyzed: gang dang gang du khrid pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bco lngas sgyogs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin gshegs pas gang gsungs pa des bdag cag la dgos pa med de /
translated: the characteristics of catapults and so on that were taught by the Tathagata are not necessary for us.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa dang bral ba dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mdzad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa dang bral ba dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mdzad pa yin gyi /
translated: It is the deed of bodhisattvas who are free from afflictions and so on, and who accomplish the welfare of others.

original: rang gi don 'ba' zhig grub par 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi don 'ba' zhig grub par 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not one who desires to accomplish his own aim alone, nor is he one who is endowed with hatred, etc.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That very thing is stated:

original: gdug rnams bsgrub pa'i don dang / mchog gis steng du ni chos byed rgyal bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gdug rnams bsgrub pa'i don dang / mchog gis steng du ni chos byed rgyal bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of establishing the wicked, and for the sake of the highest, he is the Victorious One, the Dharma-maker.

original: sngon brjod dang po'i sangs rgyas las ni srid gsum bla mas zla ba bzang po la ni thams cad gang //
analyzed: sngon brjod dang po'i sangs rgyas las ni srid gsum bla mas zla ba bzang po la ni thams cad gang //
translated: From the first Buddha, the Lord of the Three Existences, the good moon, all things are filled.

original: de dbus cung zad yul 'dir gsal bar bdag gis da ltar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dbus cung zad yul 'dir gsal bar bdag gis da ltar bstan pa'o //
translated: In the middle of that, I have now taught a little bit in this country.

original: rang gnas bsrung ba'i don du 'di dag ma lus gyis shig zhe sdang chags pas ma yin mi dbang kye //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gnas bsrung ba'i don du 'di dag ma lus gyis shig zhe sdang chags pas ma yin mi dbang kye // zhes bya ba la /
translated: For the sake of protecting one's own place, do all of these, not out of hatred or desire, O Lord of Men!

original: gdug pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la gnod par byed pa dang / 'dul dka' bar gyur pa'i mu stegs pa rnams yin la /
analyzed: gdug pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la gnod par byed pa dang / 'dul dka' bar gyur pa'i mu stegs pa rnams yin la /
translated: The wicked are those who harm sentient beings and are difficult to tame, the tīrthikas.

original: de rnams gdul ba'i phyir dang sdig pa dang bral ba'i phyir skyes bu dam pa rnams rgyal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams gdul ba'i phyir dang sdig pa dang bral ba'i phyir skyes bu dam pa rnams rgyal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to tame them and to free them from evil, the holy beings will be victorious.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas sngon du rgyud kyi rgyal po mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las dpal phyag na rdo rje'i sprul pa'i sku zla ba bzang po la don gang bka' stsal la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas sngon du rgyud kyi rgyal po mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las dpal phyag na rdo rje'i sprul pa'i sku zla ba bzang po la don gang bka' stsal la /
translated: The Bhagavān Śākyamuni previously taught to the emanation of Śrī Vajrapāṇi, the good moon, the meaning from the supreme king of tantras, the original buddha.

original: de nyid bdag 'jam dpal gyis yul shambhala la sogs pa bsrung ba'i phyir rgyud kyi rgyal po bsdus pa'i rgyud 'dir bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: de nyid bdag 'jam dpal gyis yul shambhala la sogs pa bsrung ba'i phyir rgyud kyi rgyal po bsdus pa'i rgyud 'dir bstan pa yin la /
translated: That very meaning was taught by me, Mañjuśrī, in this condensed tantra, the king of tantras, in order to protect the land of Shambhala and so forth.

original: don de nyid ni nyi ma'i shing rta khyod kyis zhe sdang la sogs pa dor nas sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir byed par gnang bar 'gyur gyi zhe sdang la sogs pa'i sems dang rang gi don 'grub pa'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: don de nyid ni nyi ma'i shing rta khyod kyis zhe sdang la sogs pa dor nas sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir byed par gnang bar 'gyur gyi zhe sdang la sogs pa'i sems dang rang gi don 'grub pa'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: You, Sūryaratha, having abandoned anger and so forth, will be permitted to act in order to benefit sentient beings, but not with a mind of anger and so forth in order to accomplish your own purpose.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyis 'jig rten gyi bden pas 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mtshan nyid dang / skar rtsis la sogs pa bstan par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyis 'jig rten gyi bden pas 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mtshan nyid dang / skar rtsis la sogs pa bstan par mdzad nas /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavat Manjusri, by means of worldly truth, taught the characteristics of the world, astrology, and so forth.

original: yul shambhala'i yon tan dang kla klo dang lhan cig tu 'khrug pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos dar ba la sogs pa bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: yul shambhala'i yon tan dang kla klo dang lhan cig tu 'khrug pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos dar ba la sogs pa bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Then, he taught the qualities of the land of Shambhala, the war with the barbarians, the spread of the Buddha's teaching, and so forth.

original: chang dang lan tshva'i mtsho dbus thub pa'i sa yi gnas su las kyi @134b sar ni yang dag gnas pa'o //
analyzed: chang dang lan tshva'i mtsho dbus thub pa'i sa yi gnas su las kyi @134b sar ni yang dag gnas pa'o //
translated: In the middle of the ocean of beer and salt, in the place of the Sage, the land of Karma is situated.

original: dpag tshad 'bum phrag gsum la mi yi bdag po nyi ma'i dum bur rim par 'khor //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dpag tshad 'bum phrag gsum la mi yi bdag po nyi ma'i dum bur rim par 'khor // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The lord of men, the sun, moves in stages three hundred thousand leagues.

original: chang gi rgya mtsho dang lan tshva ba'i rgya mtsho'i bar du 'dzam bu gling gang yin pa de las kyi sar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chang gi rgya mtsho dang lan tshva ba'i rgya mtsho'i bar du 'dzam bu gling gang yin pa de las kyi sar shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the land of Karma should be known as the Jambudvipa between the ocean of beer and the ocean of salt.

original: de yang rgya'i tshad gyis  'bum phrag gsum gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang rgya'i tshad gyis  'bum phrag gsum gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa yin la /
translated: And that has the nature of three hundred thousand leagues.

original: de nyid gling dang nye ba'i gling gi dbye bas dum bu bcu gnyis rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gling dang nye ba'i gling gi dbye bas dum bu bcu gnyis rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
translated: That itself, divided into continents and subcontinents, becomes the twelve sectors.

original: dum bu bcu gnyis po de la dus sbyor gyi dbye bas nyi ma 'khor ba ji lta ba de bzhin du mi'i bdag po bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor los 'khor bar mdzad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dum bu bcu gnyis po de la dus sbyor gyi dbye bas nyi ma 'khor ba ji lta ba de bzhin du mi'i bdag po bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor los 'khor bar mdzad ces bya ba'o //
translated: Just as the sun moves through the twelve sectors, dividing the day into periods, in the same way the Lord of men, the Bhagavat Kalacakra, moves through the twelve sectors.

original: dum bu re re'i tshad ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: dum bu re re'i tshad ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of each sector?

original: dum bu gcig ni nor bdag dang bcas dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu lnga dag go //
analyzed: dum bu gcig ni nor bdag dang bcas dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu lnga dag go //
translated: One sector is twenty-five thousand leagues, together with the lord of riches.

original: de dbus mchog gi gangs ris phyogs rnams bskor ba'i ke la sha ri'o //
analyzed: de dbus mchog gi gangs ris phyogs rnams bskor ba'i ke la sha ri'o //
translated: In the middle of that, the supreme snow-capped mountain, Kailash, is surrounded by the directions.

original: zhes bya ba ni dpag tshad 'bum phrag gsum las cha bcu gnyis kyis thob pa'i dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga ni dum bu re re'i phyogs brgyad kyi tshad shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dpag tshad 'bum phrag gsum las cha bcu gnyis kyis thob pa'i dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga ni dum bu re re'i phyogs brgyad kyi tshad shes par bya'o //
translated: Twenty-five thousand leagues should be known as the measure of the eight directions of each sector, obtained by dividing three hundred thousand leagues into twelve parts.

original: de rnams kyi nang nas 'dzam bu gling chung ngu'i dbus su ri ke la sha gnas te ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang nas 'dzam bu gling chung ngu'i dbus su ri ke la sha gnas te ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: Among them, in the center of the small Jambudvipa, is the Kailash mountain. How is it?

original: gangs ris phyogs rnams kyis bskor zhes bya ba ni shar phyogs nas brtsams nas nub phyogs kyi bar du gangs kyi ris bskor ba'o //
analyzed: gangs ris phyogs rnams kyis bskor zhes bya ba ni shar phyogs nas brtsams nas nub phyogs kyi bar du gangs kyi ris bskor ba'o //
translated: The text says, It is surrounded by snow mountains in the directions. Beginning from the east and going up to the west, it is surrounded by snow mountains.

original: de'i tshad gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshad gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is its size?

original: sa la gangs ri dang bcas ke la sha yi dum bu de yi sum cha kun nas so //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa la gangs ri dang bcas ke la sha yi dum bu de yi sum cha kun nas so // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The text says, The part of the earth with snow mountains and Kailash is one-third of it all around.

original: khor yug gi dpag tshad de las sum cha ni gangs ri dang ke la sha'i tshad do //
analyzed: khor yug gi dpag tshad de las sum cha ni gangs ri dang ke la sha'i tshad do //
translated: One-third of the 1,000 yojanas of the outer rim is the size of the snow mountains and Kailash.

original: phyi rol 'dab ma re rer nyin byed yul dang gling dang yul rnams kyis ni brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol 'dab ma re rer nyin byed yul dang gling dang yul rnams kyis ni brgyan pa'o //
translated: The text says, The outer petals are adorned with the lands of the sun, continents, and countries.

original: zhes bya ba ni gling dang nye ba'i gling dang bcu gnyis kyis brgyan pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gling dang nye ba'i gling dang bcu gnyis kyis brgyan pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: It is adorned with the twelve continents and subcontinents.

original: g-yas phyed la ni thub mchog gnas yin bye ba grong khyer gnas la shambhala //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: g-yas phyed la ni thub mchog gnas yin bye ba grong khyer gnas la shambhala //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The text says, The right half is the abode of the supreme sages, and the city of millions is Shambhala.

original: gangs ri dang ke la sha'i g-yas phyogs su grong khyer bye ba phrag gi rang bzhin du gyur pa sham bha la zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gangs ri dang ke la sha'i g-yas phyogs su grong khyer bye ba phrag gi rang bzhin du gyur pa sham bha la zhes bya ste /
translated: To the right of the snow mountains and the Kailash, there is a country called Shambhala, which is the nature of ten million cities.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i snod du rung ba'i skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i snod du rung ba'i skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called the abode of holy beings who are suitable vessels for the Mahamudra.

original: yul ji lta bu brjod ce na /
analyzed: yul ji lta bu brjod ce na /
translated: What is the nature of the country?

original: bye ba grong gis bskor ba'i yul du 'gyur zhing grong khyer 'bum gyis dkyil 'khor lo'o //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bye ba grong gis bskor ba'i yul du 'gyur zhing grong khyer 'bum gyis dkyil 'khor lo'o // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is a country surrounded by ten million cities, and the mandala is surrounded by one hundred thousand cities.

original: grong rdal bye ba phrag gcig ni yul du brjod do //
analyzed: grong rdal bye ba phrag gcig ni yul du brjod do //
translated: One hundred million cities is called a country.

original: 'bum phrag gcig ni dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'o //🔽de dag @135a * //
analyzed: 'bum phrag gcig ni dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'o // de dag @135a * //
translated: One hundred thousand is called a mandala.

original: la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dum bu bcu gnyis la bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi 'khor lo ji ltar bskor bar mdzad ce na /
analyzed: la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dum bu bcu gnyis la bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi 'khor lo ji ltar bskor bar mdzad ce na /
translated: In those and other such natures, the Blessed One turned the wheel of Dharma in twelve parts.

original: gcig gnyis gsum dang rgya mtsho mda' dang skye bo'i byed pa lnga dang 'jig rten la sogs pa'i dbye bas /
analyzed: gcig gnyis gsum dang rgya mtsho mda' dang skye bo'i byed pa lnga dang 'jig rten la sogs pa'i dbye bas /
translated: In one, two, three, ocean, arrow, five activities of beings, world, and so on,

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa gcig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa gcig go //
translated: This is the one that has become the nature of nondual wisdom.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: It becomes two by the division of method and wisdom.

original: rdo rje gsum gyi dbye bas rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi dbye bas rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: It is three by the division of the three vajras.

original: ye shes dang lhan cig tu rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang lhan cig tu rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: It is four by the division of wisdom and the deity.

original: phung po lnga rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnam pa lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po lnga rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnam pa lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: It becomes five by the purification of the five aggregates.

original: ye shes kyi phung po dang lhan cig tu rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: ye shes kyi phung po dang lhan cig tu rnam pa drug go //
translated: It is six by the division of the five aggregates and the four elements.

original: phung po lnga dang khams bzhi'i dbye bas rnam pa dgu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //🔽dbye ba 'di dag la sogs pas tha dad par gyur pa'i mi dbang 'khor lo can ni sa rnams 'khor te /
analyzed: phung po lnga dang khams bzhi'i dbye bas rnam pa dgu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o // dbye ba 'di dag la sogs pas tha dad par gyur pa'i mi dbang 'khor lo can ni sa rnams 'khor te /
translated: It is nine by the division of the five aggregates and the four elements.

original: de ni mkhas pas btsal bar bya zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni mkhas pas btsal bar bya zhes bya ba la /
translated: The wise should search for that Cakravartin, who is different from these divisions and so on, and who turns the stages.

original: mi dbang 'khor lo can zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: mi dbang 'khor lo can zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: Cakravartin means

original: bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo yin la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo yin la /
translated: the Bhagavān Kālacakra.

original: sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis gcig la sogs pa'i dbye ba tha dad par gyur pas na /
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis gcig la sogs pa'i dbye ba tha dad par gyur pas na /
translated: Since the divisions of one and so on are differentiated by the power of the thoughts of sentient beings,

original: sems can la phan gdags pa'i don du sa'i dum bu bcu gnyis la nyin mtshan du 'khor bar mdzad de /🔽bcom ldan 'das de nyid phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir /
