analyzed: sems can la phan gdags pa'i don du sa'i dum bu bcu gnyis la nyin mtshan du 'khor bar mdzad de / bcom ldan 'das de nyid phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to benefit sentient beings, he moves day and night on the twelve divisions of the earth.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis btsal bar bya'o //
translated: That Bhagavān should be sought by the wise in order to attain the spiritual powers of the great seal.

original: da ni mu stegs pa'i skad kyis bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyi mtshan brjod par mdzad de /
analyzed: da ni mu stegs pa'i skad kyis bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyi mtshan brjod par mdzad de /
translated: Now, the name of that Bhagavān is expressed in the language of the tīrthikas:

original: 'khor lo can dang gnyis min dum bu yul gyi mi bdag lag pa'i rgya ldan de dang de las gzhan //
analyzed: 'khor lo can dang gnyis min dum bu yul gyi mi bdag lag pa'i rgya ldan de dang de las gzhan //
translated: The one with a wheel, the nondual, the one with a piece, the lord of the land, the one with a hand seal, and the one other than that.

original: zhes bya ba ni khyab 'jug gi ming gang yin pa de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor lo can dang gnyis min dang dum bu can dang rgyal po phyag rgya dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan bzung nas sems can gyi don mdzad do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyab 'jug gi ming gang yin pa de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor lo can dang gnyis min dang dum bu can dang rgyal po phyag rgya dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan bzung nas sems can gyi don mdzad do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is to say, the Blessed One, under the names of Visnu, Dvaipāyana, Śākalya, and King Mudrādhara, has worked for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: phyi rol dus kyi dbye ba ji ltar nges par 'gyur te 'jig rten mgon gyi de bzhin no //
analyzed: phyi rol dus kyi dbye ba ji ltar nges par 'gyur te 'jig rten mgon gyi de bzhin no //
translated: How is the external division of time to be understood? Just so, of the world-protector.

original: zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: This is to say,

original: phyi rol du dus kyi dbye bas lo dang bgrod pa la sogs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis dbye ba gcig dang gnyis la sogs pas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du dus kyi dbye bas lo dang bgrod pa la sogs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis dbye ba gcig dang gnyis la sogs pas shes par bya'o //
translated: just as the external division of time is to be understood by means of years, seasons, and so on, so too the Blessed One is to be understood by means of the divisions of one, two, and so on.

original: gzhan yang 'od zer bdun dang gza' ni ri ste de bzhin thub pa snying stobs lha yi skye gnas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'od zer bdun dang gza' ni ri ste de bzhin thub pa snying stobs lha yi skye gnas so //
translated: Moreover, the seven rays, the planets, the mountains, and the sages are the abodes of sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is to say,

original: mu stegs @135b pa'i skad dang mthun par mdzad de de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: mu stegs @135b pa'i skad dang mthun par mdzad de de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: the Blessed One has acted in accordance with the language of the tīrthikas. And why?

original: dang po de rnams kyi bsam pa ma zin gyi bar du de rnams 'dul bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang po de rnams kyi bsam pa ma zin gyi bar du de rnams 'dul bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first is that they are not subdued until their thoughts are subdued.

original: de'i phyir drang srong bdun dang gang zag bdun dang thub pa rnams ni dge ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa lha'i rigs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir drang srong bdun dang gang zag bdun dang thub pa rnams ni dge ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa lha'i rigs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the seven sages and the seven individuals and the sages are the divine class that has become the nature of virtue.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: nya dang rus sbal lag pa mi yi seng ge dang bcas mi'u thung gshin rje me yi bu //
analyzed: nya dang rus sbal lag pa mi yi seng ge dang bcas mi'u thung gshin rje me yi bu //
translated: the fish, tortoise, hand, human lion, dwarf, Yama, and Agni’s son,

original: ra ma de bzhin nag po brgyad de lha min rigs la 'jig rten rdul ni 'byung po'i skye gnas so //
analyzed: ra ma de bzhin nag po brgyad de lha min rigs la 'jig rten rdul ni 'byung po'i skye gnas so //
translated: the goat, and similarly, the eight black ones are the asura class. The worldly dust is the source of beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni nya la sogs pa'i sprul pa brgyad ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i lha ma yin gyi rigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nya la sogs pa'i sprul pa brgyad ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i lha ma yin gyi rigs zhes bya'o //
translated: The eight emanations of the fish and so on are the asura class that has become the nature of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: nyi shu rtsa gnyis ldan gyi mtha' ru lha min dgra ni phyag na 'khor lo tshe lo brgya par 'gyur //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gnyis ldan gyi mtha' ru lha min dgra ni phyag na 'khor lo tshe lo brgya par 'gyur //
translated: At the end of the twenty-two, the asura enemy, Cakra in his hand, will live one hundred years.

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dang / khro bo'i rgyal po nyi shu rtsa gsum gyi mthar kla klo'i chos bcom par mdzad pa'i bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyi sprul pa'i skur bzhengs nas sangs rgyas kyi chos dar bar mdzad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dang / khro bo'i rgyal po nyi shu rtsa gsum gyi mthar kla klo'i chos bcom par mdzad pa'i bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyi sprul pa'i skur bzhengs nas sangs rgyas kyi chos dar bar mdzad ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is the Bodhisattva, and the twenty-three wrathful kings. At the end, the Blessed One, having arisen in the nirmāṇakāya of Mañjuśrī, who conquers the barbarian dharma, causes the Buddha's teachings to flourish.

original: kla klo'i chos sus dar bar byed ce na /
analyzed: kla klo'i chos sus dar bar byed ce na /
translated: Who causes the barbarian dharma to spread?

original: phyed dang rlabs min phag pa lha min dang ni lo yi rigs ni gzhan rnams mun pa lnga //
analyzed: phyed dang rlabs min phag pa lha min dang ni lo yi rigs ni gzhan rnams mun pa lnga //
translated: Not half or wave, but pig, asura, and other zodiacs are the five dark ones.

original: byi ba 'di dang dkar po'i gos can sprang bdag sprul pa gang zhig brgyad pa de ni long ba yin //
analyzed: byi ba 'di dang dkar po'i gos can sprang bdag sprul pa gang zhig brgyad pa de ni long ba yin //
translated: This mouse and the one in white clothes, the king of beggars, the eighth emanation, is the blind one.

original: gsal bar ma ga'i yul gyi ngag sbyin la sogs grong khyer du ni bdun pa yang dag 'gyur //
analyzed: gsal bar ma ga'i yul gyi ngag sbyin la sogs grong khyer du ni bdun pa yang dag 'gyur //
translated: Clearly, in the city of Magadha, the seventh will be given, and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is

original: mu stegs pa'i ming 'di dag la sogs pa rnams kyis lha ma yin gyi chos 'di dar bar byed do //
analyzed: mu stegs pa'i ming 'di dag la sogs pa rnams kyis lha ma yin gyi chos 'di dar bar byed do //
translated: These and other names of tīrthikas spread this asura dharma.

original: 'di rnams kyi nang du dkar po'i gos can zhes bya ba ni ma ha ma ya na yin te /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi nang du dkar po'i gos can zhes bya ba ni ma ha ma ya na yin te /
translated: Among these, the one called “clad in white” is a Mahāyānist.

original: des ma ga'i yul la sogs pa'i grong khyer du lha ma yin la sogs pa'i chos dar bar byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: des ma ga'i yul la sogs pa'i grong khyer du lha ma yin la sogs pa'i chos dar bar byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: He causes the Dharma of the asuras and so on to flourish in the cities of Magadha and so on.

original: yul de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: yul de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of that land?

original: gang du 'jig rten lha min rigs dang stobs ldan snying rje dang bral kla klo'i rnam pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang du 'jig rten lha min rigs dang stobs ldan snying rje dang bral kla klo'i rnam pa yin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is a land where the asuras, powerful, pitiless barbarians, are the people.

original: yul de la gnas pa'i mi rnams kyi spyod pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: yul de la gnas pa'i mi rnams kyi spyod pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the conduct of the people who live in that land?

original: rnga mo rta dang ba lang bsad nas khrag dang bcas pa dag ni btsos pa cung zad do //🔽ba lang sha dang dngul chu mar dang tsha ba dang mnyam lo ma 'bras dang bsres /
analyzed: rnga mo rta dang ba lang bsad nas khrag dang bcas pa dag ni btsos pa cung zad do // ba lang sha dang dngul chu mar dang tsha ba dang mnyam lo ma 'bras dang bsres /
translated: They kill camels, horses, and cows, and eat them raw with blood, or a little cooked.🔽They mix cow meat with mercury, clarified butter, and salt, with leaves and rice,

original: gcig tu mes btsos nags kyi 'bras bu dang bcas gang du mi rnams kyis ni zas //
analyzed: gcig tu mes btsos nags kyi 'bras bu dang bcas gang du mi rnams kyis ni zas //
translated: and eat it all together, cooked by fire, with forest fruits.

original: btung ba mkha' 'gro'i sgo ngar gyur te lha ma yin gyi de gnas mi @136a * //
analyzed: btung ba mkha' 'gro'i sgo ngar gyur te lha ma yin gyi de gnas mi @136a * //
translated: The drink is the egg of the ḍākinīs. That is the land of the asuras.

original: dbang kye // zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la sogs pa'i spyod pa gang rnams kyis byed pa mi rnams dge ba dang bral ba'i kla klo yin gyi /
analyzed: dbang kye // zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la sogs pa'i spyod pa gang rnams kyis byed pa mi rnams dge ba dang bral ba'i kla klo yin gyi /
translated: The word “and” indicates that those who engage in such conduct are devoid of virtue and are barbarians.

original: 'phags pa'i skye bo rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i skye bo rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not āryas.🔽What kind of emanations are they?

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: The Bhagavān says:

original: thig le nus ma mig sman mkha' lding lha yi chu bo mis sbyin 'dod 'jo dang / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thig le nus ma mig sman mkha' lding lha yi chu bo mis sbyin 'dod 'jo dang / zhes bya ba la /
translated: The drop, the powerful one, the eye medicine, the garuḍa, the divine river, the human, the giver, the wish-fulfilling cow, and the wish-fulfilling tree.

original: thig le zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'o //
analyzed: thig le zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'o //
translated: The drop is the Bhagavān’s body.

original: nus ma zhes bya ba ni shes rab ma'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nus ma zhes bya ba ni shes rab ma'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
translated: The powerful one is the nature of wisdom.

original: de bzhin mig sman dang mkha' lding dang / lha'i chu bo zhes bya ba ni chu bo gang+g'a dang / mi sbyin zhes bya ba ni drang srong rnams kyi nang nas khyad par du gyur pa'i mi sbyin thub pa dang / 'dod 'jo dang gdug par gyur pa'i mi rnams kyis bshig par mi nus pa'i rdzong dang /
analyzed: de bzhin mig sman dang mkha' lding dang / lha'i chu bo zhes bya ba ni chu bo gang+g'a dang / mi sbyin zhes bya ba ni drang srong rnams kyi nang nas khyad par du gyur pa'i mi sbyin thub pa dang / 'dod 'jo dang gdug par gyur pa'i mi rnams kyis bshig par mi nus pa'i rdzong dang /
translated: Likewise, the eye ointment, the garuḍa, and the divine river, which is the river Ganges, and the one called “the giver of men,” which is the sage who is the most excellent of the sages, the giver of men, and the fortress that cannot be destroyed by men who are lustful and violent.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gyur ba'i klog dang / rig pa bzang po zhes bya ba ni nang gi rig pa dang / mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba dang / chu zla bzhin du sprul pa'i sku dang / mgrin pa la sogs las skyes par gyur pa'i a'a li dang k'a li'i yi ge rnams dang bral ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad kyis de bzhin gshegs pas sems can la phan gdags par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gyur ba'i klog dang / rig pa bzang po zhes bya ba ni nang gi rig pa dang / mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba dang / chu zla bzhin du sprul pa'i sku dang / mgrin pa la sogs las skyes par gyur pa'i a'a li dang k'a li'i yi ge rnams dang bral ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i skad kyis de bzhin gshegs pas sems can la phan gdags par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The reading that has the nature of nondual wisdom, and the good knowledge, which is the inner knowledge, and the supreme unchanging bliss, and the emanation body that is like the reflection of the moon in water, and the knowledge of all things that is free from the letters ā and kā that arise from the throat and so on, the Tathāgata benefits sentient beings with that speech.

original: de nyid bshad par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid bshad par mdzad de /
translated: He explains that:

original: kun spyod 'di rnams gzugs kyis rgyal ba'i ye shes sku ni sa la mngon par 'jug / ces bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i thabs dka' 'di la sogs pa rnams kyis las kyi sar gshegs so //
analyzed: kun spyod 'di rnams gzugs kyis rgyal ba'i ye shes sku ni sa la mngon par 'jug / ces bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i thabs dka' 'di la sogs pa rnams kyis las kyi sar gshegs so //
translated: This is the method of the nature of the coemergent body, which is difficult to accomplish.

original: der byon nas ci mdzad ce na /
analyzed: der byon nas ci mdzad ce na /
translated: What does he do after arriving there?

original: 'das dang ma 'ongs da ltar byung dang rig byed rtog ge la sogs bstan bcos ma lus ston //
analyzed: 'das dang ma 'ongs da ltar byung dang rig byed rtog ge la sogs bstan bcos ma lus ston //
translated: He teaches all treatises, such as the Vedas, logic, and so on, of the past, present, and future.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i don ni sems can rnams sangs rgyas par mdzad nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i don ni sems can rnams sangs rgyas par mdzad nas /
translated: The meaning of the past, future, and so on is that after he has caused sentient beings to become buddhas,

original: skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i sems can rnams la mu stegs pa'i blos rig byed la sogs pa bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i sems can rnams la mu stegs pa'i blos rig byed la sogs pa bstan par mdzad de /
translated: he teaches the treatises of the tīrthikas, such as the Vedas, to sentient beings who are not fortunate.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i blo ni rnon por gyur pa'i mi rnams la rtog ge dang bstan bcos la sogs pa bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i blo ni rnon por gyur pa'i mi rnams la rtog ge dang bstan bcos la sogs pa bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Similarly, he teaches logic, treatises, and so on to humans whose worldly minds are sharp.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub la snod du rung bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams la thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i don bstan par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub la snod du rung bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams la thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i don bstan par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
translated: He teaches the meaning that is the nature of method and wisdom to sentient beings who are suitable vessels for unsurpassed awakening.

original: de ltar bcom ldan @136b 'das kyis nyid kyi mtshan nyid bshad par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan @136b 'das kyis nyid kyi mtshan nyid bshad par mdzad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained his own characteristics,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa rnams la nges par gnas par mdzad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa rnams la nges par gnas par mdzad de /
translated: the Blessed One established the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi and others.

original: dpal ldan ka l'a par ni nyin mtshan cung zad rnams kyis shambhala zhes grags pa'i mi dbang kye //
analyzed: dpal ldan ka l'a par ni nyin mtshan cung zad rnams kyis shambhala zhes grags pa'i mi dbang kye //
translated: O Lord of Men, in the glorious Kalāpa, in the slightly day and night, in the famous Śambhala,

original: phyogs bzhir ris bskor ro yis brgya phrag dag ni bgrangs pa dpag tshad tsam /🔽rang gi gnas su mi mchog bdag po lha dbang bkod nas khyod ni 'gro bar gyis //
analyzed: phyogs bzhir ris bskor ro yis brgya phrag dag ni bgrangs pa dpag tshad tsam / rang gi gnas su mi mchog bdag po lha dbang bkod nas khyod ni 'gro bar gyis //
translated: encircled by a hundred sectors, counted as a hundred yojanas in the four directions,

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: having placed the supreme human lord, the lord of gods, in his own abode, you should go.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag na rdo rje la nges pa ji lta ba bzhin du gnang zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag na rdo rje la nges pa ji lta ba bzhin du gnang zhe na /
translated: How did the Blessed One give instructions to Vajrapāṇi?

original: dpag tshad lnga brgya'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyogs thams cad du ris bskor ba yul shambhala zhes bya ba gang yin pa de /
analyzed: dpag tshad lnga brgya'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyogs thams cad du ris bskor ba yul shambhala zhes bya ba gang yin pa de /
translated: The land called Shambhala, which is five hundred yojanas in extent and surrounded on all sides by mountain ranges,

original: phyag na rdo rje khyod kyis sems can la phan thogs la byang chub sems dpa' sa'i snying po'i sprul pa lha'i dbang po ni sangs rgyas kyi chos dang bar bya ba'i phyir bzhag nas sprul pa nyid kyis gang nas 'dos pa de nyid du sangs shig ces bya
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje khyod kyis sems can la phan thogs la byang chub sems dpa' sa'i snying po'i sprul pa lha'i dbang po ni sangs rgyas kyi chos dang bar bya ba'i phyir bzhag nas sprul pa nyid kyis gang nas 'dos pa de nyid du sangs shig ces bya
translated: O Vajrapani, you should benefit sentient beings and, having placed the emanation of the Bodhisattva Kshitigarbha, the lord of gods, in order to purify the Buddha's teachings, you should dissolve right there where you emanated.

original: ba'o // de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: ba'o // de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje nas brtsams nas /
translated: In the same way, beginning with the Bodhisattva Vajrapani,

original: khro bo'i rgyal po padma mthar byed kyi bar du byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo bdun gyis yul shambhala gnas pa'i sems can rnams la rtsa ba'i rgyud bstan par mdzad do //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po padma mthar byed kyi bar du byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo bdun gyis yul shambhala gnas pa'i sems can rnams la rtsa ba'i rgyud bstan par mdzad do //
translated: up to the wrathful king Padmantakrshna, the seven Bodhisattvas and wrathful ones taught the root tantra to the sentient beings dwelling in the land of Shambhala.

original: brgyad pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal te /
analyzed: brgyad pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal te /
translated: The eighth is the Blessed One Manjushri.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He himself said:

original: dpal ldan sh'akya'i rigs la gsal bar mi dbang bdun te dpal ldan grags pa brgyad //
analyzed: dpal ldan sh'akya'i rigs la gsal bar mi dbang bdun te dpal ldan grags pa brgyad //
translated: The seven lords of men in the glorious Śākya clan, and the glorious Aśoka.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: And how is that?

original: de 'di dpal ldan 'jam pa'i rdo rje lha mchog gis btud rdo rje rigs kyis rigs ldan no //
analyzed: de 'di dpal ldan 'jam pa'i rdo rje lha mchog gis btud rdo rje rigs kyis rigs ldan no //
translated: The glorious Mañjuvajra, the supreme deity, bowed to the vajra clan, the one of the clan.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: des ci mdzad ce na /
analyzed: des ci mdzad ce na /
translated: And what did he do?

original: rdo rje'i dbang ni bskur nas ma lus thub pa'i rigs rnams rigs gcig dag tu byed //
analyzed: rdo rje'i dbang ni bskur nas ma lus thub pa'i rigs rnams rigs gcig dag tu byed //
translated: Having bestowed the vajra empowerment, he made all the clans of sages into one clan.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i dbang ni nyi ma'i shing rta la sogs pa'i bram ze drang srong bye ba phrag phyed dang bzhi la gnang nas /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i dbang ni nyi ma'i shing rta la sogs pa'i bram ze drang srong bye ba phrag phyed dang bzhi la gnang nas /
translated: Having bestowed the empowerments of the vase and so forth to four and a half million brahmin sages such as Sūryarathin,

original: bram ze'i rigs la sogs pa rigs bzhi po ni rigs gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs la sogs pa rigs bzhi po ni rigs gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba'o //
translated: he made the four clans such as the brahmin clan into one clan. Thus it is said.

original: gzhan yang ci mdzad ce na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ci mdzad ce na /
translated: And what else did he do?

original: yang dag ye shes mngon gnas lha min rigs la 'jigs tsher dpal ldan grags pa lag na mdung //
analyzed: yang dag ye shes mngon gnas lha min rigs la 'jigs tsher dpal ldan grags pa lag na mdung //
translated: The glorious Aśoka, the spear-wielding one, in the asura clan, the abode of perfect wisdom, the terrifying one.

original: sems can thar ba'i rgyu ru dus kyi 'khor lo sa la gsal por byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can thar ba'i rgyu ru dus kyi 'khor lo sa la gsal por byed par 'gyur //
translated: He will make the Kālacakra clear on earth as the cause of the liberation of sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni /🔽sems can rnams @137a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni / sems can rnams @137a * //
translated: This is the prophecy of the Bhagavān.

original: la phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: la phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to attain the mahāmudrā siddhi for sentient beings,

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal ldan dus kyi 'khor lo mdzad par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya bar bcom ldan 'das kyis lung bstan to //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal ldan dus kyi 'khor lo mdzad par 'gyur // zhes bya bar bcom ldan 'das kyis lung bstan to //
translated: he will compose the glorious Kālacakra, the king of condensed tantras.

original: gzhan yang de dbus nyi shu rtsa lnga rim pas yongs su bgrangs pa'i gdan rnams dus kyi mtha' ru'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dbus nyi shu rtsa lnga rim pas yongs su bgrangs pa'i gdan rnams dus kyi mtha' ru'o //
translated: Moreover, in the center of the twenty-five seats counted in sequence, at the end of time,

original: rigs ldan rigs la lha dbang lha yi mchog gis phyag byas rigs ldan drag por 'gyur //
analyzed: rigs ldan rigs la lha dbang lha yi mchog gis phyag byas rigs ldan drag por 'gyur //
translated: the powerful god, the supreme god, will pay homage to the kṣatriya, and the kṣatriya will become Rudra.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the prophecy of the Bhagavān.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyi rigs las dus kyi dbang gis rigs ldan drag po lha'i dbang po'i mtshan bzung nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyi rigs las dus kyi dbang gis rigs ldan drag po lha'i dbang po'i mtshan bzung nas /
translated: From the family of the Bhagavān Mañjuśrī, by the power of time, the kṣatriya Rudra will take the name of the lord of gods and

original: sprul pa'i skur bzhengs par mdzad ces bya ba'o ;
analyzed: sprul pa'i skur bzhengs par mdzad ces bya ba'o ;
translated: will manifest as an emanation body.

original: / de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: / de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: mkhas rnams la ni zhi ba'i gzugs te de bzhin kla klo'i rigs ni mtha' ru byed //
analyzed: mkhas rnams la ni zhi ba'i gzugs te de bzhin kla klo'i rigs ni mtha' ru byed //
translated: The wise will have the form of peace, and the barbarians will be put to the border.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is what it says.

original: des ci mdzad ce na /
analyzed: des ci mdzad ce na /
translated: What will he do?

original: ri yi rtar zhon lag na mdung ste nyi ma'i 'od la 'khor lo can gyi stobs ldan dgra bcom mo //
analyzed: ri yi rtar zhon lag na mdung ste nyi ma'i 'od la 'khor lo can gyi stobs ldan dgra bcom mo //
translated: Riding on the mountain horse, with a spear in his hand, the powerful one with a wheel on his banner will conquer the barbarians.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'khor dang bcas pa'i kla klo rnams bcom par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'khor dang bcas pa'i kla klo rnams bcom par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
translated: This means that he will conquer the barbarians along with their retinue.

original: 'khrug pa'i dus de rnams nam gyi dus 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i dus de rnams nam gyi dus 'gyur zhe na /
translated: At what time will that age of conflict occur?

original: rigs ldan rigs kyi nang du lag pas dus bgrangs bu dang tsha ba'i 'dus pa las //
analyzed: rigs ldan rigs kyi nang du lag pas dus bgrangs bu dang tsha ba'i 'dus pa las //
translated: When the Kṣatriya counts the time with his hand in the family, the union of the son and the uncle

original: de dus nges par ma ga'i yul du kla klo'i chos ni rab tu 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: de dus nges par ma ga'i yul du kla klo'i chos ni rab tu 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: at that time, the barbarian religion will certainly spread in the land of Magadha.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what it says.

original: rigs ldan zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal yin la /
analyzed: rigs ldan zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal yin la /
translated: The Kṣatriya is the Blessed One Mañjuśrī.

original: de mya ngan las 'das par lo brgyad brgya nas ma ga dha'i yul du kla klo'i chos dar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de mya ngan las 'das par lo brgyad brgya nas ma ga dha'i yul du kla klo'i chos dar bar 'gyur te /
translated: Eight hundred years after his parinirvāṇa, the barbarian religion will spread in the land of Magadha.

original: kla klo'i chos dar bar gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kla klo'i chos dar bar gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the barbarian religion will have spread,

original: yul du 'khrug pa 'byung zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul du 'khrug pa 'byung zhes bya ba'o //
translated: there will be war in the country.

original: gang dang 'khrug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang dang 'khrug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: With whom will there be war?

original: ji srid lha min dbang po gdugs dang lha yi phyag rgyas drag po'i rigs ldan ji srid do //
analyzed: ji srid lha min dbang po gdugs dang lha yi phyag rgyas drag po'i rigs ldan ji srid do //
translated: As long as the lord of the demigods and the Kṣatriya of the violent gods,

original: de dus nges par sa steng gnas su gnyis pa drag po'i 'thab mor 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: de dus nges par sa steng gnas su gnyis pa drag po'i 'thab mor 'gyur ba yin //
translated: for that long there will be a second war of the violent on the surface of the earth.

original: zhes bya ba ni lha ma yin gyi gtso bo dang rigs ldan dang 'thab par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lha ma yin gyi gtso bo dang rigs ldan dang 'thab par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This means that there will be a war between the chief of the demigods and the Kṣatriya.

original: rigs ldan gyis kla klo rnams ji ltar bcom zhe na ;
analyzed: rigs ldan gyis kla klo rnams ji ltar bcom zhe na ;
translated: How will the Kṣatriya destroy the barbarians?

original: g-yul du lha min rnams ni ma lus sa gnas yan lag bzhi yi rang gi sdes bcom mo //
analyzed: g-yul du lha min rnams ni ma lus sa gnas yan lag bzhi yi rang gi sdes bcom mo //
translated: In battle, the demigods, all on the earth, were defeated by their own four-limbed army.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what it says.

original: yan lag bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The four limbs are

original: rta dang glang po che dang shing rta dang rkang thang ste /
analyzed: rta dang glang po che dang shing rta dang rkang thang ste /
translated: horses, elephants, chariots, and infantry.

original: sde de rnams kyis bcom par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sde de rnams kyis bcom par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
translated: It says that they were defeated by those armies.

original: de gang nas byon zhe na /
analyzed: de gang nas byon zhe na /
translated: Where did they come from?

original: dus kyi mtha' @137b ru ke la sha rir lha mdzes gnas nas 'khor los sgyur bar 'byung //
analyzed: dus kyi mtha' @137b ru ke la sha rir lha mdzes gnas nas 'khor los sgyur bar 'byung //
translated: At the end of time, from the abode of Bhadrā in Kailash, he will appear as a world-emperor.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is said.

original: ke la sha ri nas 'khor los sgyur ba'i sprul ba las byon par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ke la sha ri nas 'khor los sgyur ba'i sprul ba las byon par gyur pa'o //
translated: From Kailash, he will appear as an emanation of a world-emperor.

original: de'i 'khor ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'khor ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What will his retinue be like?

original: drag po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rkang pa gnyis kyis khyad par du gyur pa'i 'khor gsungs so //
analyzed: drag po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rkang pa gnyis kyis khyad par du gyur pa'i 'khor gsungs so //
translated: With the two lines beginning with “violent,” he speaks of a special retinue.

original: spyi'i 'khor du zhe na /
analyzed: spyi'i 'khor du zhe na /
translated: If we ask what his general retinue will be like,

original: rlung shugs shing rta yon tan gyis bgrangs yon tan bye ba kha dog sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: rlung shugs shing rta yon tan gyis bgrangs yon tan bye ba kha dog sna tshogs pa //
translated: [the text says:] “The wind-swift chariots, enumerated by their qualities, have a hundred thousand different colors.”

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is said.

original: rta rnams kha dog sna tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i bye ba phrag dgu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rta rnams kha dog sna tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i bye ba phrag dgu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The horses have nine hundred thousand different colors.

original: de bzhin du myos par gyur pa'i glang po che 'bum phrag bzhi dang / shing rta 'bum phrag lnga dang / rkang thang sa ya phrag drug dang / cod pan bcings pa'i rgyal po dgu bcu rtsa drug ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du myos par gyur pa'i glang po che 'bum phrag bzhi dang / shing rta 'bum phrag lnga dang / rkang thang sa ya phrag drug dang / cod pan bcings pa'i rgyal po dgu bcu rtsa drug ces bya ba ste /
translated: Likewise, there are four hundred thousand intoxicated elephants, five hundred thousand chariots, six million infantry, and ninety-six kings with bound topknots.

original: 'khor gyi bye brag brjod do //
analyzed: 'khor gyi bye brag brjod do //
translated: These are the various types of retinue.

original: 'khor des ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'khor des ci bya zhe na /
translated: What do they do with that retinue?

original: sde 'di nyid kyis seng ge drag po dang bcas rigs dang ldan pas kla klo nyams par byed //
analyzed: sde 'di nyid kyis seng ge drag po dang bcas rigs dang ldan pas kla klo nyams par byed //
translated: This very army, together with fierce Siṃha, destroys the barbarians with its lineage.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is what it says.

original: ji ltar nyams par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar nyams par byed ce na /
translated: How does it destroy?

original: mchog tu nyam nga'i 'thab mo yis ni kla klo'i tshogs bcom glang chen dbang pos glang chen no //
analyzed: mchog tu nyam nga'i 'thab mo yis ni kla klo'i tshogs bcom glang chen dbang pos glang chen no //
translated: The army of barbarians is destroyed by the supreme terrifying battle, the elephants by the lord of elephants.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what it says.

original: rigs ldan pa'i rkang thang rnams 'joms pa dang / rta rnams kyis rta dang / glang po che rnams kyis glang po che dang / rgyal po rnams kyis rgyal po rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs ldan pa'i rkang thang rnams 'joms pa dang / rta rnams kyis rta dang / glang po che rnams kyis glang po che dang / rgyal po rnams kyis rgyal po rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The infantry of the dynasty destroys the infantry, the horses destroy the horses, the elephants destroy the elephants, and the kings destroy the kings.

original: de bzhin du drag pos rta bstan la sogs pa'i kla klo'i rgyal po rnams bcom par byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du drag pos rta bstan la sogs pa'i kla klo'i rgyal po rnams bcom par byed de /
translated: In the same way, the Kṣatriya will destroy the barbarian kings who are the teachers of horses, and so on.

original: rigs ldan gyis kla klo'i dbang phyug bcom par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs ldan gyis kla klo'i dbang phyug bcom par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The Kṣatriya will destroy the barbarian lord.

original: phyi nas rigs ldan gyis ci mdzad ce na /🔽g-yul du kla klo bcom nas seng ge dang ni khyab 'jug dang bcas thams cad sde dang rigs ldan pa ;
analyzed: phyi nas rigs ldan gyis ci mdzad ce na / g-yul du kla klo bcom nas seng ge dang ni khyab 'jug dang bcas thams cad sde dang rigs ldan pa ;
translated: What will the Kṣatriya do after that?🔽Having destroyed the barbarians in battle, he will go with the lion and Viṣṇu to Kailāśa, where the Cakrin will be, together with his retinue.

original: ke la sha rir 'gro ste lha mdzes gnas ni gang du 'khor lo can ni yang dag bzhugs /🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ke la sha rir 'gro ste lha mdzes gnas ni gang du 'khor lo can ni yang dag bzhugs / zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Where will the Cakrin be?

original: 'khor dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo'i spyan sngar gshegs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo'i spyan sngar gshegs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He will go to the place of Ratideva, where the Cakrin will be.

original: kla klo'i chos bcom pa dang sangs rgyas kyi drin gyis sems can rnams ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: kla klo'i chos bcom pa dang sangs rgyas kyi drin gyis sems can rnams ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What will happen to the sentient beings by the destruction of the barbarian religion and by the grace of the Buddha?

original: de dus sa la ma lus skye bo'i rigs ni chos dang 'dod pa nor gyis gang //
analyzed: de dus sa la ma lus skye bo'i rigs ni chos dang 'dod pa nor gyis gang //
translated: At that time, the entire human race will be filled with dharma, desire, and wealth.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What will happen to the barbarians?

original: mi dge ba'i las dor nas sems can thams cad bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las dor nas sems can thams cad bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: Having abandoned unwholesome actions, all sentient beings have become endowed with the accumulations of merit and wisdom.
